(data analytics and ai services) | INGETEAM, S.A.(energy) | GOIZPER S.COOP. (machine-tool industry) | MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY S.COOP. (manufacturing) | UBIKARE ZAINKETAK, S.L. (healthcare) | EROSKI S.COOP (retail) | The technology coordinator is IKERLAN (a leading knowledge transfer center providing competitive value to companies) SUCCESS: Seeks to promote and research the necessary technology for the definition of a reference architecture, operational models, adoption of standard and development for a data space based on the common technical framework proposed by DSBA members, extending it main service to favor the development of artificial intelligence with guarantee of traceability, security, and governance of the data and services. BENEFITS: Aims to provide the country with a reliable data space that enables company to offer new concept of high-added value service based on data sharing, through the servitization of collaborative artificial intelligence for the productization and monetization of their data and industry knowledge in new business models. COMPONENTS: Will develop new service in the field of artificial intelligence and will explore current IDS component implementation (focusing on Connectors, Metadatabroker, and IdentityProviders) in order to select one of them to rely on. LEARN MORE: MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY EGOKIA MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY - an international firm specializing in the development of automatization and assembly solution for various sectors. It operates 6 production plant around the world and is part of the largest cooperative group in the world | IKERLAN Technical research center and member of IDSA CHALLENGE: EGOKIA solution allows collaborative learning and knowledge sharing between geographically distributed plants, integrating headquarters in Basque Country and domain experts. Thanks to the data space, data, and AI asset can be securely shared throughout different corporate site and a new knowledge-based economy emerges. SUCCESS: Deploys an architecture based on IDSA connectors, linking Mondragon Assemblys data and AI platform from different corporate sites. With this new reliable data space, we extend the lifecycle of artificial intelligence models, enhance their capabilities, and facilitate trusted access and use of it asset by EGOKIA participants. BENEFITS: NEW BUSINESS MODEL: A new business model based on AI service and a knowledge-based economy. RELIABLE AI SOLUTIONS: A "standardized", flexible, and secure solution to break data silo to share and complete AI asset and process between trusted organization and production plants. Measurable benefit can be listed as: Up to 30% quality on model thanks to the application of federated learning techniques, reduce inversion and time to market on IA-based solution or lower communication loads. STANDARIZED DATA SPACE The organization is ready to take part in the knowledge economy with other entities, domain experts, and technology providers. COMPONENTS: Data Space connector 8.0.2 Metada Broker 5.0.3 Identity Provider 1.6.0 Gaia-X4KI A sovereign data and service ecosystem for artificial intelligence in automotive development, production, and operation DLR | T-Systems | Capgemini Engineering | Continental | IAV | Intel | Conweaver | HighQSoft | Reuschlaw | STTech | Fraunhofer ITWM | Fraunhofer ISST | Hochschule Offenburg | Leibniz Universitt Hannover | Technische Hochschule Ingolstadt CHALLENGE: Autonomous driving scenario and the industrial production of required device face a broad range of challenge related to data sovereignty and security. In particular, transfer of large, sensitive file and service in a policy-conform way are addressed in the prototypes. SUCCESS: The solution are cloud-based and are embedded in existing industrial cloud landscape to enhance data sovereignty of participant in complex data exchange relations. BENEFITS: Gaia-X4KI connects various stakeholder and their diverse system landscape from the complete autonomous driving development lifecycle. COMPONENTS: Eclipse Dataspace Components (EDC) and EDC MVD including Connector, Federated Catalog, Identity Hub, Registration Service PREREQUISITES: The data space is currently in development and being tested inside the project. It base on open source components. LEARN MORE: Introduction IKERLAN is a leading knowledge transfer technological centre providing competitive value to companies. We seek for excellence in R&D&i, thanks to the continuous adaptation to the need of our customer and the proximity with the business reality. Faithful to our mission, we have been working daily since 1974 to develop solution that allow our customer to become more and more competitive. We are a cooperative member of the MONDRAGON Corporation and the Basque Research and Technology Alliance (BRTA). Business Expertise Thanks to a unique cooperation model, which combine technology transfer activities, internal research and training of highly qualified personnel, IKERLAN is currently the trusted technological partner of major company in the country. To meet our goal, we are structured into two technological specialization units: ELECTRONICS, INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGIES ENERGY AND MECHATRONICS IKERLAN is a center that is dynamic and open to the world. We are an accredited agent of the Basque Network of Science, Technology, and Innovation and of the Spanish Federation of Technology Centres. We have a major cooperation network integrated with renowned European center and universities, with which we conduct activity of research and training of researchers. Technical Expertise Mission: To solve the technological challenge of the companies, improve their competitiveness and collaborate with the sustainable social and economic development of the environment, all of that from a position of technological leadership and with differential ability in their area of expertise. Vission: Technological center, cooperative and non-profit, known a the European leader in it area of specialization, with an exceptional cohesive human team, that provides value to the company and society. Contact Details Santiago Charramendieta Website Increased visibility of order delivery process VTT | Wrtsil | Uwira CHALLENGE: The use case revolves around expediting and enhancing transparency between a focal company of a manufacturing ecosystem (OEM) and it supplier in their production order management processes. The existing communication method have proven inadequate in facilitating efficient and adaptable exchange between the two entities. By facilitating transparency and fostering a more seamless integration between the IT system of both companies, the management of product order can be streamlined, resulting in heightened efficiency and a reduction in errors. SUCCESS: The objective is to facilitate a reliable and seamless flow of data between the OEM and it supplier by establishing a dedicated data space. The developed solution will be seamlessly integrated with pre-existing IT infrastructure of both company and the solution is grounded in the framework of the IDS reference architecture. The OEM can selectively disclose data from their production environment to the supplier without the fear of data leakages. Respectively, the supplier receives only the data that are essential for them and there is no need to locally extract meaningful insight and valuable information from big data sets. BENEFITS: The established data space solution ha the potential to significantly enhance transparency between the OEM and the supplier. This give rise to several potential benefits, including: Effective Communication: Transparent communication help in conveying accurate information about product specifications, requirements, changes, and timelines. Risk Management: Sharing information about potential risks, such a change in demand or design modifications, allows supplier to proactively address these issues. Furthermore, in time of disruptions, such a supply shortage or unexpected market shifts, transparent communication help both party respond more effectively. Cost Efficiency: Transparent communication allows both party to work together to find cost-effective solutions. COMPONENTS: IDS connector - serve a the communication interface linking the two company and their existing IT systems. With IDS connectors, a data provider can define the rule and condition (usage policies) under which data are shared with a data consumer. DAPS - enables connector to authenticate themselves using X.509 certificates. After successful authentication, the DAPS issue OAuth2 access token for connectors, who need these token to access the service and data of other connectors. Metadata Broker store information about the data end-points offered by the participants. The broker provides a query interface for connector and can hence be considered a the search engine in this use case. LEARN MORE: Donate Invest in the future Empower a secure digital future by supporting the International Data Spaces Association, a non-profit shaping sovereign and trustworthy data sharing across the globe. Support the International Data Spaces Association The International Data Spaces Association (IDSA) is a non-profit organization committed to establishing secure and sovereign data spaces. By conducting research and developing standard and guidelines, we ensure that individual and organization can control and share their data in a trusted environment. Our effort span Europe and beyond, aiming to foster trust and data sovereignty for all. As outlined in our statutes, IDSA is dedicated to advancing it objective for the public good, focusing solely on charitable pursuits. We ensure that all our technical specifications, content, and the knowledge we acquire are accessible to the public, reflecting our commitment to openness and community benefit. Why your support matter Despite the critical importance of our mission, IDSA face financial uncertainties. Our primary funding sourcesmembership fee and project revenuesare not always sufficient to sustain our high-quality initiative and to satisfy the growing need of the market. As such, we rely on raising additional budget through donation to continue and extend our work. How your donation help Your contribution directly support these designated activities: Eclipse Data Spaces Working Group coordination: Ensuring effective leadership and collaboration (EUR 60,000 per year). Global standardization efforts: Advancing international standard for data sharing (EUR 120,000 per year). Documentation professionalization: Enhancing the quality of our technical document (EUR 80,000 per year). Industry-wide study and publications: Offering insight for sovereign data sharing (EUR 80,000 per year). Advocacy for data sovereignty: Influencing research and funding agenda (EUR 80,000). Professional training program development: Preparing the industry for scalability (EUR 100,000 per year). Establishing an innovation fund for data space technologies: Supporting technological advancement and global scaling (EUR 80,000 per year). Internationalization and harmonization: Aligning with key global industry (EUR 175,000 per year). Data Spaces Now magazine production: Sharing our insight and progress (EUR 20,000 per year). How to contribute You can support our mission or specific initiative via bank transfer or GitHub. Your contribution is crucial in advancing secure data sharing and ensuring data sovereignty worldwide. For any large donation that require a donation receipt, please contact u directly at . Support u with your donation via bank transfer Please enter your full address on the bank transfer form so that we can send you a donation receipt once we have received your donation. International Data Spaces e.V.IBAN DE80 3607 0050 0799 0302 00BIC DEUTDEDEXXXDeutsche Bank AGReference: Donation Become a sponsor on GitHub If youre on GitHub, you can sponsor IDSA directly by making a donation. Any questions? Contact us! Your contact person:Thorsten HuelsmannCFO Become a member Benefit from all current developments: Become a member of the International Data Spaces Association now! LEARN MORE: Board An executive board like no other IDSAs secure, cross-sector solution for global data sharing is built, not only on a strong technical foundation, but also on a rock-solid foundation of leadership, with an executive board of top business and scientific leader drawn from multiple industry and perspectives. Founded in February 2016, the IDSA currently has14board membersrepresentingsome of the most respected organization in theworld.Learn more about them below. a Dr. Reinhold Achatz ChairUnity AG a Prof. Dr. Boris Otto Deputy Chair Fraunhofer ISST a Ulrich Ahle TreasurerGaia-X a Dario Avallone a Ute Burkhardt Volkswagen a Olivier Colas Microsoft a Christoph Gerkum Deutsche Telekom AG a Marcus Hartmann PwCGermany a Jesus de la Maza Innovalia Association a Sophie Proust Atos a Akira Sakaino NTT Communications a Niels Syassen SICK AG a Dr. AndrT. The broker provides a query interface for connector and can hence be considered a the search engine in this use case. LEARN MORE: Head Office Were from the head office and were here to help International data space may be virtual, but IDSAs head office is a real placebuzzingwhere essential operation happen,and where you can find your contact partners.Werelocated at theTechnologieZentrumDortmund. What we do here The head office responsibility include, but are not limited to: Memberengagement Internationalization Marketing and communication Organization and process Strategicplanningand government relation a Julien Adelberger Senior Project Coordinator Aynur Arslan-Bilgin Administration & Process Manager a Mariano Blaya Senior Program Manager a Silvia Castellvi Director Research & Standardization a Ilknur Chulani Senior Program Manager a Anna Derevianko Membership & Administration Manager a Domenic Franke Administration & Project Manager a Olga Galanets Senior Project Manager a Antoine Garnier Senior Consultant & Innovation Manager a Giulia Giussani Senior Digital Innovation Manager a Carlos Gonzlez Ecosystem Operations Manager a Nora Gras Senior Communications Manager Maurice Hagemann Administration & Project Management Dr. Mario Holesch Senior Consultant & Innovation Manager a Thorsten Huelsmann CFO a Susanne Immel Secretary of the Head Office a Sonia Jimenez Moreno Director Data Space Technology a Andreas Kembuegler Head of Marketing & Communications a Juri Kembuegler Web Content & Project Management a Kateryna Kot Community & Project Manager a Antonia Kuster Digital Communications Manager a Mara Fernanda Luna Lpez Project Management a Lars Nagel CEO a Christoph Mertens Head of Adoption a Mouna Oraij Project Management a Tobias Prasse Director Marketing & Communications a Jessica Rombs Project Management a Nafiseh Shadman Graphic Designer a Sebastian Steinbuss CTO a Shani Tiran Senior Consultant & Innovation Manager a Anil Turkmayali Senior Project Manager Any questions? Emil-Figge-Str. 80 44227 Dortmund, Germany Phone:+49 (0)231 70096 501 2016 2024 | All Rights Reserved | International Data Spaces Association | | | | Follow u Follow u Follow u Follow u Learn more aiXia aiXia" which will be led by LANTEK (digital services) together with the company LIS SOLUTIONS | S.L. (data analytics and ai services) | INGETEAM, S.A.(energy) | GOIZPER S.COOP. (machine-tool industry) | MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY S.COOP. (manufacturing) | UBIKARE ZAINKETAK, S.L. (healthcare) | EROSKI S.COOP (retail) | The technology coordinator is IKERLAN (a leading knowledge transfer center providing competitive value to companies) SUCCESS: Seeks to promote and research the necessary technology for the definition of a reference architecture, operational models, adoption of standard and development for a data space based on the common technical framework proposed by DSBA members, extending it main service to favor the development of artificial intelligence with guarantee of traceability, security, and governance of the data and services. BENEFITS: Aims to provide the country with a reliable data space that enables company to offer new concept of high-added value service based on data sharing, through the servitization of collaborative artificial intelligence for the productization and monetization of their data and industry knowledge in new business models. COMPONENTS: Will develop new service in the field of artificial intelligence and will explore current IDS component implementation (focusing on Connectors, Metadatabroker, and IdentityProviders) in order to select one of them to rely on. LEARN MORE: MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY EGOKIA MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY - an international firm specializing in the development of automatization and assembly solution for various sectors. It operates 6 production plant around the world and is part of the largest cooperative group in the world | IKERLAN Technical research center and member of IDSA CHALLENGE: EGOKIA solution allows collaborative learning and knowledge sharing between geographically distributed plants, integrating headquarters in Basque Country and domain experts. Thanks to the data space, data, and AI asset can be securely shared throughout different corporate site and a new knowledge-based economy emerges. SUCCESS: Deploys an architecture based on IDSA connectors, linking Mondragon Assemblys data and AI platform from different corporate sites. With this new reliable data space, we extend the lifecycle of artificial intelligence models, enhance their capabilities, and facilitate trusted access and use of it asset by EGOKIA participants. BENEFITS: NEW BUSINESS MODEL: A new business model based on AI service and a knowledge-based economy. RELIABLE AI SOLUTIONS: A "standardized", flexible, and secure solution to break data silo to share and complete AI asset and process between trusted organization and production plants. Measurable benefit can be listed as: Up to 30% quality on model thanks to the application of federated learning techniques, reduce inversion and time to market on IA-based solution or lower communication loads. STANDARIZED DATA SPACE The organization is ready to take part in the knowledge economy with other entities, domain experts, and technology providers. COMPONENTS: Data Space connector 8.0.2 Metada Broker 5.0.3 Identity Provider 1.6.0 Gaia-X4KI A sovereign data and service ecosystem for artificial intelligence in automotive development, production, and operation DLR | T-Systems | Capgemini Engineering | Continental | IAV | Intel | Conweaver | HighQSoft | Reuschlaw | STTech | Fraunhofer ITWM | Fraunhofer ISST | Hochschule Offenburg | Leibniz Universitt Hannover | Technische Hochschule Ingolstadt CHALLENGE: Autonomous driving scenario and the industrial production of required device face a broad range of challenge related to data sovereignty and security. In particular, transfer of large, sensitive file and service in a policy-conform way are addressed in the prototypes. SUCCESS: The solution are cloud-based and are embedded in existing industrial cloud landscape to enhance data sovereignty of participant in complex data exchange relations. BENEFITS: Gaia-X4KI connects various stakeholder and their diverse system landscape from the complete autonomous driving development lifecycle. COMPONENTS: Eclipse Dataspace Components (EDC) and EDC MVD including Connector, Federated Catalog, Identity Hub, Registration Service PREREQUISITES: The data space is currently in development and being tested inside the project. It base on open source components. LEARN MORE: Introduction IKERLAN is a leading knowledge transfer technological centre providing competitive value to companies. We seek for excellence in R&D&i, thanks to the continuous adaptation to the need of our customer and the proximity with the business reality. Faithful to our mission, we have been working daily since 1974 to develop solution that allow our customer to become more and more competitive. We are a cooperative member of the MONDRAGON Corporation and the Basque Research and Technology Alliance (BRTA). Business Expertise Thanks to a unique cooperation model, which combine technology transfer activities, internal research and training of highly qualified personnel, IKERLAN is currently the trusted technological partner of major company in the country. To meet our goal, we are structured into two technological specialization units: ELECTRONICS, INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGIES ENERGY AND MECHATRONICS IKERLAN is a center that is dynamic and open to the world. We are an accredited agent of the Basque Network of Science, Technology, and Innovation and of the Spanish Federation of Technology Centres. We have a major cooperation network integrated with renowned European center and universities, with which we conduct activity of research and training of researchers. Technical Expertise Mission: To solve the technological challenge of the companies, improve their competitiveness and collaborate with the sustainable social and economic development of the environment, all of that from a position of technological leadership and with differential ability in their area of expertise. Vission: Technological center, cooperative and non-profit, known a the European leader in it area of specialization, with an exceptional cohesive human team, that provides value to the company and society. Contact Details Santiago Charramendieta Website Increased visibility of order delivery process VTT | Wrtsil | Uwira CHALLENGE: The use case revolves around expediting and enhancing transparency between a focal company of a manufacturing ecosystem (OEM) and it supplier in their production order management processes. The existing communication method have proven inadequate in facilitating efficient and adaptable exchange between the two entities. By facilitating transparency and fostering a more seamless integration between the IT system of both companies, the management of product order can be streamlined, resulting in heightened efficiency and a reduction in errors. SUCCESS: The objective is to facilitate a reliable and seamless flow of data between the OEM and it supplier by establishing a dedicated data space. The developed solution will be seamlessly integrated with pre-existing IT infrastructure of both company and the solution is grounded in the framework of the IDS reference architecture. The OEM can selectively disclose data from their production environment to the supplier without the fear of data leakages. Respectively, the supplier receives only the data that are essential for them and there is no need to locally extract meaningful insight and valuable information from big data sets. BENEFITS: The established data space solution ha the potential to significantly enhance transparency between the OEM and the supplier. This give rise to several potential benefits, including: Effective Communication: Transparent communication help in conveying accurate information about product specifications, requirements, changes, and timelines. Risk Management: Sharing information about potential risks, such a change in demand or design modifications, allows supplier to proactively address these issues. Furthermore, in time of disruptions, such a supply shortage or unexpected market shifts, transparent communication help both party respond more effectively. Cost Efficiency: Transparent communication allows both party to work together to find cost-effective solutions. COMPONENTS: IDS connector - serve a the communication interface linking the two company and their existing IT systems. With IDS connectors, a data provider can define the rule and condition (usage policies) under which data are shared with a data consumer. DAPS - enables connector to authenticate themselves using X.509 certificates. After successful authentication, the DAPS issue OAuth2 access token for connectors, who need these token to access the service and data of other connectors. Metadata Broker store information about the data end-points offered by the participants. The broker provides a query interface for connector and can hence be considered a the search engine in this use case. LEARN MORE: Come to where the action is! Welcome to IDSAs workshop where theory meet practice and idea are put into action. Our member work in team to co-create the IDS standard; and build IDS based solution for their own domain to push IDS further towards market-readiness. Its exciting, it happening now and it only need you to go the next mile. Open source The open-source portfolio of IDS building block is a collective development environment where you can find IDS component in a variety of implementations, and you can work with others on IDS idea transparently and collaboratively. Everyone is welcome to participate. Working Groups Our working group are IDSA member co-creating the standard and characteristic for international data spaces. Join us! Hubs, competence centers, lab The IDSA ha inspired a strong network of international hubs, competence center and lab that share knowledge and information about IDS in country across the entire world. R&D ProjectsIDSA leaf a footprint in European and national research these project are important pillar to bring IDS to life, to develop fundamental concepts, to test proof of concept and to stimulate the adoption and proliferation of IDS CommunitiesIDS Communities are aligning tomorrow data solution with common business need across all industry and domain of activity. There are currently four IDS Communities, consisting of relevant stakeholder from industry, research and government, developing blueprint for data sovereignty in mobility, industry, logistics and the medical field. LiaisonsIDSAs liaison are major digital initiative that are working with IDSA to connect IDS concept and standard with broad-based national and industry digital strategies, business need and specific application worldwide. When business can really trust their data-sharing ecosystem, itstimulates innovation,eases process anddrives growth! Christoph Mertens, Head of Adoption, IDSA Any questions? Contact us! No website or brochure can replace a personal conversation about your goal and your topics. Our team is looking forward to your call!Phone: +49 (0) 231 70096 501 Download our brochure Read our brochure: International Data Spaces trustworthy and sovereign data sharing enable the data economy Make Stay updated with u Share this page: International Data Spaces e. The broker provides a query interface for connector and can hence be considered a the search engine in this use case. LEARN MORE: Working Groups Who creates global standard for data spaces? You do! Our working group are IDSA member collaborating on the standardsand characteristic for international data spaces. Join us! IDSA working group are for member only. Join IDSA to drive change in sovereign data sharing! a Working Group Architecture The working group Architecture aim to develop a business, security, data & service and software architecture. Its also responsible for standardizing the main software component, the IDS Connector, a well a embracing existing standard and corresponding initiatives. Finally, the Architecture group is incubating the IDSA Developers Community to help IDSA architecture and technology mature and foster their acceptance. Activities of the Working Group Modifying the IDS-RAM so that IDS can be used across industry Verifying the different element of the reference architecture a the basis for the IDS ecosystem Implementing and testing sprint release within user company Standardizing the IDS Connector and other component that will enable IDS to deliver on it value proposition Who should join? IT Architecture development and analysis expert Colleagues who know about their company IT infrastructure, software and system Experts in developing software, apps or other component The working version of the IDS-RAM 4.0 is available on GitHub. Whether you have a question, want to request a change, or contribute to the text: Just join IDSA on GitHub. The user-friendly version of the IDS-RAM is accessible in the IDSA Knowledge Base. Heads of the working group Andreas Teuscher SICK AGCo-chair of the Working Group Architecture Peter Koen MicrosoftCo-chair of the Working Group Architecture Arian Firouzbakhsh IONOSCo-chair of the Working Group Architecture Join the next working group meeting WG Architecture June 18, 2024 Working Group Rulebook TheIDSA Rulebook serf multiple purpose that are instrumental in shaping how sovereign data sharing in data space work. At it core, it provides a clear understanding of mandatory rule and optional guidelines, encompassing functional, technical, operational, and legal dimension for data sharing. This governance framework lay down guideline for common service functionalities, defining processes, and outlining specific role and service within data spaces. Activities of the working group The IDSA Rulebook working group is responsible for creating and maintaining the IDSA Rulebook, which address all relevant aspect of secure, fair, and trustworthy cross-organizational data sharing. This encompasses data space within specific sector a well a across various industries. The working group take the lead in discussing mandatory and optional element within data space and continually improves guideline concerning their development and operation. This is done through close collaboration with other IDSA Working Groups and Task Forces. Join the working group Contribute to the development and enhancement of the IDS Rulebook. Your expertise and insight can make a significant impact on creating guideline that foster innovation, collaboration, and compliance in data spaces. The working version of the IDSA Rulebook is available on GitHub. Whether you have a question, want to request a change, or contribute to the text: Just join IDSA on GitHub. The user-friendly version of the IDSA Rulebook accessible in the IDSA Knowledge Base. Your feedback on the IDSA Rulebook Your voice counts! Help u to make the IDSA Rulebook better by giving u your feedback. Heads of the working group Marko Turpeinen 1001 lake | Aalto UniversityCo-chair of the Working Group Rulebook Peter Koen MicrosoftCo-chair of the Working Group Rulebook Olaf-Gerd Gemein OrbiterCo-chair of the Working Group Rulebook Join the next working group meeting No Events Working Group Certification The Working Group Certification creates and maintains the IDS certification process. The IDS Reference Architecture Model (IDS-RAM) outline essential component and requirement for data spaces, ensuring interoperability and standardization across diverse implementations. IDS-RAM specifies key component like data connectors, data models, and governance guidelines. IDS Certification, a defined in IDS-RAM, ensures compliance with these specifications, safeguarding data sovereignty for all data space participants. Activities of the Working Group The Working Group Certification develops certification requirement and strategies. It creates and maintains the IDSA certification process a an important aspect of building trust among participant in data spaces. This includes certifying operational environment and core components, defining role and developing evaluation method used during certification. Who should join? Experts in certification process Colleagues who know about certification activity in your company Colleagues who are interested in International Data Spaces certification Head of the working group Javier Bores SQS Software Quality SystemsChair of the Working Group Certification Join the next working group meeting WG Certification June 19, 2024 Working Group Training The IDSA Working Group Training is dedicated to establishing and upholding a professional certification program that aligns closely with the goal of IDSA and caters to the specific requirement within the IDS framework. Its core objective is to create a robust training initiative that disseminates knowledge and skill effectively, promoting comprehensive understanding and proficient implementation of IDS principles. This program is designed to accommodate various learning style and level of expertise, striking a balance between depth and accessibility, while continuously updating to reflect evolving IDS standards, ensuring the success of the overall initiative. The structure of the Working Group Training adheres closely to the guideline outlined in the organizational handbook of IDSA, ensuring alignment with these requirement throughout it developmental stages. Activities of the Working Group Developing and implement a Professional Certification Program about data space in variety of aspects: technical, operational, functional and business. Ensuring that the Certification Program aligns with the IDS framework and core document Creating an IDS Body of Knowledge underpinning the Certification Program and laying down essential information to develop trainings. Compiling, organizing, and documenting essential knowledge and best practice related to the IDS framework. Organizing internal and external Collaboration and Expansion about training in the Association Heads of the working group Jess Alonso-Rodrguez Piedra Innovalia AssociationChair of the Working GroupTraining Christoph Becker Enterprise Training CenterCo-chair of the Working Group Training Join the next working group meeting WG Training June 20, 2024 Any questions? Contact us! To be successful in creating truly global, cross-industry data ecosystem in which anyone can participate, IDSA need the involvement of company of all size and sectors. This mean you! We hope youll consider joining the effort to drive the data economy of the future. become a member Benefit from all current developments: Become a member of the International Data Spaces Association now! COMPONENTS: IDS connector - serve a the communication interface linking the two company and their existing IT systems. With IDS connectors, a data provider can define the rule and condition (usage policies) under which data are shared with a data consumer. DAPS - enables connector to authenticate themselves using X.509 certificates. After successful authentication, the DAPS issue OAuth2 access token for connectors, who need these token to access the service and data of other connectors. Metadata Broker store information about the data end-points offered by the participants. The broker provides a query interface for connector and can hence be considered a the search engine in this use case. LEARN MORE: Task force Tackle challenge with expertise and collaboration Open to all: Our task force address complex, cross-functional challenges. Together, we work towards achieving defined goal to drive the global data economy. Join our task force IDSA task force are open to all, comprising individual with interest or expertise in the area at hand. Task force address complex, cross-functional challenges, requiring input from multiple stakeholders. Together, we work towards achieving defined goal or objective before disbanding. Task Force China The Task Force China is a group of professional aiming to promote data space and position them a a de-facto standard for secure and trusted data sharing in China and the world. In today data-driven world, the exchange of industrial data is becoming increasingly prevalent. As technology advance and new standard like IDS emerge, it is vital to ensure interoperability by enabling company to participate in decentralized and federated dataspaces. Our primary purpose is to develop technology and define the existing mechanism through which IDS handle situation involving industrial and cross-border data sharing in China. Join the Task Force China to play a crucial role in developing IDS-based technology for cross-border data sharing. Moderator of the task force Thorsten Hlsmann International Data SpacesAssociation Task Force Energy Interoperability The Task Force Energy Interoperability aim to define a framework to achieve inter data space interoperability in the energy domain, implement it in specific use cases, and document both the framework and it implementation. Additionally, it establishes communication channel with standardization committee to contribute to industry standards. Activities of the task force The Task Force work on a common position paper that describes: State of the Art and Standards Data space governance and interoperability Definition of energy interoperability framework: Technical, Semantic & organizational interoperability Existing interoperability tool and platform How to achieve cross-domain interoperability Benefits of inter-data space interoperability for actor of the energy domain Moderator of the task force Sonia Jimenez Moreno International Data Spaces Association Task Force Legal Framework Legal aspect are crucial in ensuring innovation and safeguarding sovereignty within data spaces. The Task Force Legal Framework ha been established by IDSA to discus and align legal issue with other initiatives, strengthening IDSAs internal and external positioning on legal matters. The Task Force Legal Framework ha two area of activity: public voice and task and solutions. Public voice involves external communication with stakeholders, providing input to regulatory proposal and proactive impulse on legal issues. Tasks and solution support working group and projects, finding answer to general regulatory question and specific contractual issues. Moderator of the task force Dr. Sntje Julia Hilberg LL.M. | Lawyer | IT | Data Privacy Any questions? Contact us! Your contact person:Domenic FrankeAdministration & Project Manager Join our working group Contribute your requirement for secure data exchange and data sovereignty. (healthcare) | EROSKI S.COOP (retail) | The technology coordinator is IKERLAN (a leading knowledge transfer center providing competitive value to companies) SUCCESS: Seeks to promote and research the necessary technology for the definition of a reference architecture, operational models, adoption of standard and development for a data space based on the common technical framework proposed by DSBA members, extending it main service to favor the development of artificial intelligence with guarantee of traceability, security, and governance of the data and services. BENEFITS: Aims to provide the country with a reliable data space that enables company to offer new concept of high-added value service based on data sharing, through the servitization of collaborative artificial intelligence for the productization and monetization of their data and industry knowledge in new business models. COMPONENTS: Will develop new service in the field of artificial intelligence and will explore current IDS component implementation (focusing on Connectors, Metadatabroker, and IdentityProviders) in order to select one of them to rely on. LEARN MORE: MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY EGOKIA MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY - an international firm specializing in the development of automatization and assembly solution for various sectors. It operates 6 production plant around the world and is part of the largest cooperative group in the world | IKERLAN Technical research center and member of IDSA CHALLENGE: EGOKIA solution allows collaborative learning and knowledge sharing between geographically distributed plants, integrating headquarters in Basque Country and domain experts. Thanks to the data space, data, and AI asset can be securely shared throughout different corporate site and a new knowledge-based economy emerges. SUCCESS: Deploys an architecture based on IDSA connectors, linking Mondragon Assemblys data and AI platform from different corporate sites. With this new reliable data space, we extend the lifecycle of artificial intelligence models, enhance their capabilities, and facilitate trusted access and use of it asset by EGOKIA participants. BENEFITS: NEW BUSINESS MODEL: A new business model based on AI service and a knowledge-based economy. RELIABLE AI SOLUTIONS: A "standardized", flexible, and secure solution to break data silo to share and complete AI asset and process between trusted organization and production plants. Measurable benefit can be listed as: Up to 30% quality on model thanks to the application of federated learning techniques, reduce inversion and time to market on IA-based solution or lower communication loads. STANDARIZED DATA SPACE The organization is ready to take part in the knowledge economy with other entities, domain experts, and technology providers. COMPONENTS: Data Space connector 8.0.2 Metada Broker 5.0.3 Identity Provider 1.6.0 Gaia-X4KI A sovereign data and service ecosystem for artificial intelligence in automotive development, production, and operation DLR | T-Systems | Capgemini Engineering | Continental | IAV | Intel | Conweaver | HighQSoft | Reuschlaw | STTech | Fraunhofer ITWM | Fraunhofer ISST | Hochschule Offenburg | Leibniz Universitt Hannover | Technische Hochschule Ingolstadt CHALLENGE: Autonomous driving scenario and the industrial production of required device face a broad range of challenge related to data sovereignty and security. In particular, transfer of large, sensitive file and service in a policy-conform way are addressed in the prototypes. SUCCESS: The solution are cloud-based and are embedded in existing industrial cloud landscape to enhance data sovereignty of participant in complex data exchange relations. BENEFITS: Gaia-X4KI connects various stakeholder and their diverse system landscape from the complete autonomous driving development lifecycle. COMPONENTS: Eclipse Dataspace Components (EDC) and EDC MVD including Connector, Federated Catalog, Identity Hub, Registration Service PREREQUISITES: The data space is currently in development and being tested inside the project. It base on open source components. LEARN MORE: Introduction IKERLAN is a leading knowledge transfer technological centre providing competitive value to companies. We seek for excellence in R&D&i, thanks to the continuous adaptation to the need of our customer and the proximity with the business reality. Faithful to our mission, we have been working daily since 1974 to develop solution that allow our customer to become more and more competitive. We are a cooperative member of the MONDRAGON Corporation and the Basque Research and Technology Alliance (BRTA). Business Expertise Thanks to a unique cooperation model, which combine technology transfer activities, internal research and training of highly qualified personnel, IKERLAN is currently the trusted technological partner of major company in the country. To meet our goal, we are structured into two technological specialization units: ELECTRONICS, INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGIES ENERGY AND MECHATRONICS IKERLAN is a center that is dynamic and open to the world. We are an accredited agent of the Basque Network of Science, Technology, and Innovation and of the Spanish Federation of Technology Centres. We have a major cooperation network integrated with renowned European center and universities, with which we conduct activity of research and training of researchers. Technical Expertise Mission: To solve the technological challenge of the companies, improve their competitiveness and collaborate with the sustainable social and economic development of the environment, all of that from a position of technological leadership and with differential ability in their area of expertise. Vission: Technological center, cooperative and non-profit, known a the European leader in it area of specialization, with an exceptional cohesive human team, that provides value to the company and society. Contact Details Santiago Charramendieta Website Increased visibility of order delivery process VTT | Wrtsil | Uwira CHALLENGE: The use case revolves around expediting and enhancing transparency between a focal company of a manufacturing ecosystem (OEM) and it supplier in their production order management processes. The existing communication method have proven inadequate in facilitating efficient and adaptable exchange between the two entities. By facilitating transparency and fostering a more seamless integration between the IT system of both companies, the management of product order can be streamlined, resulting in heightened efficiency and a reduction in errors. SUCCESS: The objective is to facilitate a reliable and seamless flow of data between the OEM and it supplier by establishing a dedicated data space. The developed solution will be seamlessly integrated with pre-existing IT infrastructure of both company and the solution is grounded in the framework of the IDS reference architecture. The OEM can selectively disclose data from their production environment to the supplier without the fear of data leakages. Respectively, the supplier receives only the data that are essential for them and there is no need to locally extract meaningful insight and valuable information from big data sets. BENEFITS: The established data space solution ha the potential to significantly enhance transparency between the OEM and the supplier. This give rise to several potential benefits, including: Effective Communication: Transparent communication help in conveying accurate information about product specifications, requirements, changes, and timelines. Risk Management: Sharing information about potential risks, such a change in demand or design modifications, allows supplier to proactively address these issues. Furthermore, in time of disruptions, such a supply shortage or unexpected market shifts, transparent communication help both party respond more effectively. Cost Efficiency: Transparent communication allows both party to work together to find cost-effective solutions. COMPONENTS: IDS connector - serve a the communication interface linking the two company and their existing IT systems. With IDS connectors, a data provider can define the rule and condition (usage policies) under which data are shared with a data consumer. DAPS - enables connector to authenticate themselves using X.509 certificates. After successful authentication, the DAPS issue OAuth2 access token for connectors, who need these token to access the service and data of other connectors. Metadata Broker store information about the data end-points offered by the participants. The broker provides a query interface for connector and can hence be considered a the search engine in this use case. LEARN MORE: Hubs, Competence Centers & Labs Join our network of international hubs, competence center & lab The IDSA ha inspired a strong network of international hub and competence center that share knowledge and information about IDS in country around the world. These hub and competence center are all facilitated by not-for-profit organization that understand the importance of sovereign data sharing for future data economy and global value chains. Our partner are building momentum across Europe and around the world IDSA hub and competence center build bridge for growth and adoption in their countries. They disseminate the IDS standard for data sovereignty and data ecosystem in Europe and beyond. And they build cooperation with international R&D organization and companies. The facilitator of IDSA hub and competence center are all not-for-profit organizations, operating out of university or research and technology organizations. These organization work with IDSA on a variety of initiative to create awareness of data sovereignty, transfer knowledge, recruit new IDSA members, and disseminate IDS-based applications. They also foster and coordinate research and development project to further develop the IDS standard, even beyond their country borders. IDSA Hub in Austria facilitated by Data Intelligence Offensive (DIO) The DIO association is taking on the role of the new IDSA hub. This development mark a decisive step in the promotion and strengthening of the data community in Austria. The proven expertise and commitment of DIO, which operates dataspaces and drive the data infrastructure forward, will create a pioneering platform that enables innovation in the data sector and intensifies collaboration within the Austrian data landscape. Your contact person:Gnther TschabuschnigPresident Data Intelligence Offensive IDSA Hub Brazil facilitated by ABINC ABINC, the Brazilian Association of Internet of Things, is a non-profit organization with the mission to catalyze, foster, and promote various interest and need within the IoT business sector, aiming to satisfy it associate and partner through action and representation in both the public and private spheres. ABINC endeavor to contribute to technological development while respecting individuals, society, and the environment. More ABINC ha decided to partner with IDSA, creating and facilitating the IDSA hub in Brazil, a it perceives Data Spaces a a natural evolution of IoT and a fundamental component of the development of the Brazilian Digital Economy landscape. This decision is aligned with it mission to promote international cooperation and position Brazils economy at the forefront of technological advancement. Your contact person:Flavio Maeda Vice President at ABINC IDSA Competence Center China: CFIEC The IDSA Competence Center is facilitated by the China Future Internet Engineering Center (CFIEC), a leading provider and operator of new infrastructure services, focusing on IPv6, DNS, SDN/NFV, advanced computing, blockchain, and data governance. CFIEC is also involved in global technology standardization and promotion, operates a supercomputing center and other key information infrastructure, carry out third-party testing and certification services. More The China Competence Center serf a an open information exchange station for trusted data space and sovereign data sharing in China. Additionally, it is a vital communication platform for enterprises, academic institutions, and non-profit organization to discus data sharing and promote IDSA knowledge and standards. The center play a pivotal role in building ecosystem for data sharing, organizing events, promoting cooperation between IDSA members, and providing data compliance-related services. Data sovereignty, security and trustworthy governance are key element of Industry 4.0 solution and are therefore integral to the Digital Czechia governmental strategy. More The IDSA brings an international, open approach that set the standard for industrial and scientific systems, a well a industry-academic cooperation. The Czech hub wa launched in June 2019 during the Open House Day of the Testbed for Industry 4.0. Your contact person:Dimitrios TzovarasChairman of the Board of Directors of CERTH a IDSA Hub in Italy facilitated by Cefriel Cefriel host IDSAs Italian hub, driving Italys national conversation around data sovereignty and data exchange with a view towards digital transformation. The second is the European Communitys increased attention to the challenge of SMEs and MEs and their supply chains. Since SMEs and MEs are among the most critical European economic backbones, a Europewide data-centric approach raise the relevance of IDSA. Your contact person:Nadia ScandelliHead of Smart Industry Solutions Unit at Cefriel a IDSA Hub in Japan facilitated by University of Tokyo (UTokyo) in collaboration with Data Society Alliance (DSA) The IDSA Japan Hub is facilitated by the University of Tokyo (UTokyo) in close collaboration with DSA (Data Society Alliance). UTokyo, a the oldest and largest national university in Japan, conduct research in a wide range of fields, including computer science, data science, digital infrastructure, economics, law, and other area of expertise. At UTokyo, the Research Center for Ubiquitous Information Society Infrastructure, Interfaculty Initiatives in Information Study, play a central role in this facilitation. More The DSA is a general incorporated association, aiming to realize a prosperous society (called a data society) through cross-sectoral fair and free data flow and utilization through industry-government-academia collaboration. In addition to the hub, UTokyo also host the IDSA Japan Research Lab. There, we establish the UTokyo International Dataspace Testbed and address technical issue such a interoperability between different data space architectures, in collaboration with international data space communities. Through these two activities, we aim to promote international data space among industry, government, and academia to realize the concept of Data Free Flow with Trust (DFFT). The concept, developed at the G7 Hiroshima Summit in 2023, seek to encourage the free flow of data while ensuring trust in privacy, security, and intellectual property rights. More TNO connects people and knowledge to support innovation that boost the competitive strength of the economy and the well-being of society in a sustainable way. TNO ha been very active in many different data-sharing initiatives, both on a national and a European level. The idea behind IDSAwhat we all contribute to and where we profit from the advancement of IDS a a wholeis how we want to innovate. For us, this is a good model to leverage the intelligence of the community, where each member can play it role. Founded in 1831, LUH is today a study and work place for around 24.000 students, over 1,100 academic employee and more than 300 professor in the natural science and engineering, the humanity and social science a well in law and economics, with a focus on interdisciplinary teaching, research and cooperation projects. More TheL3S Research Centeris a joint research institute of several university in Lower Saxony, Germany formally associated with Leibniz Universitt Hannover (LUH). Work at L3S focus on innovative and cutting-edge method and technology for Web Science. The L3S team build upon technology and multidisciplinary approach from various domains, achieving thus international recognition. As a library, TIB is committed to openness, open access to information, publication and scientific data: it aim to make information and knowledge more easily accessible, more transparent and better reusable. As a research institution, TIB is continuously expanding it role a the German information centre for the digitisation of science and technology. It conduct applied research and development to generate new service and improve existing ones. Your contact person:Alexandra GaratzogianniProgram Coordinator at Leibniz Uni Hannover a IDSA Competence Center Greece: LMS Patras Laboratory for Manufacturing Systems & Automation (LMS) of the University of Patras is oriented on research and development in cutting edge scientific and technological fields. Your contact person:Alexopoulos Kosmasresearch engineer at LMS Patras a IDSA Competence Center Italy: MediTech 4.0 MediTech 4.0 is a competence center designed to facilitate the adoption of Industry 4.0 technology by SMEs and public administration. As such, it is also dedicated to the activity of IDSA and the introduction and establishment of data spaces. MediTech collaborates with institutes, companies, public administration, cities, and university in Southern Italy to promote secure access, sovereign sharing and use of data, and create trusted ecosystem based on open and interoperable standards. More The IDSA Competence Center facilitated by MediTech focus on a variety of key activities: Research and development: MediTech is committed to researching and developing innovative technology and solution to enable sovereign data sharing and use. MediTech collaborates with companies, research institutes, and governmental organization to promote innovation and the adoption of best practices. Training and consulting: MediTech offer training and consulting program to support organization implement their data spaces. MediTechs expert provide in-depth knowledge on how to implement a data architecture based on the International Data Spaces standard, ensuring data sovereignty, security, privacy, and regulatory compliance. Testing, demonstration and prototypes: MediTech creates demo and prototype to showcase the benefit and potential of International Data Spaces in real-world use cases. MediTech collaborates with industrial partner to create concrete use case that demonstrate the effectiveness and benefit of their data space in enhancing collaboration and innovation through sovereign data sharing. Collaboration and networking: MediTech provides an exetensive computer platform dedicated to IDSA activity for organizations, students, researcher interested in International Data Spaces. In addition, MediTech organizes events, workshops, and conference to facilitate knowledge exchange, foster partnership collaboration, and promote the adoption of the International Data Spaces standard at the national and international levels. Joining the IDSA Competence Center facilitated by MediTech mean becoming part of a community of experts, professionals, and innovator working together to shape the future of secure access and sovereign sharing of data. We are committed to supporting organization harness the full potential of data, drive innovation and achieve economic growth. Your contact person:Angelo GiulianaGeneral Director of MediTech 4.0 IDSA Hub in Malaysia facilitated by Digital Connect Society (DCS) Digital Connect Society (DCS) is a Professional Society registered under the Society Act 1966 of Malaysia. It is established to gather globally connected individual and entity who are passionate in working together to achieve the common vision of a manageable digitally connected world that is constantly evolving and progressive, by establishing professional and scientific advancement of the education, standard practices, recognition and governance of technology. More The three objective to be achieved by the Society are (1) advocate the use of standard and best practice for digitally connected society; (2) promote interoperability with the use of common framework and classification standards, and (3) to be the Center of Excellence for digital transformation agenda, which DCS aim to promote the standards, practice and work established by the Society in relation to Objectives 1 and 2, into all area of business and relevant parties. DCS encourages the adoption of best practice and standard for community to be digitally connected. The effort to achieve the objective include but not limited to having professional activity directed towards the advancement of the education and practice of digital transformation in the business and industry, a well a the allied branch of educational standard related to consultancy, skill development, business management, human resource management, governance, technology management, and any other relevant areas. DCS also aim to establish the governance of educational standards, such a to formulate, monitor, review and endorse course content related to digitalization, that accelerate the competency of skilled workforce, to enable a dynamic and adaptive digitally connected society. Besides, DCS emphasizes on having professional and scientific works, directed towards the advancement, recognition and governance of technology and digital solution that enables digital transformation in the industry, a well a the allied branch of science and technology application that conform to the national and international standards, guidelines, policy and any other relevant publication and works; Besides, DCS also aim to establish standards, classification and governance of digital solution that include software, hardware, cloud services, telecommunication, appliances, equipment, and everything that support digitalization; and establish centre of excellence, hub or associated centre of state, national and international body that can drive the national digital transformation in the industry. DCS develops research and development platform that promote digital innovation and digital culture. Lastly, DCS aim to foster opportunity for professional development in digitalization through activity such a conferences, workshops, publications, electronic media, etc., and set up platforms, such a forums, in digital or physical means, to deliver information and service to the member of the Society. Your contact person:Dr. Wah Pheng, LeePresident of DCS a IDSA Hub in Poland facilitated by PSNC Poznan Supercomputing and Networking Center (PSNC) is affiliated to the Institute of Bioorganic Chemistry of the Polish Academy of Sciences. PSNC is a HPC and Data Center and network operator, leading e-Infrastructure provider in Poland. More The main part of e-infrastructure consists currently of 7.5 PFlops of computing power, 120+ PB storage and data management system (fast data cache and archivisation). The backbone network in Poland (operated by PSNC) is based on 100 Gbps connection between the major HPC sites, 100 Gbps to bigger academic community and 400 Gbps between a few academic cities. PSNC play a role of NREN in Poland and partner of the international consortium GANT. PSNC provides direct support for scientific community in Poland a well a in Europe. PSNC ha built a co-working space and is coordinating living lab communities. Via it co-working space, PSNC support 15+ user communities, gathered around ICT technology and application areas. PSNCs Poznan Living Lab, a an effective member of ENoLL, run city challenge workshops, hackathons and design thinking interdisciplinary courses. PSNC coordinate the leading Polish ICT research driven Wielkopolska ICT Cluster with 100+ members. PSNC coordinate the eDIH HPC4Poland and eDIH CyberSec. PSNC also co-manage the EOSC DIH that is pan-European DIH, but also is a part of DIH4CPS, EUhubs4Data, and co-creates the first Agriculture DIH in Poland. PSNC is an R&D Center involved so far in over 300 projects, out of which 45 a coordinator in wide range of the technology. PSNC is a member of BDVA, AIOTI, ENoLL, GAIA-X, EOSC, GANT Association, Fiware, ECCP, IDSA. PSNC being active in the activity related to the Data Spaces become also the member of IDSA and IDSA Hub Facilitator aiming at promotion of the IDSA in Poland and building the community of the company interested in appliance in different area such a smart agriculture, smar city or industry 4.0. Your contact person:Marcin PlociennikHead of the IoT Systems Department at PSNC a IDSA Hub in Spain facilitated by Innovalia IDSAs hub in Spain is based in the Basque region and facilitated by Innovalia, a research association founded by the Innovalia Group. The goal of the Spain hub is to provide the national meeting point for fostering the development of Spains trustworthy, sovereign data ecosystem and data economy. More The IDSA Hub Spain support five main type of activities: technology development, business development, ecosystem development, skill development and SME support. Innovalia Group is an accredited member of the Basque Science, Technology and Innovation Network and the national research center network of the Spanish Ministry of Science and Innovation. Other integral part of the IDSA Hub in Spain are an IDS competence center and testbed at Tecnalia, one of the first Spanish member and leading research and technological development center in Spain, and software testing facility provided by SQS S.A. Any questions? Contact us! (healthcare) | EROSKI S.COOP (retail) | The technology coordinator is IKERLAN (a leading knowledge transfer center providing competitive value to companies) SUCCESS: Seeks to promote and research the necessary technology for the definition of a reference architecture, operational models, adoption of standard and development for a data space based on the common technical framework proposed by DSBA members, extending it main service to favor the development of artificial intelligence with guarantee of traceability, security, and governance of the data and services. BENEFITS: Aims to provide the country with a reliable data space that enables company to offer new concept of high-added value service based on data sharing, through the servitization of collaborative artificial intelligence for the productization and monetization of their data and industry knowledge in new business models. COMPONENTS: Will develop new service in the field of artificial intelligence and will explore current IDS component implementation (focusing on Connectors, Metadatabroker, and IdentityProviders) in order to select one of them to rely on. LEARN MORE: MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY EGOKIA MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY - an international firm specializing in the development of automatization and assembly solution for various sectors. It operates 6 production plant around the world and is part of the largest cooperative group in the world | IKERLAN Technical research center and member of IDSA CHALLENGE: EGOKIA solution allows collaborative learning and knowledge sharing between geographically distributed plants, integrating headquarters in Basque Country and domain experts. Thanks to the data space, data, and AI asset can be securely shared throughout different corporate site and a new knowledge-based economy emerges. SUCCESS: Deploys an architecture based on IDSA connectors, linking Mondragon Assemblys data and AI platform from different corporate sites. With this new reliable data space, we extend the lifecycle of artificial intelligence models, enhance their capabilities, and facilitate trusted access and use of it asset by EGOKIA participants. BENEFITS: NEW BUSINESS MODEL: A new business model based on AI service and a knowledge-based economy. RELIABLE AI SOLUTIONS: A "standardized", flexible, and secure solution to break data silo to share and complete AI asset and process between trusted organization and production plants. Measurable benefit can be listed as: Up to 30% quality on model thanks to the application of federated learning techniques, reduce inversion and time to market on IA-based solution or lower communication loads. STANDARIZED DATA SPACE The organization is ready to take part in the knowledge economy with other entities, domain experts, and technology providers. COMPONENTS: Data Space connector 8.0.2 Metada Broker 5.0.3 Identity Provider 1.6.0 Gaia-X4KI A sovereign data and service ecosystem for artificial intelligence in automotive development, production, and operation DLR | T-Systems | Capgemini Engineering | Continental | IAV | Intel | Conweaver | HighQSoft | Reuschlaw | STTech | Fraunhofer ITWM | Fraunhofer ISST | Hochschule Offenburg | Leibniz Universitt Hannover | Technische Hochschule Ingolstadt CHALLENGE: Autonomous driving scenario and the industrial production of required device face a broad range of challenge related to data sovereignty and security. In particular, transfer of large, sensitive file and service in a policy-conform way are addressed in the prototypes. SUCCESS: The solution are cloud-based and are embedded in existing industrial cloud landscape to enhance data sovereignty of participant in complex data exchange relations. BENEFITS: Gaia-X4KI connects various stakeholder and their diverse system landscape from the complete autonomous driving development lifecycle. COMPONENTS: Eclipse Dataspace Components (EDC) and EDC MVD including Connector, Federated Catalog, Identity Hub, Registration Service PREREQUISITES: The data space is currently in development and being tested inside the project. It base on open source components. LEARN MORE: Introduction IKERLAN is a leading knowledge transfer technological centre providing competitive value to companies. We seek for excellence in R&D&i, thanks to the continuous adaptation to the need of our customer and the proximity with the business reality. Faithful to our mission, we have been working daily since 1974 to develop solution that allow our customer to become more and more competitive. We are a cooperative member of the MONDRAGON Corporation and the Basque Research and Technology Alliance (BRTA). Business Expertise Thanks to a unique cooperation model, which combine technology transfer activities, internal research and training of highly qualified personnel, IKERLAN is currently the trusted technological partner of major company in the country. To meet our goal, we are structured into two technological specialization units: ELECTRONICS, INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGIES ENERGY AND MECHATRONICS IKERLAN is a center that is dynamic and open to the world. We are an accredited agent of the Basque Network of Science, Technology, and Innovation and of the Spanish Federation of Technology Centres. We have a major cooperation network integrated with renowned European center and universities, with which we conduct activity of research and training of researchers. Technical Expertise Mission: To solve the technological challenge of the companies, improve their competitiveness and collaborate with the sustainable social and economic development of the environment, all of that from a position of technological leadership and with differential ability in their area of expertise. Vission: Technological center, cooperative and non-profit, known a the European leader in it area of specialization, with an exceptional cohesive human team, that provides value to the company and society. Contact Details Santiago Charramendieta Website Increased visibility of order delivery process VTT | Wrtsil | Uwira CHALLENGE: The use case revolves around expediting and enhancing transparency between a focal company of a manufacturing ecosystem (OEM) and it supplier in their production order management processes. The existing communication method have proven inadequate in facilitating efficient and adaptable exchange between the two entities. By facilitating transparency and fostering a more seamless integration between the IT system of both companies, the management of product order can be streamlined, resulting in heightened efficiency and a reduction in errors. SUCCESS: The objective is to facilitate a reliable and seamless flow of data between the OEM and it supplier by establishing a dedicated data space. The developed solution will be seamlessly integrated with pre-existing IT infrastructure of both company and the solution is grounded in the framework of the IDS reference architecture. The OEM can selectively disclose data from their production environment to the supplier without the fear of data leakages. Respectively, the supplier receives only the data that are essential for them and there is no need to locally extract meaningful insight and valuable information from big data sets. BENEFITS: The established data space solution ha the potential to significantly enhance transparency between the OEM and the supplier. This give rise to several potential benefits, including: Effective Communication: Transparent communication help in conveying accurate information about product specifications, requirements, changes, and timelines. Risk Management: Sharing information about potential risks, such a change in demand or design modifications, allows supplier to proactively address these issues. Furthermore, in time of disruptions, such a supply shortage or unexpected market shifts, transparent communication help both party respond more effectively. Cost Efficiency: Transparent communication allows both party to work together to find cost-effective solutions. COMPONENTS: IDS connector - serve a the communication interface linking the two company and their existing IT systems. With IDS connectors, a data provider can define the rule and condition (usage policies) under which data are shared with a data consumer. DAPS - enables connector to authenticate themselves using X.509 certificates. After successful authentication, the DAPS issue OAuth2 access token for connectors, who need these token to access the service and data of other connectors. Metadata Broker store information about the data end-points offered by the participants. The broker provides a query interface for connector and can hence be considered a the search engine in this use case. LEARN MORE: Open Source Where collaborative data space innovation happens The open-source portfolio of IDS building block is a collective development environment where you can find IDS component in a variety of implementations, and you can work with others on IDS idea transparently and collaboratively. Everyone is welcome to participate. How can you be part of IDS Open Source? We welcome all interested party either they are contributor or external reviewer to join IDS Open Source. You can find more information on our . To contribute, youll need to sign into your GitHub account, or create a free accountif you dont have one. GitHub is the creative workspace where you can comment on the code, add to it and build it into something new. It give everyone a new kind of control, making coding more fun and more productive. But GitHub is not only for geeks. It is IDSAs knowledge base where you can learn more about the fundamental of our work, how to build data space and the IDSA graduation scheme. But these are just a few examples. Collaborative creation The open-source environment is efficient, agile and transparent; it creates a collaborative atmosphere that welcome ideas, contribution request and feedback. Everyone involved in IDS want implementation to reach the highest quality possible the IDS Open-Source landscape maximizes the possibilities. Become a contributor IDS Open-Source repository are the place where fruitful discussion happen. You can use this opportunity to meet other member of the community, review the code, provide feedback, report bugs, and improve the quality and functionality of end products. Collaboration among partner is the core of IDS and key to a thriving data economy. Check out the existing project on GitHub and contact the appropriate project teams. Learn more about IDSA-RAM Specifications Frequently Asked Questions Who is maintaining the repositories? The repos are maintained by each project respective maintainers. This decision is made by the project teams. How is the development and collaboration workflow managed? All project have their contribution guideline (contributing.md) and code of conduct file available. Anybody who is interested in contributing is more than welcome. The step are explained at the bottom of . Anybody who is interested in contributing is welcome to join the team and contact project maintainer and create issue to share their idea and question with the project teams. Are there term and condition for using the existing codes? Most of the project are under Apache 2.0 license and explanation about licensing condition can be found in each project repository. Any questions? Contact us! Your contact person:Anil TurkmayaliSenior Project Manager Join our open-source Landscape Have your idea on stage in our open, transparent and collaborative work environment.
