IDS research project are the springboard that bringfundamentalIDSconceptsto life, test first proofsofconcept andstimulatethe adoption of IDS ideas. IDSA a consortium partner The consortium is at the heart of any research project. It is not only a written requirement for collaborative project in Europe, but also crucial to the success of the project itself. See for yourself in which research or coordination project IDSA is a consortium partner. AgriDataValue Short description Agriculture face major challenges: It must meet the world food needs, provide farmer with an adequate income and protect the environment at the same time. To achieve these goals, smart agriculture and careful use of resource are required. AgriDataValue aim to establish itself a a game changer in the field of smart agriculture and agri-environmental monitoring. Overall goal The project will strengthen smart agriculture capacity, competitiveness and fair income through the implementation of an innovative, intelligent and multi-technological fully distributed platform.AgriDataValue take a multi-dimensional approach that combine Big Data and Data Spaces technology (BDVA/IDSA/GAIA-X) with agricultural knowledge, new business model and agri-environmental measures. DaCapo - Digital asset and tool for Circular value chain and manufacturing product Short description DaCapo aim to create human-centric digital tool and service that promote the adoption of Circular Economy strategy across manufacturing value chain and product lifecycles. By leveraging digital assets, AI-based systems, and Digital Twins, these tool and service will enhance sustainability, efficiency, and the use of resource in manufacturing. The project will develop a new methodological approach that considers business models, material flows, and circular strategy to support decision-making. Overall goal The overall goal of DaCapo is to foster widespread adoption of Circular Economy strategy in manufacturing. Through digital tool and services, it drive sustainability, efficiency, and resource optimization. DaCapo will establish a digital architecture aligned with interoperability and connectivity standards, ensuring seamless data sharing and integration. This architecture will be based on the IDS standard. IDSA also play a leading role in standardization activities. The project will be demonstrated in production and consumer environment related to aeronautics, electronics, and logistics. DATAMITE - DATA Monetization, Interoperability, Trading & Exchange Short description DATAMITE will provide a modular framework for European company to facilitate data monetization, interoperability, trading and exchange. To this end, the project will provide user with tool and open-source training material to help improve data management and compliance with FAIR principles. Overall goal The goal is to open new revenue stream and business model through sovereign data sharing. DATAMITE will validate the result in three different use cases, demonstrating that the framework is interoperable and applicable in different domain and user needs: 1) intra-enterprise, cross-sector data sharing; 2) data trading between data spaces; 3) integration with other initiative such a data markets, EU AI on Demand platform or DIHs. Short description DAT4.Zero is a digitally-enhanced quality management system (DQM) that gather and organizes data from a distributed multi-sensor network (DMN), which offer adequate level of data accuracy and precision for effective decision support and problem-solving. The system usessmart, dynamic feedback and feed-forward mechanism with the aim of achieving zero defect manufacturing. Overall goal The aim of DAT4.Zero is to integrate smart, cost-effective sensor and actuator for process simulation, monitoring, and control; to develop real-time data validation and integrity strategy within actual production lines; to demonstrate innovative data management strategy a an integrated approach to ZDM and to develop strategy for rapid line qualification and reconfiguration Short description Although some player in agriculture are making good use of the data they generate, the industry still lack holistic approach to data sharing and analysis along the entire agri-food supply chain. The DIVINE project will build an agricultural data ecosystem that incorporates existing agricultural data space while conducting industry-led pilot based on data sharing agreements. Overall goal The goal of DIVINE is to demonstrate the cost-benefit and added value of agricultural data sharing. DIVINE will promote it ecosystem and assessment to technology providers, policymakers, agriculture representatives, and various other agricultural data stakeholders. It will take the first concrete step towards mature data market in European and global agriculture. EU DATA SP4CE - A EUropean Common Digital MAnufacturing InfrasTructure and DatA Space Pathway for ConnectedFactories 4.0 Data Value Chain GovernancE Short description Manufacturing data space for Europe development ha been so far conducted by many different alliances, projects, network and in many case driven in the context of National Industry 4.0 initiative and within seed disconnected project to establish the first embryonic data space for different application in different manufacturing sectors. Overall goal The data space development should not only break data silo per-se, but it should also break the data space development silos. Therefore, the main mission of EU DATA SP4CE is to facilitate a sectorial alliance that brings a unified voice across national initiative & EU manufacturing data-driven initiative (European, national, regional, local, offer, demand) under one common governance framework for technical and business alignment to capitalize on recently established data directive and regulation and unlock business model and rich data value chain in manufacturing products, factory and supply chains. Short description Health-X Dataloft support the vision of a European health data space in which patient enjoy the full digital sovereignty over their data. Health-X Dataloft delivers on the need to unify the control and access of data from the primary and secondary healthcare market by implementing IDS enabled GAIA-X infrastructure component to facilitate cross sectoral interoperability and trustworthy data sharing. Overall goal The approach aim to put citizen at the center of consideration for the provision, the use case a well a their control of sharing or keeping their own health data from the two health markets. Short description MERLOT is one of eleven project awarded in the funding competition Innovative and practical application and data space in theGaia-Xdigital ecosystem. The project goal is to digitize the education sector in Europe. This will enable European citizen to have better learning output and gain equal access to education. To achieve this, the processing of sensitive personal data is necessary Overall goal MERLOT aim to establish an educational data space, encompassing federated services, data marketplace and the sovereign sharing of data between participants. By using the GXFS structure, complemented with IDS data space expertise, learners, schools, public institutions, and educational service provider will be able to share sensitive educational data in a GDPR-compliant manner without having to enter into separate individual agreement or compromising privacy. IDSA will ensure the transfer of knowledge about data space into the project, but also from the project into a common standard and underlying component a open-source software. DSA will also create a technical, legal and Gaia-X compliant concept for educational data space and for smart educational services. Short description Omega-X stand for Orchestrating an interoperable sovereign federated Multi-vector Energy data space built on open standard and ready for Gaia-X. The proposed concept and architecture heavily rely on the approach adopted by IDSA, GAIA-X, FIWARE, BDVA/DAIRO and SGAM a major EU reference regarding data spaces. It will pursue the GAIA-X label, which ensures highest standard on protection, security, transparency, openness and trust, avoids vendor lock-in and is restricted to EU countries. Overall goal The aim of this European research and innovation action is to implement an Energy Data Space which will be based on common European standards, including a federated infrastructure, a data marketplace, and a service marketplace. PLIADES - AI-Enabled Data Lifecycles Optimization and Data Spaces Integration for Increased Efficiency and Interoperability Short description PLIADES advance data space reference architectures, empowering data a a key driver for AI and Robotics innovation. It pioneer AI-enabled tool for seamless data integration across life cycle within and between data spaces. Sustainable data creation method ensure efficient storage with reduced environmental impact. Data privacy and sovereignty are fortified through decentralized protocols. IDS-based broker and data connector revolutionize data sharing, enhancing metadata for improved interoperability. Active data discovery service enable linked data space and real-time data evaluation. Collaborations with EU initiative contribute to a Common European Data Space. Six diverse use case validate advancement in AI and Robotics, spanning mobility, healthcare, industry, energy, and green deal sectors. IDSAs contribution The project capitalizes on the IDS-RAM to comprehensively analyze technical, functional, and organizational requirement for sovereign data sharing. Through threat and risk analysis, security measure are devised, prioritizing essential feature of trusted connector like App Isolation and Data Usage Control. Utilizing IDS-RAM ensures not only data sovereignty but also secure data sharing and compatibility with diverse protocols. Short description TANGO will establish a stronger cross-sector data sharing. The overall outcome of the project is a novel platform that allows user-friendly, secure, trustworthy, compliant, fair, transparent, accountable, and environmentally sustainable data management. The platform will promote trustworthy and digitally enabled interaction across society, having at it core technology component for distributed, privacy preserving and environmentally sustainable data collection, processing, analysis, sharing and storage. Overall goal TANGO aim at leveraging the power of emerging digital technology to strengthen the privacy for citizen and private/public organizations, reduce cost and improve productivity. It will unlock the innovation potential of digital technology for decentralized, privacy-preserving applications, while making accessible and demonstrating this potential within the GAIA-X and EOSC ecosystem Short description Minimizing waste and pollution in manufacturing enables economic progress and conserve resources. The new research project Zero-SWARM zero-enabling smart networked control framework for agile cyber physical production system of system strives to achieve climate-neutral and digitized manufacturing through the adoption of 5G technology in the European manufacturing sector. The International Data Spaces Association will contribute it expertise in sovereign data sharing in manufacturing. Overall goal The goal of the project is to develop a multidisciplinary, human-centric approach that will lead to technical solution for an open swarm framework, a non-public 5G network, and a digital twin. Zero-SWARM will be a forum where maturing technologies, such a 5G and cloud edge continuum, data technology and analytics (including data space and GAIA-X), and operational technology are co-developed and co-created in 10 different trials. Short description The rising decentralization of the energy system is unveiling an enormous opportunity for energy stakeholder to leverage on big data & AI technology to improve decision making. There are however some barrier hampering the exploitation of this potential, such a the lack of standardized big data architecture for smart grid and regulatory framework not enabling data sharing. Overall goal BD4NRG will deliver a reference architecture for Smart Energy, which aligns BDVA SRIA, IDSA and FIWARE architectures, SAREF standard and extend COSMAG specification to enable B2B multi-party data exchange, while providing full interoperability of leading-edge big data technology with smart grid standard and operational frameworks. IDSA will contribute to the definition of the Smart Energy reference architecture and will lead the Standardisation and clustering activities. Short description Data spaces, platform and marketplace are key to unleash the potential of sovereign data sharing in Europe. However, data sharing and data interoperability are still at their infancy. The DataBri-X project aim at equipping European Data Spaces, platform and marketplace and their wide range of stakeholder with a holistic and flexible data governance process and a seamless integrated standards-based toolbox for data- and metadata management. Overall goal The goal is to create a toolbox that will improve the interoperability, usability, discoverability, quality, and integrity of data and metadata, with the aim of making data set ready for expanded digital value creation in the context of European Data Spaces. Short description This coordination and support action will set up and operate a Support Centre to operationalize the European Strategy for Data and facilitate common data space that collectively create an interoperable data sharing environment. The aim is to enable data reuse and secondary use within and across sectors, fully respecting EU values, and contributing to the European economy and society. Overall goal The DSSC explores the need of the data space initiatives, the common requirements, and best practices. By distilling existing solutions, integrating what works, and closing gap of what is missing, the DSSC delivers the Data Spaces Blueprint, composed of common building block encompassing the business, legal, operational, technical and societal aspect of data spaces. The Blueprint continuously evolves with a user-centric approach, a the result of co-creation with the stakeholders. DISCO Data-driven, Integrated, Syncro-modal, Collaborative and Optimised urban freight meta model for a new generation of urban logistics and planning with data sharing at European Living Labs Short description DISCO aim to create a European urban freight (UF) data space that serf a a one-stop-shop for sharing data on digital urban logistics solutions. Through real-life demonstrations, DISCO will prove the value of this ecosystem and it replicable use cases. The project focus on transforming urban planning and land use by establishing an open and collaborative UF Data Space with smart governance. This framework encourages purpose-oriented data sharing, improves urban logistics planning, and reduces dependence on private digital platforms. IDSA will onboard the participant in data spaces, prepare an onboarding toolkit and give the living lab visibility on the IDSA data space radar. Overall goal DISCO expands the scope of Sustainable Urban Mobility Plans (SUMPs) to drive data-driven Sustainable Urban Logistics Planning (SULPs) across various urban areas. By optimizing city freight flow and enhancing accessibility, DISCO enables well-informed planning and optimized land use within a larger, global context. Short description Data sharing in the energy sector is lagging, mainly due to lack of trust, privacy breach risk and business model immaturity. In that respect, Enershare will deliver a Reference Architecture for an European Energy Data Space, which hybridizes SGAM with IDSA and Gaia-X architectures. The project will develop building block for interoperability, trust, data value and governance that are IDS-compliant and adapted to the energy sector. The overallEnershareframework will be applied, implemented,demonstrated, and validated in 7 real-life pilots, 11 use cases, across 7countries. Short description FAME will develop, deploy and launch a federated data marketplace for Embedded Finance (EmFi). The project will extend a data marketplace infrastructure in three directions: 1) secure, interoperable and compliant data sharing across multiple federated cloud-based data provider in line with new European initiative such a GAIA-X; 2) decentralized trading of data asset using blockchain tokenization techniques; 3) integration of trusted and energy-efficient (EE) analytics. FAME will be connected to more than 12 data marketplace operated by project partners, a well a other data infrastructures. Through this process, the FAME marketplace catalog will be populated with more than 1000 data assets. HEDGE-IoT Holistic Approach towards Empowerment of the DiGitalization of the Energy Ecosystem through adoption of IoT solution Short description HEDGE-IoT introduces a novel Digital Framework for energy systems, deploying IoT asset from behind-the-meter to the Transmission System Operator level. By integrating AI/ML tool at the edge and cloud layers, it enhances system intelligence. Bridging the cloud/edge continuum, HEDGE-IoT foster federated applications, boosting the hosting capacity of Renewable Energy Sources (RES) and creating new market opportunities. The framework emphasizes IoT standardization and interoperable energy services, supported by pillars: Technology Facilitator, Interoperability, Standardization, and Digital Energy Ecosystem Enabling. It engages with EU IoT initiative and prioritizes stakeholder involvement, addressing IoT ethic for inclusivity. Scalability study and connection with innovator and SMEs ensure effectiveness and drive innovation within the IoT ecosystem. IDSAs contribution HEDGE-IoT will utilize IDSA asset such a the IDSA Reference architecture Model and the IDSA Rulebook, emphasizing semantic and technological interoperability, trust, data sovereignty, data value, and governance. The project will tailor these framework to edge/cloud application within IoT infrastructure, interfacing with legacy equipment. Key component like IDS-compliant connector and a central Context Broker will be integrated into HEDGE-IoTs proposed reference architecture. ODEON - federated data and intelligence Orchestration & sharing for the Digital Energy transition Short description Significant stride have been made toward the Twin Transition, yet the recent energy crisis exposed the EUs vulnerability and reliance on external energy sources. This underscore the imperative to bolster RES integration across electricity, transport, and building sectors. ODEON envisions an inclusive ecosystem fostering resilient energy system through distributed flexibility. It introduces a reliable, scalable federated technological frameworkthe ODEON Cloud-Edge Data and Intelligence Service Platform. This platform, including Federated Energy Data Spaces and AI Containers, facilitates innovative, data-driven energy services. Validated in large-scale demo across diverse contexts, ODEON aim for widespread replication and market adoption. IDSAs contribution In conjunction with the IDS RAM v4.2, the project will develop an overall architecture for data sharing, along with technical specification for key component and their functionalities. This involves translating requirement into specific feature and organizing them into modular components. Moreover, the initiative will consider the building and mobility data modeling landscape and will draw from the work of IDSA on semantic interoperability, including the Energy Interoperability Taskforce and the IDS Vocabulary Hub. OPENVERSE - OPEN and co-created metaVERSe for Europe Short description Europe envisions an open, transparent, and inclusive Metaverse, prioritizing ethical and environmental responsibility while restoring EU industry technological sovereignty globally. This European Metaverse promise higher accessibility, freedom, and equitable resource distribution, along with interoperability, privacy, and security. It foster innovation, creativity, and social benefit through collaborative environments. OPENVERSE aim to establish this Metaverse by building a knowledge base, fostering stakeholder communities, and testing user co-creation and XR methodologies. It address ethical, legal, and governance challenges, proposing industry standard and a roadmap for the Open Metaverse in Europe and beyond. Short description Only with the help of innovative data-driven process can the green, circular and digital transformation of European production succeed. Companies that successfully implement decision support based on AI, Digital Threads and Digital Twin solution will remain competitive in the long run. For this, RE4DY proposes the core concept of data a a product to facilitate the implementation of digital continuity across data spaces. Overall goal The project will show how European Industry 4.0 can build unique data-driven digital value network to remain competitive through sovereign data exchange in virtual data space across all production phases. Short description Smart Health utilizes AI, cloud computing, and IoT to integrate health data and foster innovative healthcare solutions. The European Commission prioritizes the creation of a European Health Data Space, improving data exchange and access. Also regional strategy in Bulgaria, Romania, Greece, and Cyprus stress the significance of digitalized healthcare. To establish a Southeast Europe Smart Health Innovation Ecosystem, a coordinated approach is crucial. Overall goal VELES aim to enhance innovation excellence in Southeast EU by creating a sustainable innovation ecosystem, supported by a Regional Smart Health Data Space. The project includes a framework, strategy, and action plan for the adoption of secure digital solution in healthcare. IDSA will play a crucial role in supporting the development and implementation of the methodological framework. VELES will demonstrate the Regional Smart Health Data Space through four interrelated initiative focused on cancer treatment, personalized/precision medicine for Alzheimers, cerebral tumors, and dementia. The project goal is to promote regional and national health data sharing strategies, improve clinical practice, and empower citizen with access to innovative and secure digital health services. Any questions? Contact us! (healthcare) | EROSKI S.COOP (retail) | The technology coordinator is IKERLAN (a leading knowledge transfer center providing competitive value to companies) SUCCESS: Seeks to promote and research the necessary technology for the definition of a reference architecture, operational models, adoption of standard and development for a data space based on the common technical framework proposed by DSBA members, extending it main service to favor the development of artificial intelligence with guarantee of traceability, security, and governance of the data and services. BENEFITS: Aims to provide the country with a reliable data space that enables company to offer new concept of high-added value service based on data sharing, through the servitization of collaborative artificial intelligence for the productization and monetization of their data and industry knowledge in new business models. COMPONENTS: Will develop new service in the field of artificial intelligence and will explore current IDS component implementation (focusing on Connectors, Metadatabroker, and IdentityProviders) in order to select one of them to rely on. LEARN MORE: MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY EGOKIA MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY - an international firm specializing in the development of automatization and assembly solution for various sectors. It operates 6 production plant around the world and is part of the largest cooperative group in the world | IKERLAN Technical research center and member of IDSA CHALLENGE: EGOKIA solution allows collaborative learning and knowledge sharing between geographically distributed plants, integrating headquarters in Basque Country and domain experts. Thanks to the data space, data, and AI asset can be securely shared throughout different corporate site and a new knowledge-based economy emerges. SUCCESS: Deploys an architecture based on IDSA connectors, linking Mondragon Assemblys data and AI platform from different corporate sites. With this new reliable data space, we extend the lifecycle of artificial intelligence models, enhance their capabilities, and facilitate trusted access and use of it asset by EGOKIA participants. BENEFITS: NEW BUSINESS MODEL: A new business model based on AI service and a knowledge-based economy. RELIABLE AI SOLUTIONS: A "standardized", flexible, and secure solution to break data silo to share and complete AI asset and process between trusted organization and production plants. Measurable benefit can be listed as: Up to 30% quality on model thanks to the application of federated learning techniques, reduce inversion and time to market on IA-based solution or lower communication loads. STANDARIZED DATA SPACE The organization is ready to take part in the knowledge economy with other entities, domain experts, and technology providers. COMPONENTS: Data Space connector 8.0.2 Metada Broker 5.0.3 Identity Provider 1.6.0 Gaia-X4KI A sovereign data and service ecosystem for artificial intelligence in automotive development, production, and operation DLR | T-Systems | Capgemini Engineering | Continental | IAV | Intel | Conweaver | HighQSoft | Reuschlaw | STTech | Fraunhofer ITWM | Fraunhofer ISST | Hochschule Offenburg | Leibniz Universitt Hannover | Technische Hochschule Ingolstadt CHALLENGE: Autonomous driving scenario and the industrial production of required device face a broad range of challenge related to data sovereignty and security. In particular, transfer of large, sensitive file and service in a policy-conform way are addressed in the prototypes. SUCCESS: The solution are cloud-based and are embedded in existing industrial cloud landscape to enhance data sovereignty of participant in complex data exchange relations. BENEFITS: Gaia-X4KI connects various stakeholder and their diverse system landscape from the complete autonomous driving development lifecycle. COMPONENTS: Eclipse Dataspace Components (EDC) and EDC MVD including Connector, Federated Catalog, Identity Hub, Registration Service PREREQUISITES: The data space is currently in development and being tested inside the project. It base on open source components. LEARN MORE: Introduction IKERLAN is a leading knowledge transfer technological centre providing competitive value to companies. We seek for excellence in R&D&i, thanks to the continuous adaptation to the need of our customer and the proximity with the business reality. Faithful to our mission, we have been working daily since 1974 to develop solution that allow our customer to become more and more competitive. We are a cooperative member of the MONDRAGON Corporation and the Basque Research and Technology Alliance (BRTA). Business Expertise Thanks to a unique cooperation model, which combine technology transfer activities, internal research and training of highly qualified personnel, IKERLAN is currently the trusted technological partner of major company in the country. To meet our goal, we are structured into two technological specialization units: ELECTRONICS, INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGIES ENERGY AND MECHATRONICS IKERLAN is a center that is dynamic and open to the world. We are an accredited agent of the Basque Network of Science, Technology, and Innovation and of the Spanish Federation of Technology Centres. We have a major cooperation network integrated with renowned European center and universities, with which we conduct activity of research and training of researchers. Technical Expertise Mission: To solve the technological challenge of the companies, improve their competitiveness and collaborate with the sustainable social and economic development of the environment, all of that from a position of technological leadership and with differential ability in their area of expertise. Vission: Technological center, cooperative and non-profit, known a the European leader in it area of specialization, with an exceptional cohesive human team, that provides value to the company and society. Contact Details Santiago Charramendieta Website Increased visibility of order delivery process VTT | Wrtsil | Uwira CHALLENGE: The use case revolves around expediting and enhancing transparency between a focal company of a manufacturing ecosystem (OEM) and it supplier in their production order management processes. The existing communication method have proven inadequate in facilitating efficient and adaptable exchange between the two entities. By facilitating transparency and fostering a more seamless integration between the IT system of both companies, the management of product order can be streamlined, resulting in heightened efficiency and a reduction in errors. SUCCESS: The objective is to facilitate a reliable and seamless flow of data between the OEM and it supplier by establishing a dedicated data space. The developed solution will be seamlessly integrated with pre-existing IT infrastructure of both company and the solution is grounded in the framework of the IDS reference architecture. The OEM can selectively disclose data from their production environment to the supplier without the fear of data leakages. Respectively, the supplier receives only the data that are essential for them and there is no need to locally extract meaningful insight and valuable information from big data sets. BENEFITS: The established data space solution ha the potential to significantly enhance transparency between the OEM and the supplier. This give rise to several potential benefits, including: Effective Communication: Transparent communication help in conveying accurate information about product specifications, requirements, changes, and timelines. Risk Management: Sharing information about potential risks, such a change in demand or design modifications, allows supplier to proactively address these issues. Furthermore, in time of disruptions, such a supply shortage or unexpected market shifts, transparent communication help both party respond more effectively. Cost Efficiency: Transparent communication allows both party to work together to find cost-effective solutions. COMPONENTS: IDS connector - serve a the communication interface linking the two company and their existing IT systems. With IDS connectors, a data provider can define the rule and condition (usage policies) under which data are shared with a data consumer. DAPS - enables connector to authenticate themselves using X.509 certificates. After successful authentication, the DAPS issue OAuth2 access token for connectors, who need these token to access the service and data of other connectors. Metadata Broker store information about the data end-points offered by the participants. The broker provides a query interface for connector and can hence be considered a the search engine in this use case. LEARN MORE: Communities The industry of tomorrow: IDS community International data space work across all industry and domain of activity. To that end, technologies, methods, organizational concept and governance structure must be designed generically, to work with all. At the same time, IDS concept must be adaptable to important cross-sector domain of activity that have specific requirements. Thats where IDS Communities come in. IDS Communities are aligning tomorrow data solution with common business need There are currently four IDS Communities, consisting of relevant stakeholder from industry, research and government, that are developing blueprint for data sovereignty inthe area of mobility, industry, logistics and medicine. a Industrial Community IDSAs broad goal is data sovereignty across a secure, vendor-independent network. But we know that industrial business ecosystem also have their own special requirement standards, capabilities, governance and more that will drive the future of global production and smart manufacturing. The IDS-I Community exists to tailor IDS principle and technology to these unique demands. show more The Industrial Community is an international coalition of industry partner that unites more than 60 organization from around the world. The. objective: Mapping IDS concept and principle of data sovereignty to the requirement of the industrial sector. The IDS-I Community will strengthen the link between IDSA and the Platform Industrie 4.0 a well a the Industrial Internet Consortium and formal liaison partner in the industrial sector, such a the Robot Revolution Initiative, the Industrial Value Chain Initiative, the Data Trading Alliance and the OPC-Foundation. On a mission for global industry Gathering requirement for data sovereignty for industry applications. Mapping requirement to IDS and Platform Industrie 4.0, a platform developed by Germany to digitally transform industry. Derive profile of IDSA/PI4.0 specification that support the requirement in industrial business eco-systems on the basis of standard and by mean of common governance models. Explore the Industrial Communitys position paper Data Sovereignty Requirements Analysis of Manufacturing Use Cases Position Paper 2022 | Version 1.0 Data Sovereignty Critical Success Factor for the Manufacturing Industry Position Paper 2021 | Version 1.0 Mobility Community IDSAs mobility community aim to drive Europes automotive sector into the future. This sector is a crucible of innovation thats mission-critical economically and politically for Europe, in the global marketplace. A successful mobile future is also key to maintaining and growing the nearly 14 million job the industry currently provides in Europe. Promote IDS for better mobility Success requires mobility to be better forits users.Customer-centricity is no secret to business success. Therefore,the key is to be better. And since IDS became an official in 2020, now is the time. Create and communicate content The mobility community creates content to add a new and valuable dimension to the industry current perspective on the future of mobility. There is no shortage of story on mobility. Our contribution is to show how IDS will take thing to the next level. Then, we have to spread the word, evangelize, and get decisionmakers to understand why IDS need to be part of their next-generation data solutions. Read our mobility paper IDSA anthology Read our mobility story Catena-X for GAIA-X: Will Data Space Be the Word of 2021? Prof. Dr. Chris Schlueter Langdon Mobility with IDS: Adding tht "N" in NPM to RealLab HH Prof. Dr. Chris Schlueter Langdon Metamorphosis of Auto into Mobility Prof. Dr. Chris Schlueter Langdon Logistics Community The IDSA logistics community wa formed to drive industrial data space that address the characteristic and complex nature of global supply chain and transportation/distribution networks. The community aim to adapt and extend the general concept of IDS to provide a specific implementation of logistics data spaces. Learn more about the Logistics Community Logistics Community Whitepaper, PDF Medical Community Data is rapidlly becoming the new horizon of health care, enabling powerful tool and method for P4 medicine (preventive, predictive, participatory, personalized). Medical data is often connected to individual health records, requiring scrupulous attention toprivacy and security concerns. Data sovereignty becomes paramount. The IDSA Medical Communitys top priorities: Co-creation: Joint identification of real-world problem in the health care and life science industry Implementation: Realization of use case on top of industry solution Data sovereignty: Development of guideline and concept ensuring the sovereignty of the individual (patient or health care consumer) a data owner Data economics: Definition of business model for business driven by health care data, with special attention attention to data ethic and legal affair More Leaflet Learn more about the IDS community Magazine Read our magazine for more insight on IDSA Read the new position paper written by the Industrial Community Any questions? Contact us! Start an IDS Community Find partner in your domain or with asimilar scope and form an alliance with aclear mission statement. Reach out to theIDSA Head Office for support in settling theIDSA community. Communities Stay updated with u Share this page: International Data Spaces e. V. LEARN MORE: Liaisons Connecting the dot Major digital initiative around the world are working with IDSA to connect IDS concept and standard with broad-based national and industry digital strategies, business need and specific applications. What our liaison do Industries need to agree on function and interface for platforms, reference architecture and interaction protocol that have the potential to create market and opportunity for the data economy of the future. This is not only true for the manufacturing sector but also for agriculture, healthcare, energy, public administration, municipality and much more. Our liaison are partner organization and initiative with whom we collaborate to align our common work, share best practice and support each other in standardization activities. Some company are member of multiple initiatives, so there is strong demand and support for the alignment of these approaches. Find out more about them below. Big Data Value Association (BDVA) BDVA is an industry-driven, international, not-for-profit organization that is working with IDSA to enable a European solution for Big Data and the AI-driven data economy. BDVA offer expertise and people who bring a functional point of view to the table, complementing IDSAs international approach and expertise in data sharing in a data economy. The liaison relationship ha the potential to help build an onboarding community, enabling user to implement IDS component in an ecosystem of trust, and integrate BD/AI application and platform into the ecosystem to deliver functionality to potential customers. Data Intelligence Offensive (DIO) The Data Intelligence Offensive is a cooperative platform of individuals, companies, organization and public authority to promote data management and the optimized use of technologies. The liaison with IDSA is based on our shared goal of a data economy based on trust and ethics; security and data sovereignty; data quality and interoperability; and establishing a cross-domain data ecosystem. Data Sharing Coalition The Data Sharing Coalition is an open and growing international initiative that is working to unlock the value of cross-sectoral data sharing. The group aim to drive sovereign cross-sectoral data sharing by enabling interoperability between data-sharing initiative and strengthening individual initiatives. IDSA is a founding member. Data Society Alliance (DSA) / DATA-EX The purpose of DSA is to set up technical and systematic environment so that user can easily judge, collect and utilize data that they seek. The aim of the liaison relationship with IDSA is to focus on data quality for cross-company data exchange and on certification and architecture for data sharing. Part of that is to promote DATA-EX, a platform for cross-disciplinary data collaboration, that link existing data collaboration efforts. Furthermore, IDSA and DSA will intensively consult on question and development with respect to data exchange, data catalog and data marketplaces. FIWARE FIWARE is a curated framework of open-source platform component that can be assembled together with other third-party component to accelerate the development of smart solutions. The liaison between IDSA and FIWARE is designed to expand and actualize Europes focus on the secure and sovereign exchange of data between company and organization in a way that is agnostic with regard to technologies, platform and vendors. IDSA is a member. Industrial Internet Consortium (IIC) The IIC is a global, non-profit partnership of industry, researcher and academics, bringing together the organization and technology to accelerate the growth of the industrial internet. Data is a key economic factor in the success of the industrial internet, making collaboration between the IIC and IDSA critical on standard and certification for data spaces. The IDS provides valuable resource for application that are compliant with IICs reference architecture, and IIC help extend the effectiveness of key aspect of IDS. Industrial Valuechain Initiative (IVI) The Industrial Valuechain Initiative is working to design a new society in which manufacturing and IT are integrated. The IVI is specifically concerned with the human factor and how manufacturing with people will change in the IoT era. Industrial data sharing is key to a number of IVI initiatives, so alignment between IVI and IDSA concept is critical. Although the two organization approach are not identical, they are complementary, and the in-depth analysis of data privacy and security element by the IDSA enables the business-related consideration proposed by IVI. iSHARE iSHARE is a not-for-profit initiative that ha developed a data sharing scheme to enable organization to provide access to their data to other parties. iSHARE focus on defining data usage rule around identification, authorization and authentication. The basic principle underlying iSHARE, a it is for IDSA, is data sovereignty. Today, iSHARE implement legal contract for the enforcement of the data usage terms. iSHARE ha been live since 2018, so it protocol can kick-start IDS implementation by specifying iSHARE a a trust option in order to achieve the first and conditional level of data sovereignty. This serf a a strong foundation for the market adoption of IDS. IDSA is a member. OPC Foundation OPC is the interoperability standard for the secure and reliable exchange of data in the industrial automation space and other area of industry. The OPC Foundation and IDSA work together to develop the infrastructure necessary for the two organization to promote systemwide interoperability. The goal is to deploy an interoperability standard that is platform-independent and ensures the seamless flow of information among device from multiple vendors. Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC) The Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC) is an international non-profit consortium aiming to make geospatial (location) information and data service FAIR Finadable, Accessable, interoperable, Reusable. The collaboration between OGC and IDSA aim to synchronize the activity of both organizations, fostering a collaborative environment for technical standard to seamlessly interoperate.This will be achieved in part through joint participation in potential future project and initiatives, particularly in the area of global supply chains, intelligent transport, and smart city data spaces. The two organization have already identified several ongoing or completed project relevant to their work together, including:,,,&,,,, and others. Robot Revolution & Industrial IoT Initiative (RRI) The RRI is a private-led organizational platform to promote the Robot Revolution a described in The New Robot Strategy. This document defines robot a a system that executes task by using digital and network technology, advanced sensors, and artificial intelligence. One of the organization key goal is to use IoT technology to demonstrate the viability and commercial potential of the new robot age. The parallel and synergy with IDSA concept are clear. Join us! If your organization is interested in joining force with the IDSA, email u at . The IDSA provides a reference architecture for trustworthy and secure data exchange a well a a reference implementation and a growing number of product and solution for our members. The focus on data sovereignty already extends the Plattform Industrie 4.0, the Industrial Internet Consortium Reference Architecture, FIWARE and others. More Position paper Jointly Paving the Way for a Data Driven Digitalisation of European Industry Position paper Implementing the European Strategy on Data. (healthcare) | EROSKI S.COOP (retail) | The technology coordinator is IKERLAN (a leading knowledge transfer center providing competitive value to companies) SUCCESS: Seeks to promote and research the necessary technology for the definition of a reference architecture, operational models, adoption of standard and development for a data space based on the common technical framework proposed by DSBA members, extending it main service to favor the development of artificial intelligence with guarantee of traceability, security, and governance of the data and services. BENEFITS: Aims to provide the country with a reliable data space that enables company to offer new concept of high-added value service based on data sharing, through the servitization of collaborative artificial intelligence for the productization and monetization of their data and industry knowledge in new business models. COMPONENTS: Will develop new service in the field of artificial intelligence and will explore current IDS component implementation (focusing on Connectors, Metadatabroker, and IdentityProviders) in order to select one of them to rely on. LEARN MORE: MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY EGOKIA MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY - an international firm specializing in the development of automatization and assembly solution for various sectors. It operates 6 production plant around the world and is part of the largest cooperative group in the world | IKERLAN Technical research center and member of IDSA CHALLENGE: EGOKIA solution allows collaborative learning and knowledge sharing between geographically distributed plants, integrating headquarters in Basque Country and domain experts. Thanks to the data space, data, and AI asset can be securely shared throughout different corporate site and a new knowledge-based economy emerges. SUCCESS: Deploys an architecture based on IDSA connectors, linking Mondragon Assemblys data and AI platform from different corporate sites. With this new reliable data space, we extend the lifecycle of artificial intelligence models, enhance their capabilities, and facilitate trusted access and use of it asset by EGOKIA participants. BENEFITS: NEW BUSINESS MODEL: A new business model based on AI service and a knowledge-based economy. RELIABLE AI SOLUTIONS: A "standardized", flexible, and secure solution to break data silo to share and complete AI asset and process between trusted organization and production plants. Measurable benefit can be listed as: Up to 30% quality on model thanks to the application of federated learning techniques, reduce inversion and time to market on IA-based solution or lower communication loads. STANDARIZED DATA SPACE The organization is ready to take part in the knowledge economy with other entities, domain experts, and technology providers. COMPONENTS: Data Space connector 8.0.2 Metada Broker 5.0.3 Identity Provider 1.6.0 Gaia-X4KI A sovereign data and service ecosystem for artificial intelligence in automotive development, production, and operation DLR | T-Systems | Capgemini Engineering | Continental | IAV | Intel | Conweaver | HighQSoft | Reuschlaw | STTech | Fraunhofer ITWM | Fraunhofer ISST | Hochschule Offenburg | Leibniz Universitt Hannover | Technische Hochschule Ingolstadt CHALLENGE: Autonomous driving scenario and the industrial production of required device face a broad range of challenge related to data sovereignty and security. In particular, transfer of large, sensitive file and service in a policy-conform way are addressed in the prototypes. SUCCESS: The solution are cloud-based and are embedded in existing industrial cloud landscape to enhance data sovereignty of participant in complex data exchange relations. BENEFITS: Gaia-X4KI connects various stakeholder and their diverse system landscape from the complete autonomous driving development lifecycle. COMPONENTS: Eclipse Dataspace Components (EDC) and EDC MVD including Connector, Federated Catalog, Identity Hub, Registration Service PREREQUISITES: The data space is currently in development and being tested inside the project. It base on open source components. LEARN MORE: Introduction IKERLAN is a leading knowledge transfer technological centre providing competitive value to companies. We seek for excellence in R&D&i, thanks to the continuous adaptation to the need of our customer and the proximity with the business reality. Faithful to our mission, we have been working daily since 1974 to develop solution that allow our customer to become more and more competitive. We are a cooperative member of the MONDRAGON Corporation and the Basque Research and Technology Alliance (BRTA). Business Expertise Thanks to a unique cooperation model, which combine technology transfer activities, internal research and training of highly qualified personnel, IKERLAN is currently the trusted technological partner of major company in the country. To meet our goal, we are structured into two technological specialization units: ELECTRONICS, INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGIES ENERGY AND MECHATRONICS IKERLAN is a center that is dynamic and open to the world. We are an accredited agent of the Basque Network of Science, Technology, and Innovation and of the Spanish Federation of Technology Centres. We have a major cooperation network integrated with renowned European center and universities, with which we conduct activity of research and training of researchers. Technical Expertise Mission: To solve the technological challenge of the companies, improve their competitiveness and collaborate with the sustainable social and economic development of the environment, all of that from a position of technological leadership and with differential ability in their area of expertise. Vission: Technological center, cooperative and non-profit, known a the European leader in it area of specialization, with an exceptional cohesive human team, that provides value to the company and society. Contact Details Santiago Charramendieta Website Increased visibility of order delivery process VTT | Wrtsil | Uwira CHALLENGE: The use case revolves around expediting and enhancing transparency between a focal company of a manufacturing ecosystem (OEM) and it supplier in their production order management processes. The existing communication method have proven inadequate in facilitating efficient and adaptable exchange between the two entities. By facilitating transparency and fostering a more seamless integration between the IT system of both companies, the management of product order can be streamlined, resulting in heightened efficiency and a reduction in errors. SUCCESS: The objective is to facilitate a reliable and seamless flow of data between the OEM and it supplier by establishing a dedicated data space. The developed solution will be seamlessly integrated with pre-existing IT infrastructure of both company and the solution is grounded in the framework of the IDS reference architecture. The OEM can selectively disclose data from their production environment to the supplier without the fear of data leakages. Respectively, the supplier receives only the data that are essential for them and there is no need to locally extract meaningful insight and valuable information from big data sets. BENEFITS: The established data space solution ha the potential to significantly enhance transparency between the OEM and the supplier. This give rise to several potential benefits, including: Effective Communication: Transparent communication help in conveying accurate information about product specifications, requirements, changes, and timelines. Risk Management: Sharing information about potential risks, such a change in demand or design modifications, allows supplier to proactively address these issues. Furthermore, in time of disruptions, such a supply shortage or unexpected market shifts, transparent communication help both party respond more effectively. Cost Efficiency: Transparent communication allows both party to work together to find cost-effective solutions. COMPONENTS: IDS connector - serve a the communication interface linking the two company and their existing IT systems. With IDS connectors, a data provider can define the rule and condition (usage policies) under which data are shared with a data consumer. DAPS - enables connector to authenticate themselves using X.509 certificates. After successful authentication, the DAPS issue OAuth2 access token for connectors, who need these token to access the service and data of other connectors. Metadata Broker store information about the data end-points offered by the participants. The broker provides a query interface for connector and can hence be considered a the search engine in this use case. LEARN MORE: Real systems, real standard connect to all the technical specification for implementing IDS Unlocking the power of data across the globe take brains, and here where youll find the brain of our operation. Next-level, federated data exchange ecosystem blueprint check. Super-secure connector design check. Rigorous, transparent certification process based on European value and standard check. But dont take our word for it. Its all here so you can check The IDS Reference Architecture Model Data is rapidly becoming business most valuable asset but it can only deliver on it full value when you put it into use and share it in way that you, a the data provider, determine and control. International data space (IDS) are where this kind of trustworthy, self-determined exchange can happen, and our Reference Architecture Model (IDSRAM) set the standard for building data-driven ecosystems, product and services. Heres where youll find everything you need to know to get started. IDS reference testbed The IDS concepts, architecture, and component form the standard for sovereign data sharing. To move from theory to practice and to achieve large-scale adoption, technical component must be tested for interoperability compliance. For this reason, we have created the IDS Reference Testbed. Data connector report The Data Connector Reportcomprehensively document all existing implementation of data connector and offer valuable information on their present state of development and usage. Certification Our goal is to establish international data space that guarantee data sovereignty and safe collaboration between partners. The foundation of IDS is trust, which must be established through a rigorous, transparent certification process. Find out more here. Our keyword is data sovereigntythe IDS architecture ensures data sovereignty for those who make data available in data ecosystems. This mean that data provider always keep control. They decide who us their data for how long, for which application and according to which term & conditions. Sonia Jimenez Moreno, Senior Consultant Programme & Stakeholder Management, IDSA Any questions? Contact us! No website or brochure can replace a personal conversation about your goal and your topics. Our team is looking forward to your call! LEARN MORE: Reference Architecture Lets Get Real: The IDS Reference Architecture Model Data is rapidly becoming business most valuable asset but it can only deliver on it full value when you put it into use and share it in way that you, a the data provider, determine and control. International data space (IDS) are where this kind of trustworthy, self-determined exchange can happen, and our Reference Architecture Model (IDS-RAM) set the standard for building data-driven ecosystems, product and services. Heres where youll find everything you need to know to get started. Data is your most valuable asset Data will increasingly be a key source of competitive advantageforthe future ofglobal business but only if you can share it securely while confidently self-determining how it can be used. Data space are where this kind of secure exchange can happen, and IDS-RAM set the standard for building IDS ecosystems, product and services. The IDS-RAM is the beating heart of the IDS it comprises the standard for secure and sovereign data exchange, certification and governance for across Europe and around the world. By loading the video, you agree to YouTube's privacy policy. Always unblock YouTube What is the IDS-RAM? To build the IDS Reference Architecture Model, company collaborated with scientists, technologist and policymakers. The result is a conceptual framework for designing and implementing IDS-compliant data spaces.It defines the key components, their interactions, and the principle that govern the architecture of an IDS data space. Role model Role model: IDS-RAM serf a a practical blueprint, but also a an exemplar of the ethical and design principle that well ensure trustworthiness in data exchange and true data sovereignty in the data economy of the future. Data sovereignty Data sovereignty: in the open, federated data marketplace we envision, the IDS-RAM enables self-determination and control over data usage to remain in the hand of those who collect, store and provide it, rather than passing to large data exchange platform and others, a is often the case today. Information model The IDS-RAMs information model is open, agnostic with regard to technology and domains. This approach enables data exchange within a trusted ecosystem while preserving data sovereignty. The information model enables the comprehensive description of data asset and interoperability required for this kind of exchange. Usage policy enforcement The IDS-RAM provides a framework for technically enforced agreement for data sharing in addition to existing, legally binding contracts. This serf to underwrite trust in the system. The working version of the IDS-RAM 4.0 is available on GitHub. Whether you have a question, want to request a change, or contribute to the text: Just join IDSA on GitHub. Next version of the IDS Reference Architecture Model: RAM 5 We have started working on the next version of the IDS-RAM, which will be more modular and flexible, providing architectural guidance and support for building a dataspace, participating in one, or providing vale added data space services. RAM 5 will be aligned with the latest development in IDSA and Data Spaces. Aligned RAM 5 is aligned with the latest development in the Dataspace protocol, IDSA Rulebook, DSSC blueprint and more. Decentralized RAM 5 includes all variant of data space authorities: centralized, federated/distributed, decentralized, e.g. in the trust framework. Diverse RAM 5 provides architectural guidance for all role in data spaces: Data space authorities, participants, service providers. Modular RAM 5 will have a modular approach instead of a linear approach for structuring the five layer and three perspectives. Would you like to co-create RAM 5 with us? Please register your interest using this or contact the IDSA team. Any questions? Contact us! Your contact person:Ilknur ChulaniSenior Program Manager Get IDS certified now! The IDS certification is of fundamental importance for a trustworthy and sovereign data exchange. Reference Architecture Stay updated with u Share this page: International Data Spaces e. V. LEARN MORE: Dataspace Protocol overview Advancing interoperability:the Dataspace Protocol The Dataspace Protocol is at the very core of the technical implementation of every data space component and guarantee interoperability between component and data space participants. What is the Dataspace Protocol Are you familiar with the Internet Protocol? At some point, everyone agreed on the HTTP standard to transport data between a web server and a browser. Now, picture a similar need for data spacesa universal protocol that doesnt favor specific business model or technical components. Enter the . This detailed set of rule is designed to facilitate seamless data sharing between data space component and participants. The Dataspace Protocol ensures trust and interoperability, defining the needed schema and protocol for cataloging data, negotiating contract and usage agreement within a data space. Organizations using this protocol can align with industry standards, foster best practices, and unlock new data-driven business model and opportunities. is version () of the Dataspace Protocol specification is the release candidate and considered to be stable. Further change shall not affect conformity. Since the specification is stable with change in details. The user-friendly version of the Dataspace Protocol is accessible in the IDSA Knowledge Base. For the version history and changes, refer to the GitHub Repository. Relation to the IDS-RAM The provides guidance on implementing functional requirement and design choice for component within a data space, guaranteeing essential data sovereignty for reliable data exchange. The Dataspace Protocol effectively put into practice the principle and guideline outlined in the IDS-RAM. It set forth technical specification and mechanism for standardized , ensuring consistent interaction among components. This promotes interoperability and maintains data sovereignty within data spaces. Relation to the IDSA Rulebook In the , IDSA describes at an organizational level the interaction of role and component in a data space, which create the foundation for trust and core function of a data space. It clarifies the business level structure and process of a data space. The Dataspace Protocol provides the to implement the compliance, trust, and security measure dictated by the IDSA Rulebook, ensuring that data transaction adhere to the standard and policy detailed in IDSA Rulebook. Relation to standardization The Dataspace Protocol provides a standardized set of rule and format for data exchange. This is necessary for interoperability, allowing different system and organization to communicate in a seamless way. As part of IDSAs goal to establish the Dataspace Protocol a an ISO standard, plan are underway to integrate the specification document IDSA ha created for the Dataspace Protocol with a compatibility kit an essential software component, crafted by the developer community. This integration is set to take place within the . Why we need the Dataspace Protocol When organization or company want to share data, they need to provide detail about the data to enable it transfer. The Dataspace Protocol explains how this information is provided: It outline how are presented a and how rule about data usage are expressed. It defines how governing data usage are written and negotiated electronically. It explains how datasets are accessed using specific protocols. The interaction within a data space involve , which implement the described protocols. While most interaction occur between data connectors, some involve other systems. An identity provider validates the identity of a connector, with it structure and content varying between different data spaces. Any questions? Contact us! Your contact person: Anil TurkmayaliSenior Project Manager Join the Working Group Architecture Join our Working Group Architecture and actively contribute to the development of the Dataspace Protocol! Your insight matter be part of the innovation. Dataspace Protocol overview Stay updated with u Share this page: International Data Spaces e. V. Measurable benefit can be listed as: Up to 30% quality on model thanks to the application of federated learning techniques, reduce inversion and time to market on IA-based solution or lower communication loads. In particular, transfer of large, sensitive file and service in a policy-conform way are addressed in the prototypes. SUCCESS: The solution are cloud-based and are embedded in existing industrial cloud landscape to enhance data sovereignty of participant in complex data exchange relations. BENEFITS: Gaia-X4KI connects various stakeholder and their diverse system landscape from the complete autonomous driving development lifecycle. COMPONENTS: Eclipse Dataspace Components (EDC) and EDC MVD including Connector, Federated Catalog, Identity Hub, Registration Service PREREQUISITES: The data space is currently in development and being tested inside the project. It base on open source components. LEARN MORE: Introduction IKERLAN is a leading knowledge transfer technological centre providing competitive value to companies. We seek for excellence in R&D&i, thanks to the continuous adaptation to the need of our customer and the proximity with the business reality. Faithful to our mission, we have been working daily since 1974 to develop solution that allow our customer to become more and more competitive. We are a cooperative member of the MONDRAGON Corporation and the Basque Research and Technology Alliance (BRTA). Business Expertise Thanks to a unique cooperation model, which combine technology transfer activities, internal research and training of highly qualified personnel, IKERLAN is currently the trusted technological partner of major company in the country. To meet our goal, we are structured into two technological specialization units: ELECTRONICS, INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGIES ENERGY AND MECHATRONICS IKERLAN is a center that is dynamic and open to the world. We are an accredited agent of the Basque Network of Science, Technology, and Innovation and of the Spanish Federation of Technology Centres. We have a major cooperation network integrated with renowned European center and universities, with which we conduct activity of research and training of researchers. Technical Expertise Mission: To solve the technological challenge of the companies, improve their competitiveness and collaborate with the sustainable social and economic development of the environment, all of that from a position of technological leadership and with differential ability in their area of expertise. Vission: Technological center, cooperative and non-profit, known a the European leader in it area of specialization, with an exceptional cohesive human team, that provides value to the company and society. Contact Details Santiago Charramendieta Website Increased visibility of order delivery process VTT | Wrtsil | Uwira CHALLENGE: The use case revolves around expediting and enhancing transparency between a focal company of a manufacturing ecosystem (OEM) and it supplier in their production order management processes. The existing communication method have proven inadequate in facilitating efficient and adaptable exchange between the two entities. By facilitating transparency and fostering a more seamless integration between the IT system of both companies, the management of product order can be streamlined, resulting in heightened efficiency and a reduction in errors. SUCCESS: The objective is to facilitate a reliable and seamless flow of data between the OEM and it supplier by establishing a dedicated data space. The developed solution will be seamlessly integrated with pre-existing IT infrastructure of both company and the solution is grounded in the framework of the IDS reference architecture. The OEM can selectively disclose data from their production environment to the supplier without the fear of data leakages. Respectively, the supplier receives only the data that are essential for them and there is no need to locally extract meaningful insight and valuable information from big data sets. BENEFITS: The established data space solution ha the potential to significantly enhance transparency between the OEM and the supplier. This give rise to several potential benefits, including: Effective Communication: Transparent communication help in conveying accurate information about product specifications, requirements, changes, and timelines. Risk Management: Sharing information about potential risks, such a change in demand or design modifications, allows supplier to proactively address these issues. Furthermore, in time of disruptions, such a supply shortage or unexpected market shifts, transparent communication help both party respond more effectively. Cost Efficiency: Transparent communication allows both party to work together to find cost-effective solutions. COMPONENTS: IDS connector - serve a the communication interface linking the two company and their existing IT systems. With IDS connectors, a data provider can define the rule and condition (usage policies) under which data are shared with a data consumer. DAPS - enables connector to authenticate themselves using X.509 certificates. After successful authentication, the DAPS issue OAuth2 access token for connectors, who need these token to access the service and data of other connectors. Metadata Broker store information about the data end-points offered by the participants. The broker provides a query interface for connector and can hence be considered a the search engine in this use case. LEARN MORE: Certification Certification: the basis of trust How can you gain from your valuable data? by sharing it with others in trustworthy partnerships. These partnership are based on data spaces. It is therefore our goal to establish data space that guarantee a safe collaboration between partners. Entrusting data to IDS The foundation of IDS is trust, which is established through a rigorous, transparent certification process. The most important component of a data space is the IDS Connector. To make sure that each IDS Connector behaves a it should, it is certified against specific security standard and so is any participant in data sharing. On this basis of trust the participant can start their actual exchange of data. Transparency through clear process For the certification of participant and components, we are using a certification scheme which defines the rules, and standard of the certification process. The IDS certification scheme follows best practice from internationally accredited certification concepts. a Two complementary type of certification IDS certification ha two parts: First, you prove that the IDS component you are using is built correctly. Second, you need to make sure your IDS component operational environment is supporting data sharing according to the requirement and rules. While the certification of your operational environment focus on security and trust, the component certification also ensures interoperability. Core component certification Here we evaluate and certify the core component of IDS. Do they provide the required functionality and security? a Operational environment certification This evaluation provides an assessment of the trustworthiness of the physical environment, defined processes, and organizational rules. a There are two assurance level available Different company and organization have different data sharing needs, timelines, and budgets. For that reason, we offer two type of assessment to allow for more flexibility. Have a look at the first and simpler one below to the left and see a more complex variant below to the right. a The assurance level 1 checklist approach cover basic requirement for taking part in IDS. It allows you to prove that your IDS Connector is not only interoperable with any other connector in a data space but also complies with the IDS Reference Architecture Model. It is prepared by yourself and focus on basic implementation but also on efficient, non-bureaucratic processes. Before starting the assessment, your component need to go through the IDS reference testbed The assessment is based on a questionnaire, which can be accessed via the IDS Certification portal Youll receive your certificate after youve filled in the questionnaire, uploaded the testing log file to the portal and have been assessed based on that information The checklist approach certification generates significant value for companies; it is the beginning of a journey towards trustworthy and interoperable data space to grow your business. All IDS component must meet a list of certification criterion to prove the provision of the required functionality, interoperability, and level of security. a The IDS assurance level 2 concept review certification is a wonderful way to show your partner in data sharing that you are committed to giving them the highest level of trust. It is proof that your IDS component complies with all requirement in term of functionality and security. The concept review certification is performed by an independent third party: the IDS evaluation facilities. All IDS evaluation facility must go through an extensive approval process for added security. The external concept review includes the examination of documentation a well a the practical testing of the Connector, to ensure the correct implementation of the functional and security requirements. IDS Assurance Level 2 strike the right balance between an independent review and the corresponding costs. This level can be combined with all three trust levels. Receiving the third-party IDS certificatedemonstrates: comprehensive review and testing independent validation credibility by data sharing partner All IDS component must meet a list of certification criterion to prove the provision of the required functionality, interoperability, and level of security. a Operational environment certification This evaluation provides an assessment of the trustworthiness of the physical environment, processes, and organizational rules. a The self-assessment cover basic requirement for taking part in IDS. This allows smaller company to clear the first hurdle to IDS Certification and try out data space participation. It is prepared by yourself and focus on basic but also on efficient, non-bureaucratic process The assessment itself is based on a questionnaire, which can be accessed via the IDS Certification portal. Youll receive your certificate after youve filled in the questionnaire and have been assessed based on that information The IDS Self-assessment Certification generates significant value for companies; it is the beginning of a journey towards trustworthy and interoperable data space to grow your business. All IDS component must meet a list of certification criterion to prove the provision of the required functionality, interoperability, and level of security. a Certified data connector Which data connector are certified? What are the evaluation results? Are there any application remarks? Discover a list of all certified data connectors. Click on the button for more details. T-Systems Data Intelligence Hub (DIH) connector VTT DSIL connector IDS evaluation facility IDSA implementation should be reliable and robust. To this end, data sharing between certified entity using certified core component is encouraged. IDS evaluation facility are accredited laboratory for validating IDS component according to standard formulated by IDSA. The evaluation facility independently oversee the validation of commercial IDS component developed by company in various industries. They are also responsible for preparing the corresponding evaluation report, which is sent to IDSA for subsequent certification. SQS | Software Quality Service SQS is the first approved IDS Evaluation Facility and the accredited laboratory for validating component according to the IDSA standard for rusted and sovereign data sharing. Details: Low barrier to certification IDS Certification is compatible with commonly used security standard likeISO 27001 and IEC 62443. This way, you can reuse existing documentation and setup for IDS certification and minimize your effort significantly. a More Leaflet How to getIDS_certified!
