Emil-Figge-Str. 80 44227 Dortmund, Germany Phone:+49 (0)231 70096 501 2016 2024 | All Rights Reserved | International Data Spaces Association | | | | Follow u Follow u Follow u Follow u Learn more IDS certification scheme Any organization or individual seeking permission to operate component in the International Data Spaces need to pas the Operational Environment Certification which ensures secure process and management of components. Comparably, each IDS component is expected to behave in adherence with IDS specification and to protect the data which is transferred and processed. It shall allow participant to ass the possible consequence of data sharing and provide transparent information. Therefore, component need to pas the Component Certification before they may be used in the IDS. While the certification of organization and individual focus on security and trust, the certification of component additionally refers to compliance with technical requirement ensuring interoperability.To ensure a consistent process in the certification of participant and core components, the IDS us a certification scheme comprising all processes, rules, and standard governing the certification process. The IDS Certification Scheme follows best practice from internationally recognized certification concepts. IDS Certification is described in the IDS Reference Architecture Model (IDS-RAM), a practitioner-oriented guide to designing and implementing architecture for data spaces. Roles in IDS Certification The realization of the IDS certification scheme requires different role responsible for different tasks: applicants, evaluation facilities, and certification body Certification body The certification body oversees the certification process regarding quality assurance and framework governance. It defines standard evaluation procedure and supervises the action of the evaluation facilities. A certificate is granted only if both, the evaluation facility, and the certification body have concluded that all precondition for certification are fulfilled. Evaluation facility Contracted by an applicant, the evaluation facility is responsible for carrying out the detailed technical and/or organizational evaluation work during a certification process. The evaluation facility issue an evaluation report for the respective organization/individual or core component, listing detail regarding the evaluation process and an assessment whether all requirement are properly fulfilled. The approval scheme for evaluation facility can be found . Applicant The applicant is not just the subject of the evaluation and certification process but play an active part in it. An applicant need to actively apply to trigger the certification process. During the certification process, the Applicant provides all necessary material needed for the evaluation and certification of it component or organization and support with question or issue arising. Certification process The certification follows the same process for all certification profile in operational environment and component certification. It consists of the following three phases: Application Phase: The main goal of this stage is the successful start of the IDS evaluation and certification process. Evaluation Phase: The main goal of this stage is the evaluation of an applicant or core component based on the defined evaluation criteria. Certification Phase: The main goal of this stage is the examination of the evaluation report by the certification body, which issue a certificate if the result of the evaluation process is positive. However, the detail for each phase differ slightly between the assurance level a described below. Assurance Level 1 For Assurance Level 1, the applicant must apply directly to the certification body to trigger the start of the certification process. Once the certification body accepts the application, the applicant is responsible for the evaluation phase by conducting a self-assessment and providing the result to the certification body. In the certification phase, the certification body review the self-assessment and issue the certificate, if the self-assessment meet the defined requirements. Fig.: Certification Process for Assurance Level 1 Assurance Level 2 and 3 Assurance Level 2 and 3 require an independent evaluation facility to conduct the evaluation of the component or operational environment. The applicant must contract an evaluation facility. Together, applicant and evaluation facility finalize the application for certification with the certification body. Afterwards, the evaluation facility is responsible for carrying out the evaluation according to the IDS certification scheme. The evaluation facility document their progress and finding in an evaluation report which is passed on to the certification body at the end of the evaluation phase. In the certification phase, the certification body examines the evaluation report and issue a certificate, if the evaluation wa conducted properly and led to a positive evaluation result. IDS Certification criterion IDS Certification ensures that IDS component and organization or individual who want to participate in data sharing meet the highest security standards. These standard are industry-proven security criterion derived from ISO/IEC 27001 (international standard for information security management) and IEC 62443 (cybersecurity for operational technology in automation and control systems). In addition, IDS Certification implement security criterion defined in the Cloud Computing Compliance Criteria Catalogue(C5) and the CSA Cloud Controls Matrix. Finally, IDS certification capture IDS specific criteria. The certification criterion are defined in the IDS Certification criterion catalogs. IDS Certification trust level IDS Certification ensures that IDS component and organization or individual who want to participate in data sharing provide a sufficiently high degree of trust and security. Nevertheless, the IDS Certification ha a flexible setup and provides different level of certification according to the intended use cases. To ensure on the one hand a low entry barrier specifically suitable for SMEs and on the other hand a scalable certification to meet high information security requirements, three different security levels, with an increasing extent of the security requirement that need to be fulfilled, were defined: Criteria for IDS Connector certification Three different trust levels, with an increasing extent of the security requirement that need to be fulfilled, are defined: Trust 1: offer basic security feature to protect against attacker from outside, to ensure integrity and availability. It is therefore designed for use in scenario with only low security requirements. A Connector meeting this profile is suitable for exchanging data with limited trust and security needs, for exchange of data in a contained environment or for demonstration purposes. Trust 2: includes strict container isolation, integrity-protected logging, encryption of all persisted data, protection against accidental misuse by administrators. This profile is used for scenario in which the protection of the processed and transmitted data is essential. Trust 3: offer additional protection against misuse of privileged access, i.e., manipulation by administrators. This includes the protection against insider attack a well a against external attacker who could gain privileged access. This is achieved by actively monitoring user and data on behalf of the data owner. Criteria for IDS operational environment certification The operational environment certification defines three different trust levels, with an increasing extent of the security requirement that need to be fulfilled: Trust 1: cover only the basic security requirement that every participant of the International Data Space need to fulfil. The entry level therefore serf a a low barrier for company (especially SMEs) interested in trying out International Data Space participation. Trust 2: cover additional security requirements, ensuring an advanced level of security. This level is suit-able for most core participants. Trust 3: includes special security requirement that are necessary for International Data Space participant providing key service within the Inter-national Data Space. Criteria Catalogue: Components-Broker White Paper 2020 | Version 1.0 SEND A REQUEST Criteria Catalogue: Components-Connector White Paper 2021 | Version 2.1.2 SEND A REQUEST Criteria Catalogue: Operational Environments White Paper 2020 | Version 1.0 SEND A REQUEST Component certification Trustful cross-company data exchange requires secure soft- and hardware components. All IDS component must meet a list of certification criterion to prove the provision of the required functionality, interoperability, and level of security. The evaluation of these certification criterion is conducted in the IDS core component certification. Component assurance levels: The depth and rigor of a component evaluation consists of the following three assurance levels, independent on the type of component that is being certified: Assurance Level 1: Checklist self-assessment and automated interoperability testing Assurance Level 2: External concept review including functional and security testing Assurance Level 3: External evaluation including concept review, testing and source code audit Connector trust level The criterion that make up each of the three trust level for a Connector are defined in such a way that they are specific enough to ensure interoperability with the functional requirement of an IDS Connector, yet general enough, to allow the use of a Connector in different deployment scenario without having to define different criterion catalogue for each separate use case. The following three trust level are defined for the certification of a Connector: Trust Level 1: Data space interoperability Trust Level 2: Feature complete for data usage control Trust Level 3: Additional protection from internal attack The following figure illustrates all possible combination of assurance and trust level, that an applicant can choose from. This matrix approach allows the component developer to select a combination of assurance and trust level for their component that best correspond with the intended use cases. On the one hand, this ensures a low entry barrier specifically suitable for SMEs. On the other hand, a scalable certification to meet high information security requirement becomes possible. purposes. Operational environment certification Participants in the International Data Spaces share valuable data. It is essential that all participant's organizational process and operational environment are trustworthy. This trustworthiness is evaluated in the IDS operational environment certification. Central element of the IDS operational environment certification are the different trust level and assurance levels. The IDS established these level to offer suitable certification profile for different use case requirements. On one side, the following three trust level are established: Trust level 1: Entry into data sharing Trust level 2: Providing reliable service Trust level 3: Offering trust-building service Higher Trust Level represent the increasing number of criterion which need to be fulfilled for a successful certification. On the other side, the following three assurance level are established: Assurance level 1: Self-Assessment Assurance level 2: External evaluation of corporate policy and process Assurance level 3: External audit of measure controlling the adherence to corporate policy Higher assurance level represent the increasing demand for more reliable evidence that need to be presented in different evaluation method to prove compliance with the certification criteria. aiXia aiXia" which will be led by LANTEK (digital services) together with the company LIS SOLUTIONS | S.L. (data analytics and ai services) | INGETEAM, S.A.(energy) | GOIZPER S.COOP. (machine-tool industry) | MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY S.COOP. (manufacturing) | UBIKARE ZAINKETAK, S.L. (healthcare) | EROSKI S.COOP (retail) | The technology coordinator is IKERLAN (a leading knowledge transfer center providing competitive value to companies) SUCCESS: Seeks to promote and research the necessary technology for the definition of a reference architecture, operational models, adoption of standard and development for a data space based on the common technical framework proposed by DSBA members, extending it main service to favor the development of artificial intelligence with guarantee of traceability, security, and governance of the data and services. BENEFITS: Aims to provide the country with a reliable data space that enables company to offer new concept of high-added value service based on data sharing, through the servitization of collaborative artificial intelligence for the productization and monetization of their data and industry knowledge in new business models. COMPONENTS: Will develop new service in the field of artificial intelligence and will explore current IDS component implementation (focusing on Connectors, Metadatabroker, and IdentityProviders) in order to select one of them to rely on. The broker provides a query interface for connector and can hence be considered a the search engine in this use case. LEARN MORE: IDS Reference Testbed Plug Test Go! The IDS concepts, architecture, and component form the standard for sovereign data sharing. To move from theory to practice and to achieve large-scale adoption, technical component must be tested for interoperability compliance. For this reason, we have created the IDS Reference Testbed. Make the grade! The IDS reference testbed is an open-source setup with IDS component that ha been jointly developed by the IDSA open-source community. The testbed will enable company and organization to develop IDS-compliant component and test them on their interoperability. It is also a preparatory tool for the IDS certification. Why is this important? The communal goal of the IDSA is to unleash the potential of the data economy through data sovereignty and trusted data sharing in data spaces. The testbed will enable the large-scale adoption of IDS component needed to bring this reality to fruition. What are the advantage of the testbed? Specifically, the testbed make it possible to experience your component behavior in an IDS infrastructure in real-time. As such, it is the perfect way to put your use-case to the test and prepare your component for IDS certification. Plug-test-go. Its a simple a that. The testbed is publicly available and contains the essential IDS infrastructure setup (CA, Daps, Meta Data Broker and connectors). Any company or organization that ha developed IDS component can employ them in the testbed to check their interoperability and compliance with the IDS Standard The IDS reference testbed: your first step towards the creation of data spaces. More Leaflet Learn more about the IDS reference testbed. Blog Read the latest article about IDS certification. White paper Download our white paper on certification. Any questions? Contact us! Your contact person:Sonia JimenezDirector Data Space Technology Contribute to IDS open source IDS open-source repository are the place where fruitful discussion happen. Use this opportunity to meet others, review the code, provide feedback, report bugs, and improve the quality and functionality of end products. IDS Reference Testbed Stay updated with u Share this page: International Data Spaces e. V. Emil-Figge-Str. 80 44227 Dortmund, Germany Phone:+49 (0)231 70096 501 2016 2024 | All Rights Reserved | International Data Spaces Association | | | | Follow u Follow u Follow u Follow u Learn more aiXia aiXia" which will be led by LANTEK (digital services) together with the company LIS SOLUTIONS | S.L. (data analytics and ai services) | INGETEAM, S.A.(energy) | GOIZPER S.COOP. (machine-tool industry) | MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY S.COOP. (manufacturing) | UBIKARE ZAINKETAK, S.L. (healthcare) | EROSKI S.COOP (retail) | The technology coordinator is IKERLAN (a leading knowledge transfer center providing competitive value to companies) SUCCESS: Seeks to promote and research the necessary technology for the definition of a reference architecture, operational models, adoption of standard and development for a data space based on the common technical framework proposed by DSBA members, extending it main service to favor the development of artificial intelligence with guarantee of traceability, security, and governance of the data and services. BENEFITS: Aims to provide the country with a reliable data space that enables company to offer new concept of high-added value service based on data sharing, through the servitization of collaborative artificial intelligence for the productization and monetization of their data and industry knowledge in new business models. COMPONENTS: Will develop new service in the field of artificial intelligence and will explore current IDS component implementation (focusing on Connectors, Metadatabroker, and IdentityProviders) in order to select one of them to rely on. LEARN MORE: MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY EGOKIA MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY - an international firm specializing in the development of automatization and assembly solution for various sectors. It operates 6 production plant around the world and is part of the largest cooperative group in the world | IKERLAN Technical research center and member of IDSA CHALLENGE: EGOKIA solution allows collaborative learning and knowledge sharing between geographically distributed plants, integrating headquarters in Basque Country and domain experts. Thanks to the data space, data, and AI asset can be securely shared throughout different corporate site and a new knowledge-based economy emerges. SUCCESS: Deploys an architecture based on IDSA connectors, linking Mondragon Assemblys data and AI platform from different corporate sites. With this new reliable data space, we extend the lifecycle of artificial intelligence models, enhance their capabilities, and facilitate trusted access and use of it asset by EGOKIA participants. BENEFITS: NEW BUSINESS MODEL: A new business model based on AI service and a knowledge-based economy. RELIABLE AI SOLUTIONS: A "standardized", flexible, and secure solution to break data silo to share and complete AI asset and process between trusted organization and production plants. Measurable benefit can be listed as: Up to 30% quality on model thanks to the application of federated learning techniques, reduce inversion and time to market on IA-based solution or lower communication loads. STANDARIZED DATA SPACE The organization is ready to take part in the knowledge economy with other entities, domain experts, and technology providers. COMPONENTS: Data Space connector 8.0.2 Metada Broker 5.0.3 Identity Provider 1.6.0 Gaia-X4KI A sovereign data and service ecosystem for artificial intelligence in automotive development, production, and operation DLR | T-Systems | Capgemini Engineering | Continental | IAV | Intel | Conweaver | HighQSoft | Reuschlaw | STTech | Fraunhofer ITWM | Fraunhofer ISST | Hochschule Offenburg | Leibniz Universitt Hannover | Technische Hochschule Ingolstadt CHALLENGE: Autonomous driving scenario and the industrial production of required device face a broad range of challenge related to data sovereignty and security. In particular, transfer of large, sensitive file and service in a policy-conform way are addressed in the prototypes. SUCCESS: The solution are cloud-based and are embedded in existing industrial cloud landscape to enhance data sovereignty of participant in complex data exchange relations. BENEFITS: Gaia-X4KI connects various stakeholder and their diverse system landscape from the complete autonomous driving development lifecycle. COMPONENTS: Eclipse Dataspace Components (EDC) and EDC MVD including Connector, Federated Catalog, Identity Hub, Registration Service PREREQUISITES: The data space is currently in development and being tested inside the project. It base on open source components. LEARN MORE: Introduction IKERLAN is a leading knowledge transfer technological centre providing competitive value to companies. We seek for excellence in R&D&i, thanks to the continuous adaptation to the need of our customer and the proximity with the business reality. Faithful to our mission, we have been working daily since 1974 to develop solution that allow our customer to become more and more competitive. We are a cooperative member of the MONDRAGON Corporation and the Basque Research and Technology Alliance (BRTA). Business Expertise Thanks to a unique cooperation model, which combine technology transfer activities, internal research and training of highly qualified personnel, IKERLAN is currently the trusted technological partner of major company in the country. To meet our goal, we are structured into two technological specialization units: ELECTRONICS, INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGIES ENERGY AND MECHATRONICS IKERLAN is a center that is dynamic and open to the world. We are an accredited agent of the Basque Network of Science, Technology, and Innovation and of the Spanish Federation of Technology Centres. We have a major cooperation network integrated with renowned European center and universities, with which we conduct activity of research and training of researchers. Technical Expertise Mission: To solve the technological challenge of the companies, improve their competitiveness and collaborate with the sustainable social and economic development of the environment, all of that from a position of technological leadership and with differential ability in their area of expertise. Vission: Technological center, cooperative and non-profit, known a the European leader in it area of specialization, with an exceptional cohesive human team, that provides value to the company and society. Contact Details Santiago Charramendieta Website Increased visibility of order delivery process VTT | Wrtsil | Uwira CHALLENGE: The use case revolves around expediting and enhancing transparency between a focal company of a manufacturing ecosystem (OEM) and it supplier in their production order management processes. The existing communication method have proven inadequate in facilitating efficient and adaptable exchange between the two entities. By facilitating transparency and fostering a more seamless integration between the IT system of both companies, the management of product order can be streamlined, resulting in heightened efficiency and a reduction in errors. SUCCESS: The objective is to facilitate a reliable and seamless flow of data between the OEM and it supplier by establishing a dedicated data space. The developed solution will be seamlessly integrated with pre-existing IT infrastructure of both company and the solution is grounded in the framework of the IDS reference architecture. The OEM can selectively disclose data from their production environment to the supplier without the fear of data leakages. Respectively, the supplier receives only the data that are essential for them and there is no need to locally extract meaningful insight and valuable information from big data sets. BENEFITS: The established data space solution ha the potential to significantly enhance transparency between the OEM and the supplier. This give rise to several potential benefits, including: Effective Communication: Transparent communication help in conveying accurate information about product specifications, requirements, changes, and timelines. Risk Management: Sharing information about potential risks, such a change in demand or design modifications, allows supplier to proactively address these issues. Furthermore, in time of disruptions, such a supply shortage or unexpected market shifts, transparent communication help both party respond more effectively. Cost Efficiency: Transparent communication allows both party to work together to find cost-effective solutions. COMPONENTS: IDS connector - serve a the communication interface linking the two company and their existing IT systems. With IDS connectors, a data provider can define the rule and condition (usage policies) under which data are shared with a data consumer. DAPS - enables connector to authenticate themselves using X.509 certificates. After successful authentication, the DAPS issue OAuth2 access token for connectors, who need these token to access the service and data of other connectors. Metadata Broker store information about the data end-points offered by the participants. The broker provides a query interface for connector and can hence be considered a the search engine in this use case. LEARN MORE: Data Connector Report Get a comprehensive overview of available data connector based on the IDS Reference Architecture Model. Download the Data Connector Report now. All data connector in one place The Data Connector Report comprehensively document all existing implementation of data connector and offer valuable information on their present state of development and usage. Dont miss an update subscribe to our RSS feed. Whats new? The monthly Data Connector Report provides a comprehensive overview of the latest development in the world of data connectors. Access all issue quickly and easily for download here. Any questions? Contact us! Your contact person:Giulia GiussaniDigital Innovation Manager Get IDS_certified now! The IDS certification is of fundamental importance for a trustworthy and sovereign data exchange Data Connector Report Stay updated with u Share this page: International Data Spaces e. V. LEARN MORE: Accelerating the adoption curve The international data space (IDS) standard allows company to implement the sovereign, secure data solution of the future right now. Heres how were helping everyone get on board. Adoption is a process Its a truism of technology innovation that the adoption of any new technology follows a path like this: Gather knowledge and find your role Get a better understanding of IDS core idea and identify whether your company need an IDS solution or aspires to support others in creating data spaces. Create your data sharing use case Transform your business need into an IDS-based data sharing use case and connect with others to co-create or get support in your journey. Build the necessary component for your use case Identify the specific component needed for your use case and get support to design and develop them. Prepare for bringing your use case to life Go through IDS certification and finalize the preparation of your component for getting into a data space. Adoption Go Live and benefit from secure and sovereign data sharing. At the International Data Spaces Association (IDSA) we want to accelerate adoption, and help speed organization of all size along the path to embrace IDS so they can enter into the future of the data economy a soon a possible. That mean we want a many a possible to participate in IDSA and learn about IDS. Participation enables company to see for themselves why and how to embrace data sovereignty and implement IDS technology into product and systems. Heres how we can help Education In partnership with all our members, IDSA offer hands-on workshop where you can learn about building IDS technology into your product and getting component IDS-certified. Implementation partner Imagine having experienced partner at your side to help you implement data spaces. IDSA work together with many different organization who serve a implementation partners, ready to help you along your adoption journey. All you need to do is contact u to get connected. Testing Any software engineer know that for a product to be market-ready, it ha to be tested. IDSA and our partner offer four testbed environment and multiple opportunity throughout the year for company to test IDS components. Learn more here. We help company become early adopter of IDS. Our member are already reaping the benefit of secure and sovereign data exchange for their businesses. Giulia Giussani, Digital Innovation Manager, IDSA Any questions? Contact us! No website or brochure can replace a personal conversation about your goal and your topics. Our team is looking forward to your call! LEARN MORE: Data Spaces Radar Faster IDS breakthrough are within range The Data Spaces Radar Report The first Data Spaces Radar Report of 2024 highlight the new radar and it enhanced features. In particular, it present the crucial role of the DSSC and it vibrant Community of Practice a community of data space on it way to become operational and changing the way data is shared in different domains. Take a look inside: The enhanced Data Spaces Radar More than two year back, the International Data Spaces Association (IDSA) introduced the groundbreaking Data Spaces Radar, a tool that swiftly gained acclaim and found it place within the dynamic landscape of data spaces. Today, we are excited to unveil the evolution of this pioneering asset the newly enhanced Data Spaces Radar. The Data Spaces Radar serf a the central repository for all data space endeavors. It is an accessible tool designed to provide a comprehensive view of various data space initiative worldwide. Offering insight into the 18 different sectors, global expansion, technical transparency and new stage of development of the data space featured in the radar. Bring data space to life Only the coolest new platform for finding use case to help you bring data space to life, our Data Spaces Radar map all our data space in one easy-to-use tool. The radar cover use case of different degree of maturity from the phase of creating a business case to real data spaces. From planned to pilot to fully operational, across industry and functional domain the use case that align with your business goal are on the radar. The Data Spaces Radar Version 4 | March 2024 The Data Spaces Radar Version 3 | October 2023 The Data Spaces Radar Version 2 | July 2023 The Data Spaces Radar Version 1 | March 2023 Frequently asked question What is the Data Spaces Radar? The Data Spaces Radar is a tool to give visibility to all data space endeavor out there, transparency on their achievement and identify the most promising ones, to foster evolution and matchmaking. Why should I bring my use cases/data space to the Data Spaces Radar? The Data Spaces Radar is the only tool that showcase your data space. The radar ha also been acknowledged by the European Commission a a valuable source of information regarding data spaces, making it the ideal platform for your endeavors. Is the Data Spaces Radar only for member of IDSA? No, the Data Spaces Radar is open to everyone who would like to showcase their use case or data spaces. Is Data Spaces Radar only for IDS-based endeavours? No, if you have a data-sharing use case that is not yet implementing IDS but is part of your plans, feel free to bring it to the radar. However, to achieve higher maturity level (pilot and live), IDS component should be implemented and operational. How can I join? Are there more way to disseminate my use case or data space once I register them on the Data Spaces Radar? Yes, IDSA feature the data space from the radar under #DataSpacesTuesday on LinkedIn. Members of IDSA can also present their data space during our weekly Ecosystem Building Call or at our event and live sessions. Not a member? The maturity of my use case/data space ha changed, how can I update this on the radar? You can update your entry by using the same registration form and selecting I want to update an existing entry. What is a cross-domain use case/data space? This is a use case or data space where partner from different domain (e.g., health and agriculture) share data with each other. Is the Data Spaces Radar only for European endeavors? No, the Data Spaces Radar welcome use case and data space from all around the world. IDSA encourages individual to create project based on the IDS Standard and submit them to the radar. Any questions? Contact us! Your contact person:Carlos Gonzlez RuizEcosystem Operations Manager Join the data space radar Bring your own use case and data space based on the IDS standard on our radar and let others get inspired. Data Spaces Radar Stay updated with u Share this page: International Data Spaces e. V. Emil-Figge-Str. 80 44227 Dortmund, Germany Phone:+49 (0)231 70096 501 2016 2024 | All Rights Reserved | International Data Spaces Association | | | | Follow u Follow u Follow u Follow u Learn more Horizontal Supply Chain Collaboration SICK Track and trace systems, in combination with digital services, can make the full supply chain more successful. Barcodes, 2D-codes or RFID technology can identify materials. At the same time, the digital service are digitizing the logistic processes, for example, repacking or validation of material in handling units.These system provide every stakeholder with necessary and trustworthy information via the IDS data structure. Based on the secure data exchange, further data-driven process automation, such a billing processes, is visible. BENEFITS: Digitized and trusted transparency of material flow in the full supply chain Flexibility in generating new business model in the supply chain to reduce process cost Reduced cost of fixed capital on stock COMPONENTS: SICK track and trace system IDS Trusted Connector Data Broker Identity Provider Corda LEARN MORE: Supply Chain Manager Volkswagen AG | thyssenkrupp | Fraunhofer ISST | sovity| Trust is one of the highest rated requirement for collaboration in industrial environments, such a material provider and productive consumer, e.g. automotive production. Especially when exchange of sensitive data is required purely trust is not sufficient due of the fact that access to IT system is outside of human control. A technical solution is mostly required to ensure data sovereignty on both ends, establishing trust by using technology. BENEFITS: Exchange and usage of data lead to process improvement Increased transparency in automotive supply chain Establishing mutual trust enables policy enforcement COMPONENTS: IDS Connector IDS Connector Framework LEARN MORE: ONCITE German Edge Cloud With ONCITE, company can process and store data on site before they exchange it over a public cloud with data sovereignty being ensured across the entire process. ONCITE is a compact computing center that is based on edge cloud technology. At the heart of it is the IDScertified Trusted Supplier Connector. The user interface monitor and control any exchange of data between two partners. Using the Connector, partner can evaluate data and make it available for being used by their own or by OEMs systems. BENEFITS: Suppliers and manufacturer can make their data available for being used in digital process Companies can process and store data on site before they exchange it over a public cloud ONCITE allows data exchange transaction in real time and at the highest possible level of security COMPONENTS: IDS connector LEARN MORE: Use Case Two or more organization that apply an IDS-based solution to a real-life challenge for sharing data in a sovereign way. Contact Details Alexandros Nizamis Anastasia Theodouli Collaborative Warranty and Quality Management SAP | Fraunhofer SAP want to make use of IDS data sharing concept to improve business process by providing smart data apps which facilitate intercompany collaboration. The example of the collaborative warranty and quality management apps illustrate how repair shop are incentivized to share vehicle quality data along the manufacturing supply chain, irrespective of their relevance for warranty claims. Suppliers of any tier gain transparency of quality issue from different downstream branches. When supplier perform a root cause analysis of such quality issues, they can integrate downstream or upstream quality and usage data which is shared subject to usage policies. The IDS standard is the blueprint for data exchange based on European values, such a data protection and security, equal opportunity through a federated design, the guarantee of data sovereignty for the provider of data, and trust between participants. SUCCESS: With the IDS standard a the essential infrastructure basis, Catena-X will be an extensible ecosystem in which automotive manufacturer and suppliers, dealer association and equipment suppliers, including the provider of applications, platforms, and infrastructure, can all participate equally. In consequence, any Asset Administration Shell (AAS) in the factory can be published and secured over IDS. BENEFITS: Integration and Interoperability with Asset Administration Shell Data usage control via IDS New business opportunity by publishing factory capability and asset in marketplace for industrial production COMPONENTS: OPC UA Factory Connector IDS MYDATA Usage Control Smart Factory Web Asset Administration Shell LEARN MORE: Maritime Data Space Sintef | Navtor | Neuron | Wilhelmsen | DNV-GL CHALLENGE: Maritime shipping company are required by law to transmit a set of important data before entering every port. There are various industry solution for this data exchange such a the Veracity ecosystem in the market today. All of them are very complex and time intensive to manage. Providers and organization on shore do not have access to ship data like emissions, fuel consumption and route details. Data access agreement between data provider such a ship owners, authority or shipyard equippers a well a service provider that take care of for example data analysis and process improvement must be negotiated individually. A common ecosystem for data exchange from ship to shore , that simplifies the process and doe not exist. SUCCESS: The IDS-based Maritime Data Space brings together all participant and platform in one trusted and secure data ecosystem. It ensures transparent access to ship-related data, enables secure, stable and efficient communication between ship and shore, and provides value-added and trusted service for ship operations. Autonomous shipping, environmental sustainability, industry 4.0 technologies, and the connection between ship are current trend that the Maritime Data Space address in an innovative way. The combination of the Norwegian DNV GL Veracity data platform with an IDS-based ecosystem strengthens Norways position in international maritime data exchange and sharing. Last but not least, the Maritime Data Space satisfies customer and regulatory demand for transparency. BENEFITS: Transparent access to all relevant ship related data Secure, robust and efficient communication between ship and shore Simplified provision of trusted service for ship operation Interoperability and data sovereignty for all involved party COMPONENTS: Veracity Industry Data Platform IDS Connectors IDS Identity Provider (CA, DAPS, ParIS) IDS Metadata Broker LEARN MORE: Smart Parking Volkswagen | Fiware Foundation | Wobcom Smart Parking is a digital solution to improve parking in a city, reduce air pollution and support local businesses. Drivers in a city are not navigated to their destination, but to the nearest available parking space. They can register their preferred shopping profiles. These anonymised marketing profile are matched with shop near the parking spaces. Matching shop offer are returned with hash code for the possible offers. If the driver shop at that particular shop, their parking fee is paid by the shop. COMPONENTS: IDS Connector LEARN MORE: Smart Connected Supplier Network - Market 4.0 TNO CHALLENGE: Smart Connected Supplier Network is an initiative of manufacturing company and their IT-suppliers in the high-tech manufacturing supply chain. The aim is to facilitate cross-factory communication and thus ensuring supply chain transparency and interoperability, resulting in an overall productivity improvement of 20%. This is realized by reducing the administrative burden and facilitating collaboration between supply chain partners. Unlike traditional centralized platform initiatives, SCSN is fully based on the principle of digital and data sovereignty. There is no central entity controlling the data. A non-profit foundation chair the data sharing agreements, but the implementation is done by the involved IT-suppliers. Unlike existing EDI-initiatives, these agreement not only address the semantics, but also the technical and legal aspect between partner in the ecosystem. SUCCESS: SCSN is designed a a highly scalable solution by providing a network approach (four-corner model) which consists of the following two aspects: One common semantic language to exchange: orders, forecast, TPDs, BoM, drawings, invoices, logistical information, catalogues, and measurement data. Seamless technical agreement between Service Providers to ensure the promise of Connecting Once - Communicate with everyone. The underlying SCSN infrastructure is based on the reference architecture developed by the International Data Spaces Association. The SCSN Foundation created standard IDS Connectors and Data Apps, which can be used by service providers. These service providers, i.e. integrator parties, created off-the-shelve integration with a complete portfolio of ERP systems. This way, they can very easily connect manufacturing company to the network. BENEFITS: Seamless scalable integration for manufacturing company for exchanging purchase-to-pay information Reduction in administrative burden, faster time-to-market, lower IT integration cost IT service provider only need a single integration COMPONENTS: IDS Identity Provider (Certificate Authority, DAPS, ParIS) IDS Metadata Broker IDS Clearing House IDS Connectors Data Apps LEARN MORE: Industrial Additive Manufacturing Services IBM | thyssenkrupp | Fraunhofer ISST Thyssenkrupp and IBM together with Fraunhofer ISST have developed a prototype that build the foundation for further expansion of an industrial manufacturing platform. The secure platform enables the exchange of trusted data and seamless interaction between all party along the value chain. Organizations in logistics are currently developing and implementing digitization strategy to adapt and prepare to extract value from these opportunities. However, the scale of the challenge transcends the boundary of organizations. This project build on the work and analysis of the needs, approach, positioning and roadmap for a Dutch logistics data space in the recently published white paper on the logistics infrastructure for data sharing. SUCCESS: Motivated because of conclusion from the white paper and previous research that there is a need for a Dutch Logistics Data Space (DLDS) that expands the limited function of the current framework approach for logistics agreement (such a iSHARE) and meet international development and standard a also applicable in other sector in the increasingly cross-sectoral and intertwined supply chains. That is why the DASLOGIS project aim to develop a DLDS: a digital virtual environment or ecosystem that enables the finding and controlled sharing of (potentially) sensitive data. It offer flexibility, extensibility, and personalization to support the three main type of logistics data exchange: "sharing transaction data for operational optimization," "sharing (big) data for data for data analysis," and "supply chain data sharing for real-time visibility." DLDS will be based on the generic and internationally standardized IDS reference architecture model, supplemented and adapted to Dutch logistics need where applicable. The Proof of Concept (PoC) of the DLDS is validated using three functional prototypes. The project partner will also demonstrate and ass the technical feasibility and business value of a DLDS for the Dutch logistics sector based on logistics use case. BENEFITS: Enables the discovery and controlled sharing of (potentially) sensitive data Offers flexibility, extensibility and personalisation to support data exchange in logistics COMPONENTS: IDS Connectors IDS Essential Service LEARN MORE: Metal Domain Data Space - Market 4.0 Tecnalia | Ekin | Engineering | Exkal | Gepro Systems | Gizelis | Goialde | Intrasoft | Kleemann |LMS Lab of the University of Patras | Prima Industrie | Rico | TNO CHALLENGE: Selecting the most suitable new manufacturing equipment is a time-consuming challenge for many customers. Theres no easy way to digest all available information about options, so customer must browse the internet, attend trade show and talk to multiple expert in order to reach an informed decision. We wondered if data space could help integrate and streamline this process. We focused specifically on the metal domain. SUCCESS: The MARKET 4.0 Metal Domain Data Space is based on the IDS Reference Architecture Model (RAM). It describes a robust and efficient solution for linking the inventory of different equipment manufacturer to a MARKET 4.0 service that analysis the customer requirement and return the most suitable equipment option for a certain metal domain manufacturing process. The connection is made through IDS connector and the inventory and service include essential IDS module (i.e., clearing house, metadata broker) that guarantee a trusted data exchange. BENEFITS: The MARKET 4.0 Metal Domain Data Space make the selection of manufacturing equipment simpler and more efficient, getting to a better result in le time. It is flexible and offer two solutions: Connecting equipment manufacturer repository with a single IDS connector. The equipment manufacturer do not require knowledge of the IDS RAM. Only the connector owner need to have it. Connecting one service with multiple data provider via IDS connectors. The benefit of this is that the data provider control the data flow and is independent of the connector provider. Contact Details Contact Form Website AI.SOV Cefriel The AI.SOV project aim to develop an IDS architecture inspired platform that will guarantee secure and sovereign data sharing among supply chain partners. The sustainable industrial data ecosystem will based on industrial platform that are supporting the European industry to faster exchange AI results, (such a spare part production and forecast and predictive maintenance data, or data-driven new business opportunity throughout the value-chain) along with the whole industrial and supply/value chain stakeholders, leveraging on a secure and trustworthy sharing of manufacturing data. In other words, the aim is to design, develop, setup, and deploy a platform able to support and foster data exchange between trusted party based on self-defined data usage policy by considering data sovereignty principles. The technical solution provided by AI.SOV will introduce a governance layer devoted to human user over the machine-to-machine data exchange layer provided by IDS. In details, the data exchange layer will comprise IDS Connectors relying on the Dynamic Attribute Provider Service for mutual authentication between machines. This will be complemented by a user agreement layer, which will allow data provider and data consumer to make deal according to well-defined processes. BENEFITS: Generate new knowledge in the creation/usage of platform for the exchange of data among stakeholder in the industrial supply chain Create an educational module focused on data sovereignty in supply chain by providing both a formal rule representation framework, and real and tangible industrial example (use cases) COMPONENTS: IDS Connectors Dynamic Attribute Provider Service Governance Layer User Agreement Layer MORE INFORMATION: Smart Factory VTT | Konecranes-Fastems-Danfoss The Smart Factory is a step towards the Industry 4.0 vision for smart manufacturing where different machine interact with each other without, or with minimal, human control. The use case and involved IDS Solutions provide multiple benefits. For example, machine (and the company that operate them) can better control with whom and what data is shared, and how data consumer handle the shared data. Moreover, IDS provides a systematic way to introduce new machine / company into the factory and no case-by-case integration solution are needed. With the IDS certification scheme, different stakeholder (both in-factory and external) can ensure that the utilized data exchange component address required security requirements. Finally, IDS brings improved interoperability across different data exchange protocol and formats, and data models. BENEFITS: Enhance trusted data sharing across factory border facilitating e.g. the creation of digital twin Enable interaction between machine and system using different communication protocol (i.e. OPC-UA and non-OPC-UA) COMPONENTS: Connector Is based on the Trusted Connector reference implementation and ha been extended to support OPC-UA based data exchange. Enables machine to communicate with each other and also facilitates data exchange with external stakeholders. Dynamic Attribute Provisioning Service (DAPS) Provides dynamic, up-to-date attribute information about participant and connectors. Currently, the Fraunhofers DAPS implementation is used. LEARN MORE: Mobility Data Space ADAC | BMW | CARIAD / GIS AG | Deutsche Bahn | DWD | FIWARE | Fraunhofer | Fraunhofer ISST | HUK-Coburg | Initiative fr sichere Straen | PTV-Group | Software AG | T-Systems International | DENSO | EUCON | WITTE AUTOMOTIVE | Next Prototypes TUM Hyperloop | CARUSO | Fraunhofer IOSB | urban institute [ui!] | highQ | FREENOW | Fraunhofer IML | raumobil | UnternehmerTUM | bloxmove | Intertrust | LiangDao | GATE Institute | Ferdinand-Steinbeis Institut | Aparkado | Hubject | Mercedes | TenneT | AVL | TomTom | Virtual Vehice Research | Flinkey | EcoMovement | Horyzn | Sovity CHALLENGE: Intelligent traffic and mobility system require a large amount of data in order to support decision in the best possible way or even to take them automatically. Although countless mobility data are already collected and processed today, comprehensive utilization of these data is often not possible for technical, legal or economic reasons. With the Mobility Data Space (MDS), an open IDS-based data space that go beyond the secure exchange of sensitive mobility data, a well a linking existing data platform with one another (cf. Mobility Data Marketplace MDM). In this way, comprehensive mobility data can be made available in the future without worrying about misuse of data. SUCCESS: The MDS enables the sovereign handling of data for digital mobility solutions. Common legal framework based on European data protection guideline form the basis for this.By linking offer from different mobility providers, individual mobility can be better combined with public transport offer and sharing providers. New possibility also arise for traffic control by local authority when data from private motor vehicle are combined with parking space utilization data and data from local public transport. Real-time information, for example, taking road work or traffic jam into account, allows flexible adjustment of route for private and public transport vehicles. The perspective to be compliant with other data space that cover different domain create a whole new understanding of the mobility sector. The MDS will go live in the first half of 2022 a one of the first IDS-based data space operating at the market worldwide. BENEFITS: secures data sovereignty by establishing common rule for trustworthy data transaction reduces the economic and technical dependence on digital platform of large private provider creates a basis for a cross-modal and intermodal mobility system COMPONENTS: IDS Identity Provider (CA, DAPS, ParIS) IDS Metadata Broker IDS App Store IDS Clearing House IDS Vocabulary Provider IDS Connectors (not provided by operating company) LEARN MORE: Silicon Economy Fraunhofer IML | Fraunhofer ISST | TU Dortmund The Silicon Economy is a synonym for an upcoming digital infrastructure or digital ecosystem based on the automated negotiation, scheduling and control of the flow of goods, enabling new, digital business model for logistics (among others). This digital infrastructure enables comprehensive transparency in value added network and creates trust along complete supply chains, from the supplier of raw material to the end customer which is maybe the most important prerequisite for getting all company to participate. LEARN MORE: NL AI Coalition - Oncology Research NL AIC | TNO | IKNL | Brightlands | Janssen | Philips | University Maastricht | Erasmus University | Tilburg University | Groningen University Challenged to be met: Using data between hospital to further research in oncology.Solution: IDS provides the reference framework and the software to build in data sovereignty. Here, plant exchange data according to agreed rule and under certain conditions. An IDS connector implement these rule and processes. The concept of International Data Spaces thus enables all player to make self-determined decision about the use of their data, thus enabling their digital sovereignty. The turbine operator provides a data resource with operational data via an IDS connector. When it is shared and reused, data doe not become less, but provides new information and applications. The Federal Ministry Republic of Austria Digital and Economic Affairs (BMDW) offer support to company and research institution regarding the topic of Gaia-X a part of the -Cloud initiative. The overall goal is to strengthen the digital sovereignty of Austria. SUCCESS:msg a an IDSA Implementation Partner ha supported the Ministry and the participating company by a) providing an overview about technical structure of compatible data space across domain boundary b) infrastructure consulting for the operation of IDS and Gaia-X compliant architecture c) aligning and positioning use case regarding their specific role in the Gaia-X ecosystem. With the -Cloud Initiative, the BMDW promotes secure data management and data use by Austrian companies. To this end, the association of domestic cloud provider to form a digital security network is supported. Providers of cloud service in Austria complete a self-evaluation according to strict and transparent security standards. For this, they receive the -Cloud seal of approval. BENEFITS: The use of secure cloud application and innovative service creates new economic opportunity for companies. More data sovereignty: Your own data remains where you want it - in Austria, Europe or beyond. The data is securely stored and managed according to strict standard (e.g. DSGVO). The -Cloud initiative facilitates cooperation with other European cloud provider (GAIA-X) and give domestic provider a competitive edge. Austria is strengthened a a location for the data economy and becomes more attractive internationally. Levels of Maturity Lead In: Organization or consortium is in the phase of shaping an IDS-based use case by identifying opportunity and/or challenge that can be addressed with sovereign data sharing Case Committed: The scope of the use case, the value created and the role of organization involved in it have been identified. An approach for realizing the use case ha been defined. Pilot: IDS-based solution ha been implemented and first prototype have been tested in a use case pilot. Live: Use case is running live and data flow in a sovereign way between data sharing parties. COMPONENTS: IDS Connectors Data Apps Broker DAPS LEARN MORE: ADVANEO DMP Advaneo The ADVANEO DMP is a collaboration portal that enables the data-sovereign formation of Data Spaces for data-driven applications. Thereby, integrated AI tools, data model and application a well a free access to million of Open Data support the development of data-driven innovation projects. For this purpose, the ADVANEO DMP is based on the reference architecture of the International Data Space Association and in the future also the GAIA-X standards.As a result, the DMP act a a broker service for data products: They are made globally discoverable by the marketplace with the help of their metadata. The DMP ha no contact with the actual raw data at any time. These remain with the provider and are only transmitted directly to the interested party in peer-to-peer encrypted form by an IDS-Connector after successful license acquisition. If required, several party process sensitive data in dedicated group without access to the raw data of the other parties. Only the exploitation result is accessible to all. This enables the sharing of confidential data in value chains. BENEFITS: Access to internal, external and open data offerings. Complete control: Sovereign data sharing by IDS-standards Data Science Workbench for on-the-fly processing Open Innovation through datathons Access control throughout your whole organization COMPONENTS: IDS Broker IDS Connector IDS Clearing House IDS App Provider LEARN MORE: EUHubs4Data (EUH4D) EUHubs4Data EUHubs4Data (EUH4D) project aim to establish the European federation of data driven Innovation Hubs, through the collaboration of relevant initiative in Europe, creating of an European federated catalogue of asset (services, data, training) and making it available at regional level by the hub in the federation. IDS reference model ha been selected a the model to enable the interoperability between service and datasets of the hub in the federation, providing a trusted environment where to share data and the corresponding data governance features, including data sovereignty. IDSA is a partner in the project. The project is selecting 42 experiment through three round of open calls, where SMEs will use the asset of the federation to solve real use case and move their data driven product and service closest to the market. These experiment will also serve a a way to check and improve the interoperability framework based on the IDS model. BENEFITS To leverage the potential of European initiative on data driven innovation, making accessible to SMEs and other small actor at regional and local level last European advance on Big Data and AI, and providing a unique environment for data driven experimentation COMPONENTS: Deployment of component which ensure interoperability based on trust and data sovereignty for the Federation. Implementation of IDS connectors. Implementation of Identity management component (Certification Authority and Dynamic Attribute Provisioning Service) in accordance with the IDS Reference Architecture Model. This will include turning equipped LCV's into participant of an IDS-powered data-economy by leveraging available data from multiple source, execute pre-defined and use case-specific algorithm and offer the computed result back to the data economy. Parts of the solution will be: 1) Deliver an IDS-compliant control unit a edge device in light commercial vehicle and 2) orchestrate a data and application framework to download and execute use case-specific application on the edge device. IDS help in two ways: enable an easy scalability across multiple data produce and data consumer in light of European data value (sovereignty, transparency, control). COMPONENTS: Connector, Broker DAPS, Billing, Clearing AppStore Links: Data Sharing Coalition - Green Loans Data Sharing Coalition In this use case, the consumer will be enabled to use their energy data to receive support with making their house more sustainable. This support can range from sustainability advice to a favourable Green Loan for investment in energy saving measure (e.g. heat pump or solar cells). The consumer share data on his or her energy consumption with an intermediary and/or loan provider, who in turn is able to ass potential saving from certain energy saving measures. This can be standalone advice but can also be incorporated in advice on a loan to finance these energy saving measures. This use case give the consumer more control over their energy data, a they can decide to use their data to access advice or attractive financial value propositions. With their new green loan and input for sustainability advice, financial institute are able to support the transition to a more sustainable society. With it defined standard for data exchange among others based on IDS component the Mobilithek offer nation biggest volume of information on traffic flows, traffic jams, road works, mobility options, parking facility and more. The entire business logic (at least on the customer side) and thus the control of function and process must be mapped in microservices and orchestrated to form the overall service. SOLUTION: Moving to the technical platform considering the framework, rule and reference architecture of IDS, Gaia-X and Silicon Economy. Implementation of a tool for the orchestration of web service control for the execution or support of logistical process and services. LEARN MORE: Defense Data Space TNO | CGI | Department of Defense CHALLENGE: During deployments, it is critical that Defense can share critical up-to-date information with aid agencies, local authorities, and other civilian parties. However, these partner are not part of the secure defense network.FEDICE - an acronym for Federated Digital Collaboration Environment - ensures that Defense and it partner can continue to share information digitally in a simple, manageable, and secure way. SUCCESS: TNO and CGI have been working together for the Department of Defense on this NTP (National Technology Project) for the past two years. They have developed an intelligent platform for information management in federations. The platform enables rapid ad hoc collaboration with aid organization and other partner while keeping the data at the source. FEDICE support the sharing of information a needed.Throughout all of this, the confidentiality of information is taken into account to ensure that data doe not get to the wrong places. In addition, logging make it possible to track which data wa released at what time and in which version. The prototype developed wa successfully tested earlier this year during a large-scale exercise by the 13th Light Brigade of the Royal Netherlands Army. It ha demonstrably made a good step from theory to practice. BENEFITS: Secure data exchange with non-military entities. LEARN MORE: HEALTH-X dataLOFT Charit | Siemens | Bundesdruckerei | 1&1 Ionos | SVA | polypoly | Vilua Healthcare | Medisana Space Technologies | Fraunhofer Gesellschaft | IDSA | Hasso-Plattner-Institut | OFFIS | Freie Universitt Berlin CHALLENGE: The health sector is highly regulated and health data is considered to be worthy of special protection. Most of the data from the first and second health domain are locked in proprietary system that significantly hinder the pooling and secondary use of health data. In addition to a centrally controlled collection of health data, a in China, or a largely libertarian, economically designed consolidation along the line of the U.S. model, there is scope for Europe to design a third path, that of a citizen-centered health data space. The strategic orientation of this concept is to place citizen at the center of the provision, use and control of their own health data from the primary and secondary health market and thereby to expand Europe's differentiating competitive advantage. Health data will be integrated into a legitimate, open and supported dataLOFT platform and made accessible according to GAIA-X standards. SUCCESS: The goal is to develop transparent, cloud-based health application with leading representative of health IT and health care. The concept of the Medical Informatics Initiative for semantic and syntactic interoperability and regulated data use, a well a legally binding Gema-tik standard and solution of the telematics infrastructure will be integrated for the networking of the health sector and the integrative use of the data. dataLOFT will create an ecosystem of health application based on the data sovereignty of citizen and patient a user and donor of health data and thus contribute to a broad acceptance and high economic relevance of dataLOFT. LEARN MORE: GAIA-X - MERLOT imc | AWSI | edu-sense | HKA | HPI | IBM | IDSA | 1&1 Ionos | iServ | Schlerkarriere | TUK CHALLENGE: The digitization of education is intended to improve educational opportunity and make them fairer. However, in order to identify individual educational need through algorithms, for example, extensive personal data requiring a high degree of protection (e.g., educational path, goals) is required, which must not be digitally processed because of threat to fundamental rights. The Corona Crisis urgently call for a solution to this contradiction. SUCCESS: The goal of the project is to create specially protected educational data spaces, including services, which are available via marketplaces. To establish data sovereignty, the service will be certified according to their compliant data use and provision. Interoperability of these will be ensured by mean of business model interfaces. Existing service will be brought into the project and adapted to conform to the marketplace and educational data space. The added value of the project and the underlying Gaia-x infrastructure will be demonstrated by mean of several application examples. The implemented service will be linked to data-secure AI-supported digital assistant that support learner in a data-supervised manner in career orientation and career planning. LEARN MORE: City Dataspace Wuppertal | Solingen | Remscheid | APTIV CHALLENGE: Smart city are becoming more and more of a reality every day. While the first autonomous vehicle are making their way into city on a trial basis, parking lot can already report whether they are occupied or free, sensor monitor air quality, and multimodal apps also enable people to get around using different mobility solutions. What all these application have in common is that they are based on data generated and managed in different place by different actors. However, application based on Open and Urban Data in particular have the disadvantage that they are either built specifically for exactly one city and then only work there or have to be adapted for other city at great expense. The reason for this is that today's Open & Urban Data portal provide data set in different formats, model and schemas. In addition to these syntactic differences, there are also semantic differences, such a different metric or geo-reference systems. This is exactly what make it costly for app developer to develop solution that work outside of a municipality. The City Dataspace focus on the challenge of increasing and enabling the usability of Smart City relevant Open and Urban data using the example of mobility and geodata across municipal boundaries. SUCCESS: The City Dataspace aim to enable the data-driven smart city of tomorrow by enabling compatibility of heterogeneous open and urban data from different municipality together with data from other stakeholder across city boundaries. For this purpose, the City Dataspace relies on the established semantic technologies, combined with new innovative concept to simplify the use of the required technologies. These concept are intended to make it possible to provide semantically annotated data in an interoperable way with little effort. This interoperability should enable app developer to develop an app once and roll it out to a large number of municipality using the City Dataspace. Conversely, the City Dataspace enables municipality to participate in existing apps just by making their data available. BENEFITS: The City Dataspace aim to enable the data-driven smart city of tomorrow by enabling compatibility of heterogeneous open and urban data from different municipality together with data from other stakeholder across city boundaries. COMPONENTS: The City Dataspace is a Knowledge Graph-based Data Management platform that allows access to batch and streaming data using different kind of data connectors. As IDS components, the city data space will especially focus on using IDS Connectors and IDS Metadata Broker. LEARN MORE: Plastic Domain Data Space - Market 4.0 IPC | N.
