Links: DataPorts ITI | Traxens | PRODEVELOP | IBM Israel | OTE | Everis | UPV | ICCS | UDE | CERTH | Fraunhofer ISST | THPPA | Valenciaport Foundation CHALLENGE: Although many projects/initiatives have dealt and/or are dealing with developing data platform architecture in diversified application domains, not many project have addressed integration in port environment with the possibility of including cognitive services/applications and extending/federating the platform to whole transportation route covering whole Europe. Lack of interoperable, scalable, reliable data platform cause major technological and business issue such a the impossibility to plug non-interoperable data source into heterogeneous data platforms, the impossibility to develop application to exploit heterogeneous data in homogeneous and/or cross domains, slowness of data technology introduction at a large-scale, discouragement in adopting data sharing technology, increase of costs, scarce reusability of data, user dissatisfaction, and lack of unified data governance mechanisms. SUCCESS: DataPorts aim to design, develop, set-up and operate a data platform for the trusted, secure and reliable data sharing with IDS connector and trading among the actor operating in the diverse supply chain involved in the seaports, also enabling the connection with other stakeholder in the logistics supply chain. BENEFITS The adoption and use of this Data Platform by existing connected / digital port will imply their transition to actual cognitive ports, taking real advantage of the huge amount of data produced by the stakeholder and opening the way to new capabilities: Real-time control of operations; Streamlined decision making; Accurate prediction of future event and situations; Prescriptive analytics. COMPONENTS In the context of the DataPorts project, an industrial data platform (cognitive port data platform) ha been designed and implemented that: 1. Connects to different digital infrastructure currently existing in digital seaports, enabling the interconnection of a wide variety of system into a tightly integrated ecosystem, 2. Sets the policy for a trusted and reliable data sharing and trading based on data owner rule and offering a clear value proposition, and 3. Leverages on the data collected to provide advanced data analytics service based on which the different actor in the port value chain cloud develop novel AI and cognitive applications. In the context of the DataPorts platform, to realize data sharing and data exchange, two main approach are considered: Data is stored off-chain: Generally, in this approach, we follow the concept of the International Data Spaces Association (IDSA) reference architecture model. In a nutshell, we consider the P2P data exchange between the data owner and data consumer through the IDSA connectors. To ensure the security and privacy aspects, blockchain manages consent of access to data. Smart contract decide if a particular access to data is allowed concerning the invokers credential and the specification of access rule for the data. Data is stored on-chain (blockchain for shared data): Blockchain platform record transaction related to shared data and process of all participant in a business network. For instance, cold chain alarm of a container for verification of it state such a if condition have been compromised, allows everybody in the network to be aware of the event and act upon it. This approach in fact ensures verifiable and immutable information on shared data through the entire chain to all business network participants, serving a a single source of truth and providing transparency and a not-repudiation process. In the first approach, the data (sovereign data) is kept on the owner premises. The metadata for sovereign data is published to the broker (IDSA broker). A data consumer need to understand whether the data he seek is a shared data stored in Blockchain or is stored by a data owner. To clarify this, the data consumer must access the IDSA broker, and in case the data is sovereign data, data sharing rule are used to determine if a data access is allowed. Eventually, in case of a legitimate data access, a peer-to-peer secure communication with data owner to obtain data is initialized through IDSA connectors. LEARN MORE: H2 Metaverse ARENA-INNOVATION | CODE_n CHALLENGE: The latest draft of the "Act to Accelerate the Use of Liquefied Natural Gas (Gesetzes zur Beschleunigung de Einsatzes verflssigten Erdgases) see a significant change in reallocation of LNG import terminal for the import of hydrogen. In the draft, it is no longer mandatory that green hydrogen or it derivative must replace the fossil fuel LNG. Now there is talk of "climate-neutral hydrogen and derivatives". This mean that hydrogen based on natural gas, of which CO2 is fully captured and not released into the atmosphere can also be used. With blue hydrogen, the CO2 would be stored underground (CCS). In the case of turquoise hydrogen, it would be done using the at large-scale not yet tested methane pyrolysis converted into solid matter. In both case it would have to be ensured that during extraction and transport of the natural gas no methane escapes. In theory, even hydrogen fall into this category, that would be produced by electrolysis using nuclear power. SUCCESS: A project draft (Projektskizze) ha already been submitted to BMBF under the acronym "h2republic". The goal is that a new "H2 Data Space" for sovereign data exchange shall be created, which shall stand at the basis of the "H2 Metaverse" platform. Due to the technical complexity of the "H2 Data Space", it should remain hidden to the eye of the conventional "H2 Metaverse" platform user. Hence, the "H2 Data Space" shall be the interface to the programmer and smart service providers, whereas the "H2 Metaverse" shall be the interface to the conventional Fuel Cells and Hydrogen (FCH) player by using predefined smart service according to their requirements. Such smart federated service can/shall be the implementation of standardized Digital Twins for ensuring cross-sectoral interoperability along the entire value chain and for depicting the entire physical hydrogen world into the digital H2 Metaverse, which at the end should become a de-facto standard for the entire gas domain. BENEFITS Fuel Cells and Hydrogen (FCH) technology are defined a sector coupling technology for coupling the energy and mobility sector together. Hence, it is obvious, that the newly created "H2 Data Space" will link up the already existing energy and mobility data space and of course other a well. On the other hand, in order to ensure sovereign data exchange and interoperability, it will try to digitally interconnect all FCH cluster worldwide. In order to prevent lock-in effects, the H2 Metaverse shall not belong to one person or entity but to the whole user and be created by them while being at the same time free of charge. With regard to the business model, this shall be realized via company participation (Gesellschaftsbeteiligung) with all the 16 German state (Bundeslnder), similar to the already existing company participation of the state of Baden-Wuerttemberg to the "mobility data space". COMPONENTS: The H2 Metaverse platform shall be similar to the Catena-X platform in term of visibility. For this all the necessary IDS components, like for example the IDS/Eclipse Connector and so on shall be used. LEARN MORE: GATE Urban Data Space Sofia Municipality | SofiaPlan, National Statistical Institute | Executive Environment Agency | Meteorological Institute | Urban Mobility Centre CHALLENGE: GATE Urban Data Space focus on the challenge of accelerating and improving the usability of city relevant public and private data,, such a for example air quality data, mobility data, transport data, infrastructure data, spatial data, demographic data. The aim is to realize a data space allowing for the collection, processing, aggregation and sharing of data for the city and the region, based on the understanding that data is also key to informed decision-making, a valuable resource for innovation and development and a prerequisite for building smart urban and regional decisions. SUCCESS: Public and private data, a well a citizen data on key activity such a urban and air cleanliness, mobility, construction, energy efficiency, etc., will be integrated, which is crucial not only to ensure better use of resource and fewer emission but also to provide for sustainability through construction optimization, smarter urban transport, modernized water and waste treatment facility and more efficient way to use energy in buildings. GATE Urban Data Space will enable the creation of different Use Cases, among which: - 3D City Models or Digital Twins to provide for comprehensive digital representation of the city at all level and simulation of integrated process for improved decision making; - Parametric Urban Planning and Design to provide for analysis and recommendation for optimized positioning and accessibility of social infrastructure such a kindergardens, schools, hospitals, green areas, etc.; - Urban Environment Analysis and Simulation, including spatial-temporal air quality analysis, identification of the main source of pollution and wind and air quality simulation; - Solar Potential and Energy Footprint of the Buildings analysis GATE Urban Data Space will fully comply with the IDS RAM and implement the IDS component specified. BENEFITS: Data user from research, industry and public administration can use the provided by the Urban Data Space high quality data sets, aggregated data set and data model in various scenario and economic and social domain (as well a cross domains) and extract value from it. Data driven application and service provider can utilize the Data Space platform and service to build application by exploiting the provided open APIs and building upon the Data a a Service model. Researchers, innovative startup and SMEs and bigger company using the Urban Data Space for their development and test-before-invest activity are potential customer of the training and consultancy related to IDSA technology adoption acceleration. Various business and public administration representative are the target group for consultancy/training related to the elaboration of new data sharing driven use case and business models, a well a for training on data sharing principles. Partners in membership scheme can use the Urban Data Space (together with GATE researchers) for innovation ideation, and technology co-experiments for industry prototyping, PoC, and demonstrators. Research partner can utilize the Data Space in collaborative and contract research project using it for design, experimenting, and testing in their project activities. COMPONENTS: IDS Connector - to connect to the different data provider IDS Broker IDS App Store Identity Management Clearing House LEARN MORE: Resilience and Sustainability Data Space ADVANEO CHALLENGE: News about evolving or new global crisis (e.g. pandemic, war, disasters) have become the new normal over the recent years. In our connected world, dampening their effects, adapting and becoming more resilient and thus sustainable, can be improved vastly, by building shared solution along these connections. And the backbone of these connection is data. As prominent use case the PAIRS-and the SPELL-Plattform will be part of the Resilience and Sustainability Dataspace. Especially the PAIRS-Plattform inside Resilience and Sustainability Data Space will allow for transparency of the supply chain by early identification of crisis and their effect on supply and production condition for each individual participant. Furthermore the participant will be aided with iteratively improved recommendation for measure to manage the crisis effect on their organization. But finding and using data in a sovereign way is a general core challenge in any data driven project. So how can interested party easily find service to become more resilient? How can they be sure that their data privacy and sovereignty is guaranteed in such an open ecosystem? And how can creator of such service find initial their initial partner and start building the required networks? SUCCESS: The answer to the above question lie in established and independently certifiable standard for sovereign data sharing and the usage of service like IDSA and GAIA-X. The Resilience and Sustainability Data Space is built on these standards. These standard are built into a unified system, which enables offering, finding and accessing relevant data source a well a resilient and sustainability services. The IDS solution, especially the corresponding connectors, a basic technology inside the Resilience and Sustainability Dataspace facilitate the necessary sovereign data exchange. BENEFITS Companies and organization a user of the Resilience and Sustainability Dataspace benefit from our data-based approach of a digital infrastructure to integrate decentralized information in a protected virtual space. With this infrastructure user are either able to apply already implemented service or to develop new service supporting our user in order to gain new insight and knowledge about. The variety of datasources which are part of the Resilience and Sustainability Dataspace also facilitates cross-over domain approach for service a also will be implemented inside the PAIRS-Plattform. Especially the supply chain use case a a cross-over domain service utilizes the different data source coming for different . By additional search and find functionality inside the Resilience and Sustainability Dataspace partner can connect to build research projects, exchange in a sovereign way data and make use of the existing dataspace infrastructure. In the end, athis enables user to seamlessly build their own trustworthy resilience and sustainability ecosystems. COMPONENTS The Resilience and Sustainability Data Space is built completely on the standard of IDSA and GAIA-X. It is run on the technical infrastructure of the Advaneo Data Space Solutions. This Data Space building block product suite offer ready-to-go integrated IDSA component like: IDS Broker IDS Connector IDS Clearing House IDS App Provider On top of this, it integrates Advaneos Trusted Data Hub: a proprietary privacy-preserving multi-party-computation solution. In an even more secured way than the standard IDSA Connector-implementation, it allows multiple party to jointly use even sensitive data in sharing use case without ever revealing the raw data to each other. LEARN MORE: Brainport Industries Smart Factory Brainport Industries | TNO CHALLENGE: Companies want to build a flexible production environment. Controlled access to data is needed to build new Smart Industry tools, such a dashboard and smart algorithms. This need to be shared between different companies, technology service provider and machines, sensor and equipment. SUCCESS: Data is shared in a controlled way through an IDS Connector. The IDS Broker make data source findable across the data space. Through a dedicated Asset Administration Shell (AAS) DataApp, data of different manufacturing asset can be exchanged in a standardized way. BENEFITS: It enables the creation of Smart Industry solution for a long-tail of manufacturing companies. This in turn increase the market potential for smart solutions. For manufacturing company the cost of integration is significantly reduced. COMPONENTS: TNO IDS Connector v2 LEAR MORE: Medical Data Space MedDS Fraunhofer ITMP | Fraunhofer FIT | Fraunhofer IOSB The Medical Data Space is a trustworthy infrastructure for the secure exchange of health data between distributed player (patient, doctor, clinic, relatives, service providers, manufacturers, etc.). This is intended to improve prevention, care, diagnosis and treatment process and enable innovative health-promoting business models. COMPONENTS: IDS Connectors IDS Broker LEARN MORE: AluTrace Fraunhofer EMI | Fraunhofer IWM | fem CHALLENGE: Due to the great freedom of design, additive manufacturing (AM) offer enormous potential for lightweight construction. In order to harness this potential, it is crucial to integrate knowledge between the individual stage of the AM value chain. By digitally linking AM process and product data, lightweight design and production can be further optimized in economic and ecological terms. The present use case demonstrates the added value for the lightweight potential of additively manufactured (laser powder bed fusion (LPBF)) aluminum component when decentralized material and AM process data is shared between actor via a cross-institutional data space. In the present use case, a design engineer aim to optimize a component, originally manufactured by casting AlSi10Mg, with regard to lightweight design by mean of topology optimization for AM. A process-specific topology optimization algorithm (PSTO) will provide an optimized design and also knowledge of the best suited combination of AM-machine, part orientation in build space and a heat treatment. As input for this design algorithm, decentralized data about mechanical material characteristics, AM process parameter and post-processing information such a heat or surface treatment ha to be shared and linked in an automatic manner. Since the different data is provided by different actors, compliance with the FAIR data principle is paramount. SUCCESS: To meet this need, a data space architecture based on the International Data Spaces (IDS) reference architecture model is designed and implemented. By doing so, the very first instance of the Materials Data Space (MDS) is created. Using the MDS in this context ensures findability (F) of the decentralized data and their owner through the use of a broker a a virtual marketplace, secure and automated access (A) to the data from the IT infrastructure of the institutions, interoperability (I) in data sharing with full guarantee of data sovereignty through the use of the IDS connectors, and the reusability (R) of the data by the PSTO based on machine- and human-understandable metadata in the form of knowledge graphs. The knowledge graph describe the entire process chain from additive manufacturing to mechanical testing and embed the resulting data in it context through an ontology-based process model. These semantic metadata enable the linking of data in the sense of a cross-institutional data fabric and automated data analysis for intelligent lightweight design by the design engineer. BENEFITS: The lightweight potential of additively manufactured component can be optimally exploited through process-specific topology optimization. The decentralized material, process and component data are semantically linked and shared in an automatic manner while maintaining the highest data sovereignty standards. A scalable solution for the integration of data and analysis result from the data space into the design process of lightweight component is provided. Detailed, diverse material, process and component data for AM lightweight material are provided in a scalable data space architecture. Tools for digital modelling of value chain and interoperable description of data and domain knowledge have been developed. COMPONENTS: IDS Dataspace Connector IDS Broker a a virtual market place IDS Identity Provider IDS Clearing House LEARN MORE: Macau-EU Cross-Border Flow of Scientific Research Data Macau University of Science and Technology | Fraunhofer ISST CHALLENGE: The safe and orderly flow and governance of data ha become a global issue, and the cross-border flow of data is one of the most complex sub-issue. At the outset, the existing international data cross-border flow mechanism is experiencing pressure from various aspect such a EU-US Privacy Shield Frameworks agreement overturned and Standard Contractual Clauses require additional supplementary measures, etc. Given the fact that data ha become more and more important for the development of both economy and society at large, the investigation after the fact approach cannot meet the satisfaction of some country or region for security and management concerns. In addition, how the different requirement for data export in different jurisdiction apply to the same business brings huge problem to practice when data keep flowing. In this case, Macau University of Science and Technology and the Fraunhofer ISST are respectively located in different jurisdictions. As a consequence, the cross-border flow of scientific research data involving personal information often arises in the scientific research cooperation activity between the two parties. If we transfer any kind of data in the multi-center joint scientific research activities, except for the traditional research ethic requirements, the two party must also meet the requirement of their respective law and regulation on the export of personal information. SUCCESS: In order to explore the mechanism for the safe and orderly flow of data across border in the digital era, we can together establish a trinity of legal regulation + management mechanism + technical assurance model in the field of scientific research, covering the whole process of before, during and after course. BENEFITS: This ha not only mark the possible and trust way to realize the purpose of data cross-border issue that needed to be addressed, but also laid a solid foundation for the future exploration in regard to this area. It is also a great opportunity to promote the development and fame of IDS in Macau and Asia. The issue of data protection, trust, traceability, transparency and security are cornerstone for the (technical) functioning of the project. Without all this, sharing and exchanging learning progress and document is difficult, especially because parent demand a controlled space for their child to work and develop. Rules must be defined and technically implemented that everyone must adhere to. So far, there is no suitable approach to doing this adequately. Every transaction is transparently and traceably logged, data can be securely stored, provided with term of use and shared. COMPONENTS: IDS Testbed Components LEARN MORE: PLATOON: Wind Energy Tecnalia | VUB | Engie | ENG | Fraunhofer | UDGA CHALLENGE: The goal of this pilot is to provide predictive maintenance of wind turbine with a focus on the generator and power converter, which can be applied to other pilot or use cases. However, nowadays, energy data doe not generally comply with the FAIR principles. In fact, it is normally kept in silo within company and it is hardly reused for other purpose than the one initially conceived for. In addition, in certain case access to data is limited to some influential big companies. This is a big innovation barrier for academia, RTOs and SMEs a they cannot leverage this data to develop new product and services. This situation around data is one of the main blocker for the energy transition. SUCCESS: IDS solution are used a the basis of PLATOONs solution for data sharing. PLATOON leverage sovereign data sharing a an enabler to develop innovative data analytics tool by combining data from multiple stakeholder from the energy value chain to unlock new value and further optimise the energy sector. Furthermore, apart from sovereign data sharing PLATOON also considers sovereign exchange of service (data analytics tools) allowing data provider to access a wide ecosystem of service providers. These innovation will contribute to accelerate the energy transition to achieve the goal set in the Green Deal. BENEFITS: PLATOON developed wind turbine digital twin with accurate physical and data-driven digital twin and model (physics-based simulation model, supervised data-driven model and normal behaviour data-driven model) that provides anomaly detection and fault diagnosis and isolation. Several business model have been defined in PLATOON regarding data/service sharing. In a nutshell, data is considered a an exchange token to get access to improved product (e.g. Wind Turbine Components with extended lifetime and enhanced performance) or data analytics service (e.g. HVAC operation optimisation, predictive maintenance tools) that can further optimise the Operation and Maintenance Cost and Improve the efficiency across the whole energy value chain. Several data analytics tool are developed (e.g., electrical transformer RUL estimation, electrical transformer health index calculation, transformer oil analysis, electrical transformer health monitoring tool, maintenance activity impact assessment, asset operation optimization tool, prosumer segmentation model, technical loss model, global loss assessment model, NTL identification model). Contact Details HOLONIX Srl Website Offshore Energy Data Trust NZTC CHALLENGE - SOLUTION: During the life cycle of an oil well, many field will change ownership and considerable time and effort will be required on part of the new owner to understand the plug and abandonment activity done to date and their past performance. A data trust would prove advantageous in delivering value to new owner of asset by providing critical information on the past performance of P&A campaign and delivering insight into planning for future programs. This could lead to a significant cost reduction, better quantify risk and enhance collaboration across the industry. BENEFITS: The combined future total North Sea Well P&A decommissioning work is estimated to carry a risk exposure of 6.3bn. If the use case solution can provide a 10% efficiency gain with 30% industry acceptance, the estimated cost saving is 189 million. By delivering capital project more efficiently, there is an environmental benefit of an estimated 186.7 million kg of CO2 reduction. COMPONENTS: No IDS component are deployed within this use case at the moment, to be considered for future stages. LEARN MORE: Open Access Book Usage Data Trust (OAeBU DT) OPERAS | OpenAIRE The Open Access Book Usage Data Trust effort (OAeBUDT), with support from the Mellon Foundation, is working towards exchanging reliable usage data in a trusted, equitable, and community-governed way. CHALLENGE: Currently, individual organization encounter challenge when collecting usage data to make strategic decision about their OA publishing and OA programs. Staff time and expertise are required to normalize and aggregate these impact metric from numerous platforms. SUCCESS: By 2025, the effort aim to foster the secure, multi-party exchange, aggregation, and benchmarking of book usage-related data; increase trust in usage metrics; improve data quality; and reduce OA reporting and compliance resource burdens. BENEFITS: The OAeBUDT plan to launch an unprecedented data space within scholarly publishing that can be extensible to impact and usage metric for other scholarly outputs. It will help organization to reduce time and staff cost related to benchmarking, impact reporting, and market positioning. Through improved access to granular, timely, trusted high-quality data, open science, and scholarship stakeholder can better support reporting, analytics, and innovation. COMPONENTS: Current development work is focused on governance building blocks. A gap analysis of core IDS service provider partner with connection to scholarly communication is planned for 2023. LEARN MORE: The Data Spaces Radar #3 Pressious Data Space Pressious Arvanitidis | Centre for Research & Technology Hellas (CERTH) | National and Kapodistrian University of Athens (NKUA) CHALLENGE: Pressious company is exhibiting a significant environmental footprint since it manufacturing process involvesan extensive usage of raw material (water, paper, ink, aluminum), where defective product contribute the largest part. Although the environmental impact of the company and the problem associated with the product defect have already been identified and partially addressed, their current management lead to excessive costs. For this purpose, Pressious R&D team collaborated with the National and Kapodistrian University of Athens (NKUA) and the Center of Research and Technology Hellas (CERTH) in order to implement Machine Learning (ML) models, taking advantage of the historical data that ha been collected by the company production line and now shared to data consumers/service provider through this data space. Furthermore, this data space enables CERTH to test tool from it DIH (nZEB) with data from another domain such a printing. SUCCESS: Through IDSA components, Pressious wa able to set up a secure data space for Printing Industry in order to share data with service provider like NKUA and CERTH and address the problem with defective products. BENEFITS: Minimization of the product deficiency that are observed during the final quality control. Facilitation of circular economy principles, becoming environmentally friendly by minimizing the use of wasted materials. Production cost reduction in order to increase human resource efficiency and enhance the production LEARN MORE: Middle Corridor ETA App World Bank Group | LogAware | Sovity | Port of Baku | Kazmortransflot | Kazakhstan Railways CHALLENGE: Freight transportation along the Middle Corridor between China and Europe contains multiple mode of transportation and struggle with limited transparency and plannability along the transport operations. There are various industry solution for this data exchange such a the Veracity ecosystem in the market today. All of them are very complex and time intensive to manage. Providers and organization on shore do not have access to ship data like emissions, fuel consumption and route details. Data access agreement between data provider such a ship owners, authority or shipyard equippers a well a service provider that take care of for example data analysis and process improvement must be negotiated individually. A common ecosystem for data exchange from ship to shore , that simplifies the process and doe not exist. SUCCESS: The IDS-based Maritime Data Space brings together all participant and platform in one trusted and secure data ecosystem. It ensures transparent access to ship-related data, enables secure, stable and efficient communication between ship and shore, and provides value-added and trusted service for ship operations. Autonomous shipping, environmental sustainability, industry 4.0 technologies, and the connection between ship are current trend that the Maritime Data Space address in an innovative way. The combination of the Norwegian DNV GL Veracity data platform with an IDS-based ecosystem strengthens Norways position in international maritime data exchange and sharing. Last but not least, the Maritime Data Space satisfies customer and regulatory demand for transparency. SUCCESS: In order to experience sovereign data exchange, sovity provides a quickly accessible data space, which allows company of every size to receive hands-on experience with data space technology. The sovity data space includes multiple connector (Dataspace Connector or EDC Connector) with an intuitive frontend, a highly scalable DAPS a well a a Broker, federated catalog, or a Clearing house. With this, the sovity Data Space can also be used a a technical starting point for the creation of new data spaces. There is almost no connection between different platform and a serious vendor lock-in problem. They monetize the users' content, yet any account can be arbitrarily banned. - These challenge are totally relevant for each and every industry: - Museums suffer without proper intellectual property right management and provenance tracking - Enterprise sector suffocates under hundred of different software system and database - Hotels struggle to pay a 20% commission to booking platform - Traditional and social medium promote lot of fake news, while fact-checking consumes huge resource - Individuals dont really own and control even their healthcare and wellness data, spread across multiple platform and system - Cadastre and tax authority cannot properly harmonize their system and databases, making citizen suffer Etc. SUCCESS: The pool of billion of PODs for people, organizations, and thing represents the Data Space itself. PODs are not interconnected among them. They are accessed only by and via platform (we call them post-platforms). Post-platforms get controlled access to PODs, read them and write back on them. Only authorized by the owner of PODs user get access to specific data on PODs, and it doe not matter which platform they use. These post-platforms are not interconnected amongst them and they do not hold any original data, just cache copies. Due to advanced security by design user have e-passports, issued by a developed public key infrastructure (PKI). With such e-passport, user can control their PODs, identify/authenticate themselves, get money from ATM, or open a hotel room. Users will not need logins/passwords anymore. Personal PODs keep data created by their owner, but also public and third-party data, for example, Cadastre, police or municipality data, other authorities, healthcare records, data from school and universities, etc. BENEFITS: The Web 3.0 Data Space concept make the physical world intensely data-rich and merges online and offline interaction into a single yet fully decentralized metaverse. Individual PODs keep all the information originated by a person via their online activities, including sent messages, posts, transactions, various file they created, etc. The same storage also keep track of all messages, comments, and reaction they or their content ever received. Organizations and public authority also record on the POD every piece of information about it owner's identity and legal liabilities, and this data cannot be changed or deleted by anyone but it authors. Every entity also store all the information related to it business and legal interaction on it POD. Just like individual ones, their PODs become unique focal point for their data. The Web 3.0 Data Space also implies that sooner or later, every real estate, vehicle, device, or even many part of them will have their own separate PODs. All information regarding their history (ownership, origin, modifications, adjustments, etc.), their future (resource left, maintenance scheduled), and their interaction with other subject and object will become available to their owners, manufacturers, regulators, partners, etc. COMPONENTS: Veracity Industry Data Platform IDS Connectors IDS Identity Provider (CA, DAPS, ParIS) IDS Metadata Broker LEARN MORE: Post-Platforms for Supply Chain Post-Platforms Sciences | Po Startinblox | Digita Digentity | SolidLab CHALLENGE: Full supply chain automation is not yet fully achievable due to data exchange and platform interconnectivity challenge - Now every authorized entity, public or private, can work (read and write) with the very same data at the source, which is always correct and always up to date. This is the same approach a working with a shared document: every user work on the same original record and can see all change in real-time. We believe and can prove that a similar approach is totally realistic even for the biggest urban agglomerations. Its even more challenging for large manufacturing company where the number of system may reach ~1000. Even from the end-user perspective, this situation is quite stressful and energy-consuming: human resource are used in a non-optimal way because of all the file exchange, related paperwork, unautomated communications; etc. But if we look at it holistically, well see large business performance considerably impacted by these dozen or even hundred of balkanized platform and system with their respective databases. Lack of interoperability is the most apparent issue. Still, there is another one behind it: data silos, multiple copy of similar data without a clear understanding of which version is the most recent. These data silo automatically imply that there is no control over data quality and that your technical team spend lot of effort to interconnect all these often almost incompatible system and to coordinate their incoherent ontologies. Last but not least, it negatively affect data transmission outside the company, including both communication with it client and all interaction with it supplier and contractors, which is especially crucial for the manufacturing sector. All these issue constantly keep too many human resource busy, consume too much energy, and result in the underperformance of the whole business. SUCCESS: Corporate data doesnt have to fit Procrustean bed of a multitude of different database with different ontology and data formats. Instead, it can be stored in a universal and fully machine-readable Linked Data format on separate secure virtual server we call them PODs for each object you interact with. Each machine or piece of equipment you use, each client or contractor you are connected with, can have such a POD with every single piece of data related to them stored there. (Logistics company) | Transbag (Logistics company) | IL Technologies | Lda (Software Studio) | Promerch (Advertising Company) |Sicaprep (installation and maintenance of electric, electronic, telecommunications, and energy infrastructures) | Madeira Waste Recycling (management, monitoring, collection, transportation, treatment and elimination of all type of industrial, commercial or residential waste) | Smart Islands Hub (European Digital Innovation Hub) SUCCESS: The Tidy City experiment proposes to equip vehicle with mobile device to take picture and later process them to automatically detect and classify problem in publicly visible infrastructures. The detected occurrence data will be shared with each corresponding partner for integration and operation optimization. To comply with the RGPD and other European and National legal requirements, all personally identifiable information (e.g., people face and license plates) will be removed from the image through the same privacy by-design process already used by Google Street View. LEARN MORE: EdgeDS Intracom Telecom SUCCESS: This use case address the emerging need for secure, trustworthy, and sovereign data exchange among diverse stakeholder in edge computing ecosystems. This approach integrates mechanism for trustworthy and sovereign data exchange, into Multi-access Edge Computing (MEC) environments, by extending the ETSI MEC Architectural Framework with IDS component and enriching Edge Computing application with data space capability in an as-a-service paradigm. BENEFITS: This work highlight the feasibility and usability of incorporating an IDS Connector-as-a-Service within the MEC Platform, towards creating a data ecosystem that enables trustworthy and sovereign data exchange and intercommunication of multiple domain and application that are hosted at the Edge. The proposed architecture provides the capability of utilizing and composing Dataspace-enabled MEC Applications, where any MEC App can act a a data service provider (potentially under some pricing scheme) towards other MEC Apps. This is not restricted to the supply of data but also extends to data process (e.g., ML models, data analytics workflows, etc.). Moreover, the MEC Platform itself can offer such value-added services, in addition to secure data exchange services, which translate to additional revenue stream for the Communication Service Provider - CSP (who is operating the MEC Platform). Last but not least, third-party data solution provider can offer (B2B2C) such data process to the CSPs to enrich their service on their MEC Platforms, without the need for third-party provider to run a MEC Apps, but rather by just providing the data processing models/software. To showcase the benefit of data-driven collaboration across system and actors, we employ a motivating example use case from the Autonomous Driving domain. We envision different scenario for autonomous, connected vehicle on a highway, which are powered with advanced safety, traffic routing, and other feature through the enactment of data service ecosystems. For instance, we consider the see-through case of a vehicle that intends to pas a truck and is temporarily provided access to a video stream of the car preceding that truck, which is equipped with a camera. Similar scenario are applicable, such a the platooning of vehicle that can drive in a coordinated manner a a group, sharing sensing information, or the exchange of safety or traffic alert between vehicle on the highway. COMPONENTS: This Use Case proposes the extension of the ETSI MEC architecture, by introducing the IDS- Connector-as-a-service, instilled directly into the MEC mechanisms. The prototype implementation of the proposed architecture includes the integration of the Dataspace Connector, implemented by Fraunhofer. In the introduced architecture, extending the MEC Architecture, each MEC Application (MEC App) can act a a data provider/consumer, in accordance with IDS role distinction. By introducing the concept of IDS Connector-as-a-Service among the functionality provided by the MEC Platform, each application is capable of obtaining it own connectorwhich exists within the MEC Platform a a MEC Platform-offered service instanceand can exchange data with any application that ha a registered connector inside or outside of the MEC host. In the scenario of two MEC Applications exchanging data, we denote MEC App1 the application that attempt to receive data, and a MEC App2 the one that provides the desired data. After the completion of the instantiation of both application and the assignment of a certified IDS connector to each of them, the connector information is available through the MEC Platforms relevant API for service discovery and availability. While data service that are not IDS enabled are registered directly on the MEC Platform, MEC App2 register the data resource it provides on it own connector. In order to consume the desired data services, MEC App1 receives the information of MEC App2s connector. Subsequently, MEC App1 performs a request to it own connector, encapsulating the information of the other connector, along with the identifier of the targeted resources. Finally, if the usage policy attached to the contract of the requested resource are accepted, then data transfer from the provider to the consumer is followed a defined by IDS. The IDS solution and it corresponding connector are basic technology that enable sovereign data exchange within the Green Deal Dataspace. Especially the supply chain use case a a cross-over domain service utilizes the different data source coming from different. By additional search and finding functionality inside the Green Deal Dataspace partner can connect to build research projects, exchange in a sovereign way data, and make use of the existing Dataspace infrastructure. In the end, this enables user to seamlessly build their own trustworthy resilience and sustainability ecosystems. LEARN MORE: Data Space Radar: Resilience Data Space (HERAKLION) Sintef | CHALLENGE: The aim of HERAKLION is a demonstrator for a scalable Resilience Data Space. This is developed on the basis of pandemic and extreme weather scenario (lead use cases), which take up the need of municipal user and implement them conceptually. The Resilience Data Space is associated with the Resilience and Sustainability Data Space (RSDS) and is developed in close cooperation with it. A bottom-up approach is pursued in the HERAKLION project, which culminates in a demonstrator for quantifying municipal resilience using data space functionalities. In contrast, the RSDS follows a top-down approach and is operated live immediately in order to integrate various project and services. SUCCESS: The aim of HERAKLION is a demonstrator for a scalable Resilience Data Space. This is developed on the basis of pandemic and extreme weather scenario (lead use cases), which take up the need of municipal user and implement them conceptually. The Resilience Data Space is associated with the Resilience and Sustainability Data Space (RSDS) and is developed in close cooperation with it. A bottom-up approach is pursued in the HERAKLION project, which culminates in a demonstrator for quantifying municipal resilience using data space functionalities. In contrast, the RSDS follows a top-down approach and is operated live immediately in order to integrate various project and services. BENEFITS: The innovation of HERAKLION is the provision of a functional Resilience Data Space and the associated analysis services, which function individually or together a a digital ecosystem in which data can be managed decentrally and used multilaterally in compliance with strict sovereignty standards. The standardized infrastructure of data space ensures a low threshold for municipal actors. The data, analytical methods, and simulation tool for the quantification of municipal resilience will be made available a a decision support system for three user groups: 1) municipalities, 2) SMEs and large companies, 3) a well a authority and organization with security task COMPONENTS: A process and template for a "Data Space Requirements Specification (DSRS)" is being developed for the special boundary condition in data space development, in which use case and requirement are initially unclear, even for the end users. On the basis of this DSRS, the technical implementation is carried out and IDS component are selected via incremental prototyping and reviewing with the end users. COMPONENTS: Data Space connector 8.0.2 Metada Broker 5.0.3 Identity Provider 1.6.0 I4.0 data space and app marketplace for connected factory and service provider Ikerlan (1) i2CAT Foundation: technical partner responsible for the implementation and deployment of the IDS-compliant data space solution, App Store prototype, and integration of the data apps into the App Store. (2) CIM UPC Foundation: industry research partner with an experimental pilot factory floor with machinery and deployed IoT sensor where the collected data originates. (3) Universitat Politcnica de Catalunya (UPC) and their Motion Control and Industrial Applications (MCIA) and Advanced Control Systems (SAC) research groups: development of the data analytics and ML applications. CHALLENGE: The scenario brings up several challenges: 1. This data is susceptible, and timely, related to core production process in the factory. Secure data transmission and agility are key, and traditional sharing method are inadequate. 2. Factories must avoid lock-in situation to service providers, requiring interoperable approach that allow them business flexibility in a competitive market of third-party services. This is equally important on the other side of the market, where SME service provider need an equal playing field for competing for that factory business. 3. New and developing regulations, such a the Data Governance Act and Data Act, change the market dynamic of data exploitation, requiring a scalable solution for data sharing that is built around core principle such a data sovereignty. SUCCESS: The i2CAT Foundation in Barcelona ha implemented an IDS-compliant data space and marketplace prototype in the regional Industry 4.0 project, Looming Factory. It address those aforementioned challenge via the following: 1. A minimal viable data space (MVDS) approach that securely connects the project pilot factory floor machinery with developed predictive analytics service through a connector-based solution. The factory maintains strict usage control over it data, transmitted over a secure system. 2. An IDS App Store prototype implementation that allows those certified third-party provider service to be discovered by the factory and deployed in their secure, connector-based environment. 3. Third-party predictive analytics service for the marketplace proof of concept developed by Looming Factory project partner included predictive maintenance, operational cost estimation, production time cycles, and energy efficiency. These acted a demonstrator for the proposed solution for industry actor outside of the R&D project. The Looming Factory project wa co-funded by the European Regional Development Fund of the European Union in the framework of the ERDF Operational Program for Catalonia 2014-2020. BENEFITS: Enabling secure, sovereign data sharing in an ecosystem of I4.0 data services: IDS-compliant trusted environment for data sharing for secure, controlled exchange of sensitive production data between factory and third-party service providers. The factory is connected to a potential ecosystem of third-party data service that optimize their production processes: higher efficiency and lower OpEx. Empowering business flexibility in the marketplace of competitive services: App Store prototype host and deploys innovative third-party data apps in an interoperable data space architecture. Factories are not locked into a single provider and have a selection of competing solutions, while SMEs can use the AppStore a an onboarding platform to provide their service to factory customer in an extensible data space. Scalable solution for data regulatory compliance: I4.0 data service provider can deploy their solution in an IDS-framework designed for future data regulation and evolving market dynamic between data and service providers. COMPONENTS: i2CAT ha implemented the solution following the IDS-RAM 3.0 architecture and based on the Open Source implementation of the different component provided by IDSA. In particular, the solution includes the following components: (1) Dataspace Connector v8.0.0; (2) App Store v2.0.0; (3) DAPS (the Fraunhofer test certification authority wa used, and specific digital certificate for the pilot were previously requested and issued.) These Open Source solution have been modified and adapted to the specific need of the use case, especially in term of the connectivity between the Dataspace Connector and the App Store. The App Store ha also been significantly improved with a new GUI and several service to connect it with a private docker image registry. LEARN MORE: FutureForest Freie Universitt Berlin | Technische Universitt Mnchen | M.O.S.S Computer Grafik Systeme GmbH CHALLENGE: Climate change make the adaption of forest a very high-priority issue for forest owner and management companies. Without reliable data, it is very hard to make decision in a fast-changing environment. Not acting will lead to economic and ecological losses. Traditionally, forest owner and practitioner rely little on data and have had no access to the data of others at all. This limit the discovery and adoption of best practices. SUCCESS: In our data space, forest research organizations, state forests, forest management company and forest practitioner can access a common pool of relevant data, such a climate data, soil data, tree specie distribution and tree health information, a well a in situ sensor data. It is well-defined who can access which data what for. As an example, the whole pool can be used to train AI models. With this central, interoperable data pool, any new organization coming on board can quickly deploy state-of-the-art solution to help in their decision-making, all the while retaining control over the data that they contribute. BENEFITS: Through the data space, risk related to climate change can be mitigated and revenue can be protected or enhanced, especially taking into account carbon capture and other incentiuves. Other ecosystem service can be enhanced, and a such, the value of the decision support given exceeds economic returns. The forestry data space also contributes to biodiversity and to the social and recreative function of forests. Contact Details Santiago Charramendieta Website iGreenPort HIADES | CIDIHUB | MNX Online | PLEYONE | CANARY Island Connection | JEMINOAL FARMAGROUP | FIWARE Foundation CHALLENGE: The quality of seawater is crucial to ensure the sustainability of ports. Coastal water are deteriorating due to pollution and eutrophication, which is expected to increase by a further 20% by 2050. For this reason, the digitalization of port process need to consider the environmental perspective. The combination of seawater quality data with information about ship characteristic and position is crucial for identifying the ship that could cause water pollution. iGreenPort address the real need of the Spanish Port of Palma de Mallorca to digitize the control of the seawater quality following the European Sea Ports Organizations SDG 14 Environmental Code of Conduct, which instructs port administration to develop tool to manage environmental problems. SUCCESS: iGreenPort is a cutting-edge initiative that provides port authority and other port agent with environmental management capabilities. It offer a Data Space for sharing and accessing environmental and operational data, combining two type of data: 1) Seawater quality data, starting with turbidity among 15 indicator mandatory by law.2) AIS data from ships, which provides information about the vessel every 3-6 seconds, including their characteristic and position. This data can be cross-referenced with the seawater quality data to determine their involvement in contaminated areas. The solution enables the authority to make faster and more informed decision that promote the efficiency and environmental sustainability of their ports. BENEFITS: Port Authorities are responsible for the prevention and control of marine pollution emergency in their service area (Zone 1) and are investing in specialized surveillance to allow for rapid action in the event of pollution incidents. iGreenPort provides a cutting-edge tool for monitoring seawater quality in near real-time and identifying ship that could cause water pollution. COMPONENTS: Several DSBA-based FIWARE component are used in the iGreenPort Data Space, such a a marketplace, security component, and the storage of large amount of real-time data. Additionally, iShare is used for multinational electronic identification LEARN MORE: The European Legal Data Space Nucleus Athena | eBOS | NOVA | TIB | SWC | LS Teach | IDSA | IMDEA | GT | DFKI | Wolters Kluwer Deutschland GmbH | Siemens | Nicos | Oxford Semantics SUCCESS: The use case is describing a data space nucleus for legal information based on IDS standards. This allows for both comprehensive and focused viewpoint to be taken in delivering on the value of data space for organizations. Technical Expertise Detecon, a a technology-oriented management consultancy, support the implementation of data space from both a business and technology perspective by structuring the creation of trust-based, sovereign data ecosystem across organizational boundary using an established framework, collaboratively designing interoperable information model and data architectures, and enabling new business application that meet specific requirement for cost-effectiveness and feasibility. Building on competency in data strategy, data integration, data analytics, and data-driven business models, Detecon take a comprehensive approach to data spaces. Along the core methodology and depending on the project's scope, the target definition for the data space use case is first defined, the data ecosystem of the involved party is assessed, and within the boundary of these considerations, a data space can then be designed and implemented. Contact Details Contact Website HUAWEI Data Space Huawei | Fraunhofer ISST CHALLENGE: Data exchange economy need a trust mechanism for cross-subject data flow for different data sharing scenario (B2B, B2C, G2C and G2B) To achieve trusted framework a data usage control mechanism need to be implemented to manage and monitor the entire process of data exchange Automated cross-entity data usage control policy is required with contract and effective performance with blockchain technology Sovereign Control should enable data owner to decide how data is used: Construct an ecosystem with Multi-Party Trust, for performing trustworthy authentication on organizations, individuals, and technical component through qualification assessment and certificate issuance, establish a unified trust mechanism, and ensure that participants' identity and platform environment are trusted Create composable policy to control data access, and set policy based on data use (ie. validity period, number of viewing time or downloads, access rights). Control use of data to ensure that data is used in compliance with law and regulation based on data sovereignty and control Support data provider to verify and trace user access, and exempt consumer can be exempted from the certificate. Provide reliable and visible audit tracing service throughout the process, support provider to verify and trace, and if needed to revoke certificate from consumers, and provide corresponding audit information for third-party supervision SUCCESS: IDS-RAM and Eclipse Dataspace Components are at the core of a Huawei Data Space solution, that ha been created to address business challenge listed above, and ha been developed in compliance with and according to IDS specification (with new IDS component to be included) BENEFITS: Global economy consists of a variety of data supplier and consumer in the upstream and downstream industry chains. To promote the rapid development of a data-based economy and to improve production efficiency, data must be effectively shared and data sovereignty must be guaranteed. Huawei Data Space solution provides key service value stream such a data provision, data consumption, and data operation supervision and control.Based on an IDS Data Space technology it ensures that data flow are trusted, controllable, and verifiable. Currently, Huawei Data Space support 16 participants, 6 business scenarios, and 21+ use control policies. 5,000+ data asset have been uploaded, and 10,000+ data exchange have been performed, effectively supporting the in-depth business collaboration of ecosystem partner in the computing industry in R&D, manufacturing, and product services. COMPONENTS: Huawei Data Space us standard open-source components, known by enterprise to ensure fast adaptability. Developed Glue-code will be made available a open source a well. It us the following components: 1) Keycloak for Identity Federation2) Apache Atlas a a federated service catalog3) ELK-Stack for compliance monitoring4) EDC v.0.2.1 (Eclipse Dataspace Connector) for policy-based Data Exchange5) Web-UI for easy end-user access6) Integration and Deployment code for easy deployment LEARN MORE: The ENES Data Space Centro Euro-Mediterraneo sui Cambiamenti Climatici (CMCC) | Institut Pierre Simon Laplace (IPSL) | Centre National de Recherche Scientifique (CNRS) CHALLENGE: The European Network for Earth System (ENES) modeling community wa launched in 2001 comprising a network of about 50 group including public, academic, and industrial partner who agreed to work together and cooperate to discus strategy to accelerate progress in climate, Earth system modeling and understanding. This community is a key player in the assessment of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) and provides the multi-model climate projection on which EU mitigation and adaptation policy are built. The ENES community is facing new challenge a a result of the increased model complexity and the availability of emerging computing platforms. Moreover, new multi-disciplinary audience need access to the ever-increasing volume of data for addressing climate change societal challenges. SUCCESS:Data, services, and tool represent the three fundamental component of the ENES Data Space ecosystem. The data offering is at the core of the data space. However, it is important to remark that data alone would not be enough without a comprehensive ecosystem, including a wide set of tool and service enabling scientist to develop applications, analyze data, visualize results, reproduce analyses, share code, and publish new products. Through the seamless integration of these different aspects, the ENES Data Space aim to support challenging climate-related analysis and applications. IDS would play a key role in this allowing the ENES Data Space to adopt or be compliant with standard in the field, thus enabling increased data sharing based on trustworthy technology and interoperable formats. BENEFITS: The ENES Data Space aim to provide climate scientist with a complete ready-to-use research environment enabling them to perform scientific analysis on large climate datasets. Providing scientist with large ready-to-use datasets and software solution closely integrated with the computing infrastructure can almost completely eliminate the setup time and dramatically increase productivity. Moreover, the possibility of easily reusing application and sharing the research output represents a key aspect in the scientific analysis process towards Open Science and a more sustainable, effective, and FAIR use of data. Overall, the ENES Data Space can democratize climate data analysis by supporting new user group and community that do not currently have access to solution capable of addressing such large-scale analysis. COMPONENTS: The ENES Data Space architecture consists of the following functional components: a) Gateway Interface and Authentication/Authorization (Identity Provider) b) Data Science Environment including i) Analytics engine ii) Data cataloging utility and related domain-specific Data Reference Syntax, controlled vocabularies, and convention c) Cloud-Based Computing Platform; d) Data Access and Sharing service LEARN MORE: CADS - Carbon Agri Data Space Rezos Brands S.A. | NOSC UA DIH (KAU) | DIH Faubourg Numrique | BIOINVEST-AGRO | FARMLEAP | OKP4 | PROINT PROJECTEN | Trusty | iSolutions Labs CHALLENGE: One of the biggest challenge in agriculture today is the use of heterogeneous data for smart farming technologies, improving soil fertility, and food quality, and reducing the impact of agricultural technology on climate change. Today, numerous source of data are collected and not leveraged a much a they could be. Potential application are huge, such a decision-support tool taking into account not only scientific recommendation but also information about the experience of using various agricultural additive for specific climatic and environmental conditions. Carbon measurement and estimation are promising application to improve the existing systems, but also to provide new value stream for farmers. SUCCESS: The idea is a service for the assessment of the carbon footprint of agricultural product in the process of growing a well a tool for sound adjustment of agro-technological, organizational, and management decision by food producers. Thanks to a data-sharing ecosystem, we will provide the opportunity for farmer (through data service provider interacting with the decentralized data-sharing infrastructure), to leverage the use of the data they already produce, combined with other data source such a external and open data. It will provide them with tool that will help the farmer to come up with tangible proof of their carbon impact. Also, dedicated stakeholder of the ecosystem will find go-to-market opportunity for these proofs, bringing back value for the whole ecosystem. BENEFITS: Data sharing will demonstrate benefit for many participant in optimizing existing products, valorizing bi-products, and making data space partner more attractive to downstream user in selecting new primary producer for new product line within the carbon-negative economy. Also, some output of the data space are valued by the market, and this value will be distributed among contributors, according to a fair business model driven by the rising price per tonne of CO2-e in the market a EU-wide sequestration target drive large-scale investor to increase the volume of carbon-negative market product becoming available at scale (including on-farm soil carbon sequestration and long-cycle productization). COMPONENTS: Veracity Industry Data Platform IDS Connectors IDS Identity Provider (CA, DAPS, ParIS) IDS Metadata Broker LEARN MORE: Increased visibility of order delivery process VTT | Wrtsil | Uwira CHALLENGE: The use case revolves around expediting and enhancing transparency between a focal company of a manufacturing ecosystem (OEM) and it supplier in their production order management processes. The existing communication method have proven inadequate in facilitating efficient and adaptable exchange between the two entities. By facilitating transparency and fostering a more seamless integration between the IT system of both companies, the management of product order can be streamlined, resulting in heightened efficiency and a reduction in errors. SUCCESS: The objective is to facilitate a reliable and seamless flow of data between the OEM and it supplier by establishing a dedicated data space. The developed solution will be seamlessly integrated with pre-existing IT infrastructure of both company and the solution is grounded in the framework of the IDS reference architecture. The OEM can selectively disclose data from their production environment to the supplier without the fear of data leakages. Respectively, the supplier receives only the data that are essential for them and there is no need to locally extract meaningful insight and valuable information from big data sets. BENEFITS: The established data space solution ha the potential to significantly enhance transparency between the OEM and the supplier. This give rise to several potential benefits, including: Effective Communication: Transparent communication help in conveying accurate information about product specifications, requirements, changes, and timelines. Risk Management: Sharing information about potential risks, such a change in demand or design modifications, allows supplier to proactively address these issues. Furthermore, in time of disruptions, such a supply shortage or unexpected market shifts, transparent communication help both party respond more effectively. Cost Efficiency: Transparent communication allows both party to work together to find cost-effective solutions. COMPONENTS: IDS connector - serve a the communication interface linking the two company and their existing IT systems. With IDS connectors, a data provider can define the rule and condition (usage policies) under which data are shared with a data consumer. DAPS - enables connector to authenticate themselves using X.509 certificates. After successful authentication, the DAPS issue OAuth2 access token for connectors, who need these token to access the service and data of other connectors. Metadata Broker store information about the data end-points offered by the participants. The broker provides a query interface for connector and can hence be considered a the search engine in this use case. LEARN MORE: Data and service marketplace for energy flexibility management VTT | European Dynamics | Caverion | Volue CHALLENGE: The energy ecosystem is formed by various stakeholders, including technology providers, energy service providers, aggregators, TSOs, DSOs, suppliers, balancing responsible parties, and consumers/prosumers, to name a few. The module provides the infrastructure for two type of marketplaces: service and data. The Data Marketplaces will be built upon IDS-compliant infrastructure that enables data provider to share data while maintaining data sovereignty. LEARN MORE: TRUSTEE - Trust and privacy preserving computing platform for cross-border federation of data VTT | FORTH | HMU | VTT | Panasonic Automotive Systems Europe GmbH | The University of Vienna | K3Y | ACCELIGENCE | Universit Cattolica del Sacro Cuore | Ericsson Nikola Tesla | Adrestia R&D | TECNALIA | RINA | ZORTENET | InQbit Innovations | FUJITSU | Hewlett Packard Enterprise | CDS | The Institute of Space Science | CheckWatt AB | Athena Research Center | Edinburgh Napier University | Etoile Partners LTD SUCCESS: In a data-driven world, interdisciplinary and geographically dispersed data repository naturally emerge. These repository may not always adhere to established interdisciplinary data representation standard or participate in data federation initiatives. As a result, researcher often face limited access to valuable data, and maintaining integrity, privacy, and security during data exchange can be exceptionally challenging, if not impossible. The EU-funded TRUSTEE project aim to address these challenge by delivering a green, secure, trustworthy, and privacy-aware framework. This framework will aggregate data from multiple interdisciplinary repository in sector such a healthcare, education, energy, space, automotive, and cross-border domains. Additionally, TRUSTEE will integrate with other European data federation space and transnational initiatives, including IDS and Gaia-X. This integration between the TRUSTEE framework and IDS/Gaia-X initiative will create a synergy where additional data provider can participate, allowing IDS/Gaia-X data provider to leverage TRUSTEE's capabilities. Simultaneously, TRUSTEE user will gain access to the data hosted on e.g., IDS connectors, fostering collaboration and data sharing across domains. COMPONENTS: In the TRUSTEE framework, the IDS connector serf a the bridge connecting IDS data space to TRUSTEE, facilitating seamless data exchange between these entities. The dynamic attribute provisioning service (DAPS) enables connector to authenticate themselves using X.509 certificate received from the Certificate Authority (CA). In TRUSTEE the metadata broker service can be utilized a an additional metadata repository enabling e.g., the TRUSTEE compatible IDS connector to discover data resource that other IDS connector can offer for TRUSTEE platform users. These tool and service will greatly improve both sustainability and efficiency in manufacturing, towards digital-enabled industrial sustainability and resilience. Digital Product Passport (DPP) store and share all relevant information along the product lifecycle. The data content of DPP will evolve and expand during the manufacturing value chain and provide information to the cognitive decision support system for various human actors. Data space infrastructure's technical and organizational component (e.g., IDSA connectors) are used for ensuring the secure and trusted exchange of product-related information across stakeholders. COMPONENTS: IDS Connector a test, demonstration, evaluation, and adoption of Data Spaces that can be used a a method to access/share/exchange data in the Value Chain (additional information to that included in the DPP). COMPONENTS: IDSA connector (VTT extended Data Space Connector) Broker DAPS (based on IDSA test bed) LEARN MORE: VELES Project (HORIZON-WIDERA-2022-ACCESS-04 101087483) Consortium 15 Partners from 7 from EU country (GATE |TBS | HDHC | INSO | JOIST | IMAGO-MOL | IDSA | CIT | BIOBG | UEFISCD I | CYENS | AMEN | NEHA | MEG | 3aeHea) CHALLENGE: Bulgaria, Cyprus, Greece, and Romania are part of the country that are lagging in term of digitalization of the healthcare sector and innovation-driven initiative therein (as per report of ICT&Health, DESI Index, and others). Current regulation in these country provide a framework to set up centralized healthcare database but offer no specific guidance on interoperability standards. The innovation potential in the healthcare domain of the 4 participating widening country is growing but specific policy and instrument for support are necessary to be adopted. Available funding mechanism do not encompass the whole field of Digital Health and Innovation, whereas there are many innovative start-ups and company needing guidance in their path of innovation excellence in the healthcare domain. COMPONENTS: IDS-based Data Spaces DjustConnect ILVO CHALLENGE: Making data sharing safe and efficient, with respect for farmer and horticulturists. For everybody in the agricultural food chain, we provide access to available data in a correct way. By feeding data to smart application administration get easier and advice tool get more accurate. SUCCESS: Offering a user-friendly dashboard to farmer and other user of the platform, guaranteeing the implementation of The European code of conduct for data sharing in agriculture and giving back control to the farmer BENEFITS: DjustConnect is a transparent and open platform that facilitates connection for every organization. It allows standardized methodology for both the connection process and the transfer of data, simplifying connection a much a possible. DjustConnect actively enables and support the ongoing digitalization of the sector. COMPONENTS: DjustConnect is based on the IDS architecture. We are an API-based platform, that offer centralized consent to data provider and data right holder (farmers and horticulturists). We implement the following IDS-based components: -Service Provider -Clearing House -Identity Provider LEARN MORE: DataBri-X Project (HORIZON-CL4-2021-DATA-01-03) Athena | eBOS | NOVA | Technische Informationsbibliothek (TIB) |Semantic Web Company GMBH | LSTECH Sain SL | Funcacion IMDEA Networks | Guardtime OU | Deutsches Forschungszentrum fur Kusntliche Intelligenz GMBH | International Data Spaces Association | Wolters Kluwer Deutschland GMBH | Siemens Aktiengesellschaft Oesterreich | Nicos Aktiengesellschaft | Oxford Semantic Technologies Limited SUCCESS: Energy community can greatly benefit from a data market strategy, where energy-related data, possibly real-time can be consistently described and searched by the different actor in the community, and where energy trade can be facilitated by security, privacy, and legal mechanisms. Fraunhofer also develops all component of the reference architecture in house and is thus in a position to provide a prototypical data space. The component developed by Fraunhofer are collected in the Fraunhofer IDS Lab and can be demonstrated there. Besides, Fraunhofer ha adapted the component to the respective need in various project with companies. Contact Details Ralf Neubauer Website: Business Expertise To support your organisational strategy, we work together with key people in your organisation to explore the opportunity for data sharing and data sovereignty with existing and new partner in your ecosystem. We investigate the concrete benefit of data sharing and data sovereignty, and identify how they can help you leverage your data asset to create value. Pursuing a new data strategy is likely to have a big impact on your organisation from both a business and a technical perspective. We facilitate several different training module that will help you, your co-worker and your ecosystem partner understand what data sharing and data sovereignty encompasses, how data sharing and data sovereignty will impact your service portfolio and what it take to develop your very own sovereign data sharing use cases! We tailor our content to your specific needs. Contact Details Pieter Schuurmans Website Business Expertise Business expertise focusing on creating most adequate business model for monetization of data and associated services. Example from Energy Domain - Offshore Wind Energy Data Space use case: Currently, only windfarm operator and OEMs have access to the data collected from the wind energy turbine in operation and therefore they are the only player that are presently extracting value out of data. Most European component supplier and ICT company do not have access to this data missing the opportunity to improve their competitiveness through digitalization of product and services. In this context, in Tecnalia together with the Basque Energy Cluster we are designing and developing an offshore wind digital platform based on IDSA reference architecture to enable data sharing amongst all the actor of the value chain. Technical Expertise Technical expertise from different R&D projects, focusing on: connectors, broker, usage control, clearing house, info model and vocabulary provider. Example from Manufacturing Domain - TECNALIA Industry division ha implemented a connection of manufacturing service (proprietary and external) to the central IDS module (CA, Broker) through their IDS configured connector. In addition, TECNALIA ha implemented a manufacturing data space based on the IDS RA to market manufacturing equipment. At last, TECNALIA is working on the implementation of IDS RA in the interaction of the manufacturing company with the DIH ecosystem. Contact Details Sebastian Kleff Website Green Data Hub DIO: Data Space Digital Climate Twin Data Intelligence Initiative (DIO) | Spatial Services | Ubimet | Zentrum fr Virtual Reality und Visualisierung (VRVis) | sterreichischer Dachverband fr Geoinformation (AGEO) | Climate Lab | Nexyo | Amazon Web Services | Microsoft | Hewlett Packard Enterprise CHALLENGE: A digital twin link several model of predictable feature of an object and enables the simulation of scenario of the same. In this way, the impact of new technology on local climate, air quality and health can be demonstrated. SUCCESS: Developing a digital twin (or digital shadow) requires access to different data sources, efficient data management and data cleansing strategies. In addition, it requires resource for computationally intensive modelling, a well a evaluation process and (online) feedback on the simulated entity. The possibility to exchange data in a decentralised way while maintaining data sovereignty is a key enabling factor. COMPONENTS is used a a connector. The Data Space is conform to the european Gaia-X initiative and IDSA reference architecture a well a IDS certification. Data Space participant are free to use other connector that meet the above mentioned standards.
