Contact Details Santiago Charramendieta Website Introduction In enabling client toward the use of data spaces, Detecon relies on established method of data thinking and data integration to provide client with individualized solutions. This allows for both comprehensive and focused viewpoint to be taken in delivering on the value of data space for organizations. Technical Expertise Detecon, a a technology-oriented management consultancy, support the implementation of data space from both a business and technology perspective by structuring the creation of trust-based, sovereign data ecosystem across organizational boundary using an established framework, collaboratively designing interoperable information model and data architectures, and enabling new business application that meet specific requirement for cost-effectiveness and feasibility. Building on competency in data strategy, data integration, data analytics, and data-driven business models, Detecon take a comprehensive approach to data spaces. Along the core methodology and depending on the project's scope, the target definition for the data space use case is first defined, the data ecosystem of the involved party is assessed, and within the boundary of these considerations, a data space can then be designed and implemented. Contact Details Contact Website Increased visibility of order delivery process VTT | Wrtsil | Uwira CHALLENGE: The use case revolves around expediting and enhancing transparency between a focal company of a manufacturing ecosystem (OEM) and it supplier in their production order management processes. The existing communication method have proven inadequate in facilitating efficient and adaptable exchange between the two entities. By facilitating transparency and fostering a more seamless integration between the IT system of both companies, the management of product order can be streamlined, resulting in heightened efficiency and a reduction in errors. SUCCESS: The objective is to facilitate a reliable and seamless flow of data between the OEM and it supplier by establishing a dedicated data space. The developed solution will be seamlessly integrated with pre-existing IT infrastructure of both company and the solution is grounded in the framework of the IDS reference architecture. The OEM can selectively disclose data from their production environment to the supplier without the fear of data leakages. Respectively, the supplier receives only the data that are essential for them and there is no need to locally extract meaningful insight and valuable information from big data sets. BENEFITS: The established data space solution ha the potential to significantly enhance transparency between the OEM and the supplier. This give rise to several potential benefits, including: Effective Communication: Transparent communication help in conveying accurate information about product specifications, requirements, changes, and timelines. Risk Management: Sharing information about potential risks, such a change in demand or design modifications, allows supplier to proactively address these issues. Furthermore, in time of disruptions, such a supply shortage or unexpected market shifts, transparent communication help both party respond more effectively. Cost Efficiency: Transparent communication allows both party to work together to find cost-effective solutions. COMPONENTS: IDS connector - serve a the communication interface linking the two company and their existing IT systems. With IDS connectors, a data provider can define the rule and condition (usage policies) under which data are shared with a data consumer. DAPS - enables connector to authenticate themselves using X.509 certificates. After successful authentication, the DAPS issue OAuth2 access token for connectors, who need these token to access the service and data of other connectors. Metadata Broker store information about the data end-points offered by the participants. The broker provides a query interface for connector and can hence be considered a the search engine in this use case. LEARN MORE: Education Are you IDS-ready? We can help you get there! Our partner offer hands-on training and seminar where you can learn about implementing IDS and speed up your journey to sovereign data sharing. Introduction to data space This course provides a robust introduction to IDS, covering architecture, standards, and challenge in international data sharing. Through practical examples, participant learn how IDS foster secure collaboration across sectors. Language: SpanishDetails: Configuration and use of data space This workshop will provide the basic knowledge to configure, deploy and operate an IDS-based data space, from the initial configuration of the connector and publishing of a data source to the realization of a complete data transaction. Language: SpanishDetails: IDS Certification criterion participant This course cover certification criterion and process for organization to become data provider or consumer in an IDS Data Space. Participants will learn about certification, standards, policies, and best practices, gaining the knowledge to guide their organization through IDS certification and excel a data participants. Language: SpanishDetails: IDS Certification criterion component This workshop provides a clear understanding of the criterion for IDS certification, with a focus on connectors. Participants gain insight into standards, technical requirements, and best practices. Through assessment and case studies, they demonstrate proficiency in developing compliant IDS connectors, enhancing solution implementation. Language: SpanishDetails: Introduction to data anonymization In this course fundamental concept of data anonymization along with technique for masking, randomization, aggregation and evaluation of their effectiveness will be covered and explained. On top of that, existing challenge and limitation on the topic of data anonymization will be discussed. Language: SpanishDetails: DSC: An open-source implementation of the IDS connector This course equips participant with knowledge and skill to utilize the Data Space Connector (DSC), an open-source implementation of the IDS connector. Learn fundamentals, architecture, customization. Gain hands-on experience through practical example and exercises. Language: SpanishDetails: Basic Training Data Sovereignty and IDS The workshop provides an understanding of the different architectural pattern for data sharing, explains the concept of data sovereignty and the IDS architecture. You learn about data handling in business ecosystem based on use case and exhibits. Details: IDS Lab: Demo Area & Training Program The IDS Lab provides demo for various software component of the IDS ecosystem (Connectors, Brokers, etc.). This allows user to simulate the operation of IDS and learn how to use the software component in a lab environment. Details: IDS Component Certification Prepare for IDS Certification: This workshop give you an understanding of what is required for successful IDS Component Certification and compare these requirement to the stage of development of your component. Details: Additional topic Any IDSA member can offer training and workshops. Click to propose practical idea for educational session that can help our member implement IDS concept in their product and services. Measurable benefit can be listed as: Up to 30% quality on model thanks to the application of federated learning techniques, reduce inversion and time to market on IA-based solution or lower communication loads. STANDARIZED DATA SPACE The organization is ready to take part in the knowledge economy with other entities, domain experts, and technology providers. COMPONENTS: Data Space connector 8.0.2 Metada Broker 5.0.3 Identity Provider 1.6.0 Gaia-X4KI A sovereign data and service ecosystem for artificial intelligence in automotive development, production, and operation DLR | T-Systems | Capgemini Engineering | Continental | IAV | Intel | Conweaver | HighQSoft | Reuschlaw | STTech | Fraunhofer ITWM | Fraunhofer ISST | Hochschule Offenburg | Leibniz Universitt Hannover | Technische Hochschule Ingolstadt CHALLENGE: Autonomous driving scenario and the industrial production of required device face a broad range of challenge related to data sovereignty and security. In particular, transfer of large, sensitive file and service in a policy-conform way are addressed in the prototypes. SUCCESS: The solution are cloud-based and are embedded in existing industrial cloud landscape to enhance data sovereignty of participant in complex data exchange relations. BENEFITS: Gaia-X4KI connects various stakeholder and their diverse system landscape from the complete autonomous driving development lifecycle. COMPONENTS: Eclipse Dataspace Components (EDC) and EDC MVD including Connector, Federated Catalog, Identity Hub, Registration Service PREREQUISITES: The data space is currently in development and being tested inside the project. It base on open source components. LEARN MORE: Introduction IKERLAN is a leading knowledge transfer technological centre providing competitive value to companies. We seek for excellence in R&D&i, thanks to the continuous adaptation to the need of our customer and the proximity with the business reality. Faithful to our mission, we have been working daily since 1974 to develop solution that allow our customer to become more and more competitive. We are a cooperative member of the MONDRAGON Corporation and the Basque Research and Technology Alliance (BRTA). Business Expertise Thanks to a unique cooperation model, which combine technology transfer activities, internal research and training of highly qualified personnel, IKERLAN is currently the trusted technological partner of major company in the country. To meet our goal, we are structured into two technological specialization units: ELECTRONICS, INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGIES ENERGY AND MECHATRONICS IKERLAN is a center that is dynamic and open to the world. We are an accredited agent of the Basque Network of Science, Technology, and Innovation and of the Spanish Federation of Technology Centres. We have a major cooperation network integrated with renowned European center and universities, with which we conduct activity of research and training of researchers. Technical Expertise Mission: To solve the technological challenge of the companies, improve their competitiveness and collaborate with the sustainable social and economic development of the environment, all of that from a position of technological leadership and with differential ability in their area of expertise. Vission: Technological center, cooperative and non-profit, known a the European leader in it area of specialization, with an exceptional cohesive human team, that provides value to the company and society. Contact Details Santiago Charramendieta Website Increased visibility of order delivery process VTT | Wrtsil | Uwira CHALLENGE: The use case revolves around expediting and enhancing transparency between a focal company of a manufacturing ecosystem (OEM) and it supplier in their production order management processes. The existing communication method have proven inadequate in facilitating efficient and adaptable exchange between the two entities. By facilitating transparency and fostering a more seamless integration between the IT system of both companies, the management of product order can be streamlined, resulting in heightened efficiency and a reduction in errors. SUCCESS: The objective is to facilitate a reliable and seamless flow of data between the OEM and it supplier by establishing a dedicated data space. The developed solution will be seamlessly integrated with pre-existing IT infrastructure of both company and the solution is grounded in the framework of the IDS reference architecture. The OEM can selectively disclose data from their production environment to the supplier without the fear of data leakages. Respectively, the supplier receives only the data that are essential for them and there is no need to locally extract meaningful insight and valuable information from big data sets. BENEFITS: The established data space solution ha the potential to significantly enhance transparency between the OEM and the supplier. This give rise to several potential benefits, including: Effective Communication: Transparent communication help in conveying accurate information about product specifications, requirements, changes, and timelines. Risk Management: Sharing information about potential risks, such a change in demand or design modifications, allows supplier to proactively address these issues. Furthermore, in time of disruptions, such a supply shortage or unexpected market shifts, transparent communication help both party respond more effectively. Cost Efficiency: Transparent communication allows both party to work together to find cost-effective solutions. COMPONENTS: IDS connector - serve a the communication interface linking the two company and their existing IT systems. With IDS connectors, a data provider can define the rule and condition (usage policies) under which data are shared with a data consumer. DAPS - enables connector to authenticate themselves using X.509 certificates. After successful authentication, the DAPS issue OAuth2 access token for connectors, who need these token to access the service and data of other connectors. Metadata Broker store information about the data end-points offered by the participants. The broker provides a query interface for connector and can hence be considered a the search engine in this use case. LEARN MORE: The heart of the matter Youll find all of themostmission-critical document and other information about IDSAs work and partner projectshere. IDS Reference Architecture Model Version 4.0 | 2022 IDSA RulebookWhite Paper | 2023 The Data Spaces Radar Version 4 | March 2024 IDSA overview brochure March 2024 Data Connector Report No. 14 | April 2024 Design Principles for Data SpacesPosition Paper 2021 GAIA-X and IDS Position Paper 2021 | Version 1.0 Implementing the European Strategy on Data - Role of the IDS Position Paper 2020 | Version 1.0 DIN SPEC 27070 English Version SEND A REQUEST More publication Any questions? Contact us! Your contact person:Nora GrasSenior Communication Manager Become a member Benefit from all current developments: Become a member of the International Data Spaces Association now! Most Important Documents Stay updated with u Share this page: International Data Spaces e. V. Emil-Figge-Str. 80 44227 Dortmund, Germany Phone:+49 (0)231 70096 501 2016 2024 | All Rights Reserved | International Data Spaces Association | | | | Follow u Follow u Follow u Follow u Learn more aiXia aiXia" which will be led by LANTEK (digital services) together with the company LIS SOLUTIONS | S.L. (data analytics and ai services) | INGETEAM, S.A.(energy) | GOIZPER S.COOP. (machine-tool industry) | MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY S.COOP. (manufacturing) | UBIKARE ZAINKETAK, S.L. (healthcare) | EROSKI S.COOP (retail) | The technology coordinator is IKERLAN (a leading knowledge transfer center providing competitive value to companies) SUCCESS: Seeks to promote and research the necessary technology for the definition of a reference architecture, operational models, adoption of standard and development for a data space based on the common technical framework proposed by DSBA members, extending it main service to favor the development of artificial intelligence with guarantee of traceability, security, and governance of the data and services. BENEFITS: Aims to provide the country with a reliable data space that enables company to offer new concept of high-added value service based on data sharing, through the servitization of collaborative artificial intelligence for the productization and monetization of their data and industry knowledge in new business models. COMPONENTS: Will develop new service in the field of artificial intelligence and will explore current IDS component implementation (focusing on Connectors, Metadatabroker, and IdentityProviders) in order to select one of them to rely on. LEARN MORE: MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY EGOKIA MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY - an international firm specializing in the development of automatization and assembly solution for various sectors. It operates 6 production plant around the world and is part of the largest cooperative group in the world | IKERLAN Technical research center and member of IDSA CHALLENGE: EGOKIA solution allows collaborative learning and knowledge sharing between geographically distributed plants, integrating headquarters in Basque Country and domain experts. Thanks to the data space, data, and AI asset can be securely shared throughout different corporate site and a new knowledge-based economy emerges. SUCCESS: Deploys an architecture based on IDSA connectors, linking Mondragon Assemblys data and AI platform from different corporate sites. With this new reliable data space, we extend the lifecycle of artificial intelligence models, enhance their capabilities, and facilitate trusted access and use of it asset by EGOKIA participants. BENEFITS: NEW BUSINESS MODEL: A new business model based on AI service and a knowledge-based economy. RELIABLE AI SOLUTIONS: A "standardized", flexible, and secure solution to break data silo to share and complete AI asset and process between trusted organization and production plants. Measurable benefit can be listed as: Up to 30% quality on model thanks to the application of federated learning techniques, reduce inversion and time to market on IA-based solution or lower communication loads. STANDARIZED DATA SPACE The organization is ready to take part in the knowledge economy with other entities, domain experts, and technology providers. In particular, transfer of large, sensitive file and service in a policy-conform way are addressed in the prototypes. SUCCESS: The solution are cloud-based and are embedded in existing industrial cloud landscape to enhance data sovereignty of participant in complex data exchange relations. (healthcare) | EROSKI S.COOP (retail) | The technology coordinator is IKERLAN (a leading knowledge transfer center providing competitive value to companies) SUCCESS: Seeks to promote and research the necessary technology for the definition of a reference architecture, operational models, adoption of standard and development for a data space based on the common technical framework proposed by DSBA members, extending it main service to favor the development of artificial intelligence with guarantee of traceability, security, and governance of the data and services. BENEFITS: Aims to provide the country with a reliable data space that enables company to offer new concept of high-added value service based on data sharing, through the servitization of collaborative artificial intelligence for the productization and monetization of their data and industry knowledge in new business models. COMPONENTS: Will develop new service in the field of artificial intelligence and will explore current IDS component implementation (focusing on Connectors, Metadatabroker, and IdentityProviders) in order to select one of them to rely on. LEARN MORE: MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY EGOKIA MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY - an international firm specializing in the development of automatization and assembly solution for various sectors. It operates 6 production plant around the world and is part of the largest cooperative group in the world | IKERLAN Technical research center and member of IDSA CHALLENGE: EGOKIA solution allows collaborative learning and knowledge sharing between geographically distributed plants, integrating headquarters in Basque Country and domain experts. Thanks to the data space, data, and AI asset can be securely shared throughout different corporate site and a new knowledge-based economy emerges. SUCCESS: Deploys an architecture based on IDSA connectors, linking Mondragon Assemblys data and AI platform from different corporate sites. With this new reliable data space, we extend the lifecycle of artificial intelligence models, enhance their capabilities, and facilitate trusted access and use of it asset by EGOKIA participants. BENEFITS: NEW BUSINESS MODEL: A new business model based on AI service and a knowledge-based economy. RELIABLE AI SOLUTIONS: A "standardized", flexible, and secure solution to break data silo to share and complete AI asset and process between trusted organization and production plants. Measurable benefit can be listed as: Up to 30% quality on model thanks to the application of federated learning techniques, reduce inversion and time to market on IA-based solution or lower communication loads. STANDARIZED DATA SPACE The organization is ready to take part in the knowledge economy with other entities, domain experts, and technology providers. COMPONENTS: Data Space connector 8.0.2 Metada Broker 5.0.3 Identity Provider 1.6.0 Gaia-X4KI A sovereign data and service ecosystem for artificial intelligence in automotive development, production, and operation DLR | T-Systems | Capgemini Engineering | Continental | IAV | Intel | Conweaver | HighQSoft | Reuschlaw | STTech | Fraunhofer ITWM | Fraunhofer ISST | Hochschule Offenburg | Leibniz Universitt Hannover | Technische Hochschule Ingolstadt CHALLENGE: Autonomous driving scenario and the industrial production of required device face a broad range of challenge related to data sovereignty and security. In particular, transfer of large, sensitive file and service in a policy-conform way are addressed in the prototypes. SUCCESS: The solution are cloud-based and are embedded in existing industrial cloud landscape to enhance data sovereignty of participant in complex data exchange relations. BENEFITS: Gaia-X4KI connects various stakeholder and their diverse system landscape from the complete autonomous driving development lifecycle. COMPONENTS: Eclipse Dataspace Components (EDC) and EDC MVD including Connector, Federated Catalog, Identity Hub, Registration Service PREREQUISITES: The data space is currently in development and being tested inside the project. It base on open source components. LEARN MORE: Introduction IKERLAN is a leading knowledge transfer technological centre providing competitive value to companies. We seek for excellence in R&D&i, thanks to the continuous adaptation to the need of our customer and the proximity with the business reality. Faithful to our mission, we have been working daily since 1974 to develop solution that allow our customer to become more and more competitive. We are a cooperative member of the MONDRAGON Corporation and the Basque Research and Technology Alliance (BRTA). Business Expertise Thanks to a unique cooperation model, which combine technology transfer activities, internal research and training of highly qualified personnel, IKERLAN is currently the trusted technological partner of major company in the country. To meet our goal, we are structured into two technological specialization units: ELECTRONICS, INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGIES ENERGY AND MECHATRONICS IKERLAN is a center that is dynamic and open to the world. We are an accredited agent of the Basque Network of Science, Technology, and Innovation and of the Spanish Federation of Technology Centres. We have a major cooperation network integrated with renowned European center and universities, with which we conduct activity of research and training of researchers. Technical Expertise Mission: To solve the technological challenge of the companies, improve their competitiveness and collaborate with the sustainable social and economic development of the environment, all of that from a position of technological leadership and with differential ability in their area of expertise. Vission: Technological center, cooperative and non-profit, known a the European leader in it area of specialization, with an exceptional cohesive human team, that provides value to the company and society. Contact Details Santiago Charramendieta Website Increased visibility of order delivery process VTT | Wrtsil | Uwira CHALLENGE: The use case revolves around expediting and enhancing transparency between a focal company of a manufacturing ecosystem (OEM) and it supplier in their production order management processes. The existing communication method have proven inadequate in facilitating efficient and adaptable exchange between the two entities. By facilitating transparency and fostering a more seamless integration between the IT system of both companies, the management of product order can be streamlined, resulting in heightened efficiency and a reduction in errors. SUCCESS: The objective is to facilitate a reliable and seamless flow of data between the OEM and it supplier by establishing a dedicated data space. The developed solution will be seamlessly integrated with pre-existing IT infrastructure of both company and the solution is grounded in the framework of the IDS reference architecture. The OEM can selectively disclose data from their production environment to the supplier without the fear of data leakages. Respectively, the supplier receives only the data that are essential for them and there is no need to locally extract meaningful insight and valuable information from big data sets. BENEFITS: The established data space solution ha the potential to significantly enhance transparency between the OEM and the supplier. This give rise to several potential benefits, including: Effective Communication: Transparent communication help in conveying accurate information about product specifications, requirements, changes, and timelines. Risk Management: Sharing information about potential risks, such a change in demand or design modifications, allows supplier to proactively address these issues. Furthermore, in time of disruptions, such a supply shortage or unexpected market shifts, transparent communication help both party respond more effectively. Cost Efficiency: Transparent communication allows both party to work together to find cost-effective solutions. COMPONENTS: IDS connector - serve a the communication interface linking the two company and their existing IT systems. With IDS connectors, a data provider can define the rule and condition (usage policies) under which data are shared with a data consumer. DAPS - enables connector to authenticate themselves using X.509 certificates. After successful authentication, the DAPS issue OAuth2 access token for connectors, who need these token to access the service and data of other connectors. Metadata Broker store information about the data end-points offered by the participants. The broker provides a query interface for connector and can hence be considered a the search engine in this use case. LEARN MORE: The deep dive Explore position paper and strategy statement by our board member and affiliated researcher for a deeper understanding of our mission and goals. With this new reliable data space, we extend the lifecycle of artificial intelligence models, enhance their capabilities, and facilitate trusted access and use of it asset by EGOKIA participants. BENEFITS: NEW BUSINESS MODEL: A new business model based on AI service and a knowledge-based economy. RELIABLE AI SOLUTIONS: A "standardized", flexible, and secure solution to break data silo to share and complete AI asset and process between trusted organization and production plants. Measurable benefit can be listed as: Up to 30% quality on model thanks to the application of federated learning techniques, reduce inversion and time to market on IA-based solution or lower communication loads. STANDARIZED DATA SPACE The organization is ready to take part in the knowledge economy with other entities, domain experts, and technology providers. COMPONENTS: Data Space connector 8.0.2 Metada Broker 5.0.3 Identity Provider 1.6.0 Gaia-X4KI A sovereign data and service ecosystem for artificial intelligence in automotive development, production, and operation DLR | T-Systems | Capgemini Engineering | Continental | IAV | Intel | Conweaver | HighQSoft | Reuschlaw | STTech | Fraunhofer ITWM | Fraunhofer ISST | Hochschule Offenburg | Leibniz Universitt Hannover | Technische Hochschule Ingolstadt CHALLENGE: Autonomous driving scenario and the industrial production of required device face a broad range of challenge related to data sovereignty and security. In particular, transfer of large, sensitive file and service in a policy-conform way are addressed in the prototypes. SUCCESS: The solution are cloud-based and are embedded in existing industrial cloud landscape to enhance data sovereignty of participant in complex data exchange relations. BENEFITS: Gaia-X4KI connects various stakeholder and their diverse system landscape from the complete autonomous driving development lifecycle. COMPONENTS: Eclipse Dataspace Components (EDC) and EDC MVD including Connector, Federated Catalog, Identity Hub, Registration Service PREREQUISITES: The data space is currently in development and being tested inside the project. It base on open source components. LEARN MORE: Introduction IKERLAN is a leading knowledge transfer technological centre providing competitive value to companies. We seek for excellence in R&D&i, thanks to the continuous adaptation to the need of our customer and the proximity with the business reality. Faithful to our mission, we have been working daily since 1974 to develop solution that allow our customer to become more and more competitive. We are a cooperative member of the MONDRAGON Corporation and the Basque Research and Technology Alliance (BRTA). Business Expertise Thanks to a unique cooperation model, which combine technology transfer activities, internal research and training of highly qualified personnel, IKERLAN is currently the trusted technological partner of major company in the country. To meet our goal, we are structured into two technological specialization units: ELECTRONICS, INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGIES ENERGY AND MECHATRONICS IKERLAN is a center that is dynamic and open to the world. We are an accredited agent of the Basque Network of Science, Technology, and Innovation and of the Spanish Federation of Technology Centres. We have a major cooperation network integrated with renowned European center and universities, with which we conduct activity of research and training of researchers. Technical Expertise Mission: To solve the technological challenge of the companies, improve their competitiveness and collaborate with the sustainable social and economic development of the environment, all of that from a position of technological leadership and with differential ability in their area of expertise. Vission: Technological center, cooperative and non-profit, known a the European leader in it area of specialization, with an exceptional cohesive human team, that provides value to the company and society. Contact Details Santiago Charramendieta Website Increased visibility of order delivery process VTT | Wrtsil | Uwira CHALLENGE: The use case revolves around expediting and enhancing transparency between a focal company of a manufacturing ecosystem (OEM) and it supplier in their production order management processes. The existing communication method have proven inadequate in facilitating efficient and adaptable exchange between the two entities. By facilitating transparency and fostering a more seamless integration between the IT system of both companies, the management of product order can be streamlined, resulting in heightened efficiency and a reduction in errors. SUCCESS: The objective is to facilitate a reliable and seamless flow of data between the OEM and it supplier by establishing a dedicated data space. The developed solution will be seamlessly integrated with pre-existing IT infrastructure of both company and the solution is grounded in the framework of the IDS reference architecture. The OEM can selectively disclose data from their production environment to the supplier without the fear of data leakages. Respectively, the supplier receives only the data that are essential for them and there is no need to locally extract meaningful insight and valuable information from big data sets. BENEFITS: The established data space solution ha the potential to significantly enhance transparency between the OEM and the supplier. This give rise to several potential benefits, including: Effective Communication: Transparent communication help in conveying accurate information about product specifications, requirements, changes, and timelines. Risk Management: Sharing information about potential risks, such a change in demand or design modifications, allows supplier to proactively address these issues. Furthermore, in time of disruptions, such a supply shortage or unexpected market shifts, transparent communication help both party respond more effectively. Cost Efficiency: Transparent communication allows both party to work together to find cost-effective solutions. COMPONENTS: IDS connector - serve a the communication interface linking the two company and their existing IT systems. With IDS connectors, a data provider can define the rule and condition (usage policies) under which data are shared with a data consumer. DAPS - enables connector to authenticate themselves using X.509 certificates. After successful authentication, the DAPS issue OAuth2 access token for connectors, who need these token to access the service and data of other connectors. Metadata Broker store information about the data end-points offered by the participants. The broker provides a query interface for connector and can hence be considered a the search engine in this use case. LEARN MORE: Connect Learn about IDS, interact with others, co-create the standard IDS is poised to become the backbone of our future data economy, indispensable to any enterprise that collects, manages, or share any kind of data. Our vision depends on data space which comprise relationship between trusted partners. IDS is a global standard to build data space and ensure data sovereignty. Click image to discover! Creating data space is a complex endeavor and it cant be done without collaboration. Thats why IDSA is all about teamwork. We share knowledge and experience. We work together on new concepts. We build bridge between research and business. No matter where you are on your journey to data spaces, we have the input you need to make it happen. a Learn & follow To make the IDS standard a reality and to design and develop it according to business needs, you need to gather knowledge and find your role. Get a better understanding of the core idea of IDS and find out if your company need an IDS solution or want to help others create data spaces. Read our most important document Youll find all themostmission-critical document and other information about IDSAs work and partner projectshere. IDS Reference Architecture Model Version 4 | 2022 IDSA Rule Book White Paper 2020 | Version 1.0 Data Connector Report No. 14 | April 2024 IDSA overview brochure March 2024 The Data Spaces Radar Version 4 | March 2024 Navigate through the IDSA knowledge base Do you want to develop IDS components? Or are you looking to implement the open-source component that someone else ha developed? The knowledge base is the place to start. Weve laid out five step to help you sift through the vast amount of information and documentation. Each step includes link to important resource that are helpful in setting up data spaces. By loading the video, you agree to YouTube's privacy policy. Always unblock YouTube Collaborate in our GitHub repository The open-source community is one of the cornerstone of IDSA. Every data space requires specification that detail how the component of the software architecture can be implemented. These specification are under constant development in our GitHub repositories. IDS-G In addition to the reference architecture model, the DS-G repository provides specification for IDS components. IDS-Testbed The IDS Reference Testbed is a setup of IDS component that ha been developed by the IDS open-source community. Information Model The information model is an otology that cover the basic concept of IDS IDS-RAM The IDS-RAM provides an overview of the concepts, function and process for creating a data space. Stay tuned Keep up-to-date with the future of data space and the data economy by checking out our blog and news articles. And visit our event an exclusive platform for dialogue, exchange, and networking with members, decision-makers, and experts. No Events Data Space Radar More than two year back, the International Data Spaces Association (IDSA) introduced the groundbreaking Data Spaces Radar, a tool that swiftly gained acclaim and found it place within the dynamic landscape of data spaces. We are excited to unveil the evolution of this pioneering asset the newly enhanced Data Spaces Radar. The Data Spaces Radar serf a the central repository for all data space endeavors. It is an accessible tool designed to provide a comprehensive view of various data space initiative worldwide. Explore the Data Space Radar Offering insight into the 18 different sectors, global expansion, technical transparency and new stage of development of the data space featured in the radar. Share your expertise Get support in implementing and launching IDS-based product and services, and disseminate the IDS standard for data sovereignty and data ecosystem in Europe and beyond. Become an IDSA Hub, Competence Center or Lab The IDSA ha inspired a strong network of international hubs, competence center and lab that share knowledge and information about IDS in country around the world. Become an implementation partner IDSA work together with many different organization who serve a implementation partners, ready to help along the adoption journey. Co-create To be successful in creating truly global, cross-industry data spaces, IDSA need the involvement of company of all size and sectors. This mean you! We hope youll consider joining the effort to drive the data economy of the future. See for yourself why and how to embrace data sovereignty and implement IDS technology into product and systems. Become a member of IDSA IDS is essential for any company that collects, manages and share data. All type and size of organization can reap the reward of gaining insight and access to IDS idea and technology, which can have a direct impact on advancing their business. Advantages of membership include: Co-create the IDS standard, the governance framework and the certificaton scheme by participating in our working groups. Gain access to a diverse and experienced network that span across various industry and get involved in our wide varierty of events. Offer and receive support for implementing and adopting IDS-based product and services. Join the data space pioneer IDSA membership brochure | March 2024 Below youll find all the information and form needed to apply for membership. Or contact u with any questions. IDSA Membership Application Form Download, PDF IDSA Statutes Download, PDF IDSA Rules for Participation Download, PDF IDSA Membership Fee Regulations Download, PDF Shape IDS in our working group Our working group are IDSA member collaborating on the standard and characteristic for international data spaces. Join u and become an active participant in our working groups. Join IDSA to drive change in sovereign data sharing! Working Group Architecture The Working Group Architecture establishes the IDSs general framework and the IDS Reference Architecture Model (IDS-RAM). It is also responsible for the standardization of the main software component and for the incorporation of existing standard and related initiatives. a Working Group Certification The Working Group Certification develops certification requirement and strategies. It creates and maintains the IDSA certification process a an important aspect of building trust among participant in data spaces. This includes certifying operational environment and core components, defining role and developing evaluation method used during certification. a Working Group Rule Book The Working Group Rule Book creates and maintains rule for the common interplay in data spaces. These rule are written down in the IDSA Rule Book, which cover all aspect relevant for ensuring secure, fair and trustworthy cross-organizational data sharing both within sector-specific data space and across data space of different industries. a Working Group Training The IDSA Working Group Training is dedicated to establishing and upholding a professional accreditation program that aligns closely with the goal of IDSA and caters to the specific requirement within the IDS framework. Its core objective is to create a robust training initiative that disseminates knowledge and skill effectively, promoting comprehensive understanding and proficient implementation of IDS principles. Task Force Legal Framework The aim of the TF Legal Framework is to provide tangible answer to the question that we all have in the legal aspect of data sharing, such a IP, ethics, data sharing contracts, or usage control. The Task Force meet for 4 workshop per year to discus existing challenge and possible solution to them. a Task Force China The Task Force China isa group of professional aiming to promote data space and position them a a de-facto standard for secure and trusted data sharing in China and the world. Our primary purpose is to develop technology and define the existing mechanism through which IDS handle situation involving industrial and cross-border data sharing in China. Test your component Unlock the full potential of International Data Spaces by ensuring seamless interaction among all components. Join the Integration Test Camp and the IDS Plugfest to showcase your IDS components, gain expert support, and exchange innovative ideas. IDS Plugfest Are you an DevOps engineer looking to showcase your IDS component and gain expert support? Interact with experts, share ideas, and troubleshoot issue at the IDS Plugfest. Integration Test Camp Discover the potential of your pre-commercial IDSA components! With the Integration Test Camp, developer can test the interoperability of their components. Any questions? Contact us! To be successful in creating truly global, cross-industry data ecosystem in which anyone can participate, IDSA need the involvement of company of all size and sectors. This mean you! We hope youll consider joining the effort to drive the data economy of the future. become a member Benefit from all current developments: Become a member of the International Data Spaces Association now! Read IDS-Ram Rule Book Design Principles All White Papers All Position Papers GitHub Repositories idsa This is the main repository of International Data Spaces Association on GitHub, where you can find general overview and useful information on IDS Landscape. IDS-G IDS-G InformationModel The Information Model of the International Data Spaces implement the IDS reference architecture a an extensible, machine readable and technology independent data model. IDSA Knowledge Base IDS Knowledge Base The Knowledge Base is the store of information that relies on IDS expertise, that is meant to support building IDS component and contribute to the existing open source components. Events IDSA Events & Live Sessions IDSA Events & Live Sessions Share, like and comment... Working Group Architecture The Working Group Architecture is essential in establishing and standardizing the IDS framework and components. Its activity involve modifying the IDS-RAM to enable cross-industry deployment, verifying it foundational elements, and standardizing IDS components. Additionally, the group incubates the IDSA Developers Community, promoting the maturity and acceptance of IDSA architecture and technologies. Meetings are held quarterly by the working group. Activities Modification of the IDS-RAM to enable IDS to be deployed across industries. Verification of the various element of the IDS-RAM a the foundation for the IDS ecosystem. Standardization of IDS component Who should attend? Experts in IT architecture development and analysis Colleagues who are familiar with their organization's IT infrastructure, software and system Experts in software, application or other component development Working Group Certification The Working Group Certification develops certification requirement and strategies. It creates and maintains the IDSA certification process a an important aspect of building trust among participant in data spaces. This includes certifying operational environment and core components, defining role and developing evaluation method used during certification. The working group hold quarterly meeting and is suitable for expert in certification processes, colleague with knowledge about certification activity in their company, and colleague interested in International Data Spaces certification. Working Group Rule Book The IDSA Rule Book establishes and upholds regulation for data sharing among various industry and sectors. It encompasses all relevant aspect that guarantee secure, fair, and trustworthy cross-organizational data sharing in sector-specific data space and across different industries. Be a part of our latest Working Group and help advance the Rule Book, one of IDSA's most vital resources. The Working Group convenes on the first Tuesday of each month. Task Force Legal Framework The aim of the TF Legal Framework is to provide tangible answer to the question that we all have in the legal aspect of data sharing, such a IP, ethics, data sharing contracts, or usage control. The Task Force meet for 4 workshop per year to discus existing challenge and possible solution to them. Who should join? (data analytics and ai services) | INGETEAM, S.A.(energy) | GOIZPER S.COOP. (machine-tool industry) | MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY S.COOP. (manufacturing) | UBIKARE ZAINKETAK, S.L. (healthcare) | EROSKI S.COOP (retail) | The technology coordinator is IKERLAN (a leading knowledge transfer center providing competitive value to companies) SUCCESS: Seeks to promote and research the necessary technology for the definition of a reference architecture, operational models, adoption of standard and development for a data space based on the common technical framework proposed by DSBA members, extending it main service to favor the development of artificial intelligence with guarantee of traceability, security, and governance of the data and services. BENEFITS: Aims to provide the country with a reliable data space that enables company to offer new concept of high-added value service based on data sharing, through the servitization of collaborative artificial intelligence for the productization and monetization of their data and industry knowledge in new business models. COMPONENTS: Will develop new service in the field of artificial intelligence and will explore current IDS component implementation (focusing on Connectors, Metadatabroker, and IdentityProviders) in order to select one of them to rely on. LEARN MORE: MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY EGOKIA MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY - an international firm specializing in the development of automatization and assembly solution for various sectors. It operates 6 production plant around the world and is part of the largest cooperative group in the world | IKERLAN Technical research center and member of IDSA CHALLENGE: EGOKIA solution allows collaborative learning and knowledge sharing between geographically distributed plants, integrating headquarters in Basque Country and domain experts. Thanks to the data space, data, and AI asset can be securely shared throughout different corporate site and a new knowledge-based economy emerges. SUCCESS: Deploys an architecture based on IDSA connectors, linking Mondragon Assemblys data and AI platform from different corporate sites. With this new reliable data space, we extend the lifecycle of artificial intelligence models, enhance their capabilities, and facilitate trusted access and use of it asset by EGOKIA participants. BENEFITS: NEW BUSINESS MODEL: A new business model based on AI service and a knowledge-based economy. RELIABLE AI SOLUTIONS: A "standardized", flexible, and secure solution to break data silo to share and complete AI asset and process between trusted organization and production plants. Measurable benefit can be listed as: Up to 30% quality on model thanks to the application of federated learning techniques, reduce inversion and time to market on IA-based solution or lower communication loads. LEARN MORE: Fairs & Events May 13, 2024 IDSA Ecosystem Building Call | Open Month IDSA warmly invite you to it Ecosystem Building Call Open Month. The Ecosystem Building Call is a weekly touchpoint that is firmly established in the calendar of all IDSA member every Monday from 9:00 to 10:00 CET. There, they catch up on the latest development and the adoption of data spaces; member themselves report on activity and achievements; IDSA provides exclusive report on development at a global level. On the following Mondays, we will open this valuable touchpoint and give everyone the opportunity to experience what it is like to be part of such a vibrant ecosystem, access exclusive content and knowledge and take their first step into becoming a data space pioneer: Monday, May 6 | Data space a key enabler to unlock the power of the data economy: Overview of IDSAs vision and asset to support the design and management of data space | Christoph Mertens, IDSA Microsofts experience with data space and contribution to the IDSA activity | Eric Samson, Microsoft Monday, May 13 | The importance of reference a a common ground to design data spaces: Ingredients needed to make a data space successful: IDS Reference Architecture and IDSA Rulebook BAIDATA: The Spanish data space think tank share it experience and present a new data space use case Monday, May 27 | The next level of interoperability for data spaces: Controlling data flow, enabling interoperability: the Dataspace Protocol Boot-X: band-new cross-border data sharing platform Monday, June 3 | From theory to practice how IDS asset are implemented: Keeping the overview, learning from the best: the Data Spaces Radar Making the standard a real standard: global standardization activity at IDSA Huge telco set up cross-continent connection of data space Would you like to join us? Please register here so that we can send you the access to the open Ecosystem Building Calls: Please check this website regularly. The developed solution will be seamlessly integrated with pre-existing IT infrastructure of both company and the solution is grounded in the framework of the IDS reference architecture. The OEM can selectively disclose data from their production environment to the supplier without the fear of data leakages. Respectively, the supplier receives only the data that are essential for them and there is no need to locally extract meaningful insight and valuable information from big data sets. BENEFITS: The established data space solution ha the potential to significantly enhance transparency between the OEM and the supplier. This give rise to several potential benefits, including: Effective Communication: Transparent communication help in conveying accurate information about product specifications, requirements, changes, and timelines. Risk Management: Sharing information about potential risks, such a change in demand or design modifications, allows supplier to proactively address these issues. Furthermore, in time of disruptions, such a supply shortage or unexpected market shifts, transparent communication help both party respond more effectively. Cost Efficiency: Transparent communication allows both party to work together to find cost-effective solutions. COMPONENTS: IDS connector - serve a the communication interface linking the two company and their existing IT systems. With IDS connectors, a data provider can define the rule and condition (usage policies) under which data are shared with a data consumer. DAPS - enables connector to authenticate themselves using X.509 certificates. After successful authentication, the DAPS issue OAuth2 access token for connectors, who need these token to access the service and data of other connectors. Metadata Broker store information about the data end-points offered by the participants. The broker provides a query interface for connector and can hence be considered a the search engine in this use case. LEARN MORE: International Data Spaces Association and Catena-X strengthen partnership Apr 30, 2024 | Since last year signing of a memorandum of understanding (MoU), the International Data Spaces Association (IDSA) and Catena-X Automotive Network e.V. have announced an expanded partnership. This partnership strengthens their role in advancing data space component and sovereign data sharing, a well a in innovating the automotive industry. Lars Nagel, CEO of IDSA, and Michael Hahn, Managing Director at Catena-X, solidified their commitment to collaboration at Hannover Messe, highlighting their shared dedication to complementing each others role in enabling sovereign and trustworthy data sharing. By deepening our cooperation, Catena-X and IDSA aim to drive further advancement in data sharing, promoting meaningful change and facilitating a more connected and trustworthy digital landscape. Lars Nagel, CEO of IDSA Lars Nagel, CEO of IDSA The Catena-X automotive network is the world first open and interoperable data space for the automotive industry. On an international level, it connects car manufacturers, suppliers, and service provider along the entire supply chain. Within a defined governance framework, standard developed by IDSA guarantee secure data sharing between participant while supporting trust and data sovereignty. Using the fundamental standard for data ecosystem developed by IDSA allows u to focus on the specific need of the automotive industry. In addition, the interoperability of data space is becoming increasingly important a our member are often integrated into different value chains. And we are also working with IDSA on the necessary standard for this interoperability. Michael Hahn, MD of Catena-X As participant in the , IDSA and Catena-X have cooperated to promote the development of IDS-compliant data space components, enhancing trust and security in data sharing. Both organization plan to align their training and certification programs. Catena-X will maintain it focus on industry-specific standards, catering to the automotive sector, while IDSA will continue advancing technical aspect of data space across various industries. The partner will strive to promote the adoption of IDS technology, which encompasses the Dataspace Protocol. The collaboration between IDSA and Catena-X represents a significant advance in trustful data sharing, fostering innovation within the automotive industry and beyond. (healthcare) | EROSKI S.COOP (retail) | The technology coordinator is IKERLAN (a leading knowledge transfer center providing competitive value to companies) SUCCESS: Seeks to promote and research the necessary technology for the definition of a reference architecture, operational models, adoption of standard and development for a data space based on the common technical framework proposed by DSBA members, extending it main service to favor the development of artificial intelligence with guarantee of traceability, security, and governance of the data and services. BENEFITS: Aims to provide the country with a reliable data space that enables company to offer new concept of high-added value service based on data sharing, through the servitization of collaborative artificial intelligence for the productization and monetization of their data and industry knowledge in new business models. COMPONENTS: Will develop new service in the field of artificial intelligence and will explore current IDS component implementation (focusing on Connectors, Metadatabroker, and IdentityProviders) in order to select one of them to rely on. LEARN MORE: MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY EGOKIA MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY - an international firm specializing in the development of automatization and assembly solution for various sectors. It operates 6 production plant around the world and is part of the largest cooperative group in the world | IKERLAN Technical research center and member of IDSA CHALLENGE: EGOKIA solution allows collaborative learning and knowledge sharing between geographically distributed plants, integrating headquarters in Basque Country and domain experts. Thanks to the data space, data, and AI asset can be securely shared throughout different corporate site and a new knowledge-based economy emerges. SUCCESS: Deploys an architecture based on IDSA connectors, linking Mondragon Assemblys data and AI platform from different corporate sites. With this new reliable data space, we extend the lifecycle of artificial intelligence models, enhance their capabilities, and facilitate trusted access and use of it asset by EGOKIA participants. BENEFITS: NEW BUSINESS MODEL: A new business model based on AI service and a knowledge-based economy. RELIABLE AI SOLUTIONS: A "standardized", flexible, and secure solution to break data silo to share and complete AI asset and process between trusted organization and production plants. Measurable benefit can be listed as: Up to 30% quality on model thanks to the application of federated learning techniques, reduce inversion and time to market on IA-based solution or lower communication loads. STANDARIZED DATA SPACE The organization is ready to take part in the knowledge economy with other entities, domain experts, and technology providers. COMPONENTS: Data Space connector 8.0.2 Metada Broker 5.0.3 Identity Provider 1.6.0 Gaia-X4KI A sovereign data and service ecosystem for artificial intelligence in automotive development, production, and operation DLR | T-Systems | Capgemini Engineering | Continental | IAV | Intel | Conweaver | HighQSoft | Reuschlaw | STTech | Fraunhofer ITWM | Fraunhofer ISST | Hochschule Offenburg | Leibniz Universitt Hannover | Technische Hochschule Ingolstadt CHALLENGE: Autonomous driving scenario and the industrial production of required device face a broad range of challenge related to data sovereignty and security. In particular, transfer of large, sensitive file and service in a policy-conform way are addressed in the prototypes. SUCCESS: The solution are cloud-based and are embedded in existing industrial cloud landscape to enhance data sovereignty of participant in complex data exchange relations. BENEFITS: Gaia-X4KI connects various stakeholder and their diverse system landscape from the complete autonomous driving development lifecycle. COMPONENTS: Eclipse Dataspace Components (EDC) and EDC MVD including Connector, Federated Catalog, Identity Hub, Registration Service PREREQUISITES: The data space is currently in development and being tested inside the project. It base on open source components. LEARN MORE: Introduction IKERLAN is a leading knowledge transfer technological centre providing competitive value to companies. We seek for excellence in R&D&i, thanks to the continuous adaptation to the need of our customer and the proximity with the business reality. Faithful to our mission, we have been working daily since 1974 to develop solution that allow our customer to become more and more competitive. We are a cooperative member of the MONDRAGON Corporation and the Basque Research and Technology Alliance (BRTA). Business Expertise Thanks to a unique cooperation model, which combine technology transfer activities, internal research and training of highly qualified personnel, IKERLAN is currently the trusted technological partner of major company in the country. To meet our goal, we are structured into two technological specialization units: ELECTRONICS, INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGIES ENERGY AND MECHATRONICS IKERLAN is a center that is dynamic and open to the world. We are an accredited agent of the Basque Network of Science, Technology, and Innovation and of the Spanish Federation of Technology Centres. We have a major cooperation network integrated with renowned European center and universities, with which we conduct activity of research and training of researchers. Technical Expertise Mission: To solve the technological challenge of the companies, improve their competitiveness and collaborate with the sustainable social and economic development of the environment, all of that from a position of technological leadership and with differential ability in their area of expertise. Vission: Technological center, cooperative and non-profit, known a the European leader in it area of specialization, with an exceptional cohesive human team, that provides value to the company and society. Contact Details Santiago Charramendieta Website Increased visibility of order delivery process VTT | Wrtsil | Uwira CHALLENGE: The use case revolves around expediting and enhancing transparency between a focal company of a manufacturing ecosystem (OEM) and it supplier in their production order management processes. The existing communication method have proven inadequate in facilitating efficient and adaptable exchange between the two entities. By facilitating transparency and fostering a more seamless integration between the IT system of both companies, the management of product order can be streamlined, resulting in heightened efficiency and a reduction in errors. SUCCESS: The objective is to facilitate a reliable and seamless flow of data between the OEM and it supplier by establishing a dedicated data space. The developed solution will be seamlessly integrated with pre-existing IT infrastructure of both company and the solution is grounded in the framework of the IDS reference architecture. The OEM can selectively disclose data from their production environment to the supplier without the fear of data leakages. Respectively, the supplier receives only the data that are essential for them and there is no need to locally extract meaningful insight and valuable information from big data sets. BENEFITS: The established data space solution ha the potential to significantly enhance transparency between the OEM and the supplier. This give rise to several potential benefits, including: Effective Communication: Transparent communication help in conveying accurate information about product specifications, requirements, changes, and timelines. Risk Management: Sharing information about potential risks, such a change in demand or design modifications, allows supplier to proactively address these issues. Furthermore, in time of disruptions, such a supply shortage or unexpected market shifts, transparent communication help both party respond more effectively. Cost Efficiency: Transparent communication allows both party to work together to find cost-effective solutions. COMPONENTS: IDS connector - serve a the communication interface linking the two company and their existing IT systems. With IDS connectors, a data provider can define the rule and condition (usage policies) under which data are shared with a data consumer. DAPS - enables connector to authenticate themselves using X.509 certificates. After successful authentication, the DAPS issue OAuth2 access token for connectors, who need these token to access the service and data of other connectors. Metadata Broker store information about the data end-points offered by the participants. The broker provides a query interface for connector and can hence be considered a the search engine in this use case. LEARN MORE: April 5, 2024 Advancing global interoperability: The role of standardization in data space We've reached a critical moment in the journey of IDS, where standardization is no longer just a choice; it's a must-have. Just like USB, HTML, Wi-Fi, or electrical plug sockets, standard form the backbone of global interoperability and trade. This hold true for communication within and between data space a well. Silvia Castellvi International standard are indispensable in facilitating collaboration. They play a critical role in promoting interoperability, breaking down technical barriers, and fostering cross-border trade. Adhering to these common standard enables business to streamline their operations, tap into global markets, and provide top-notch product and service to consumers. Recognizing the importance of aligning with standardization body like ISO, CEN/CENELEC, IEEE and W3C, we are committed to advancing global standard for data sharing. Our drive for global standardization Our commitment is driven by the dedicated effort of IDSA member and technical staff who actively participate in standard committees. From observing to leading these committees, we build strategic partnership with key standardization bodies, advising the European Commission on advancing global standard for data spaces. Leveraging asset such a the IDS Reference Architecture Model (IDS RAM), the IDS Rulebook, and the Dataspace Protocol, we contribute to developing essential technical specification for implementing data spaces. European standardization initiative Within the European context, regulation like the Digital Markets Act (DMA), Data Governance Act (DGA), Data Act and AI Act emphasize the need for tailored standardization efforts. Collaborative research with CEN/CENELEC is important in addressing these specific standardization need and strengthening Europes digital economy. Initiatives like the CEN/CENELEC Focus Group on Data, Dataspaces, Cloud, and Edge and the proposed Technical Committee on Data Management, Data Spaces, Cloud, and Edge Computing are instrumental in shaping European standardization policies. Collaboration with the European Commission The IDSA collaborates closely with the European Commission to align standardization effort with EU policy priorities. The Data Spaces Support Centre (DSSC) collaborates with the European Data Innovation Board to recommend guideline for unified European data spaces. By enhancing data interoperability and ensuring compliance with data protection regulations, these effort contribute significantly to the EUs digital transformation agenda. Our collective commitment to driving global standardization in data space pave the way for a more connected, efficient, and innovative future for business and society worldwide. Author: Silvia Castellvi Silvia Castellvi is Director Research & Standardization at IDSA Stay updated with u Advancing global interoperability: The role of standardization in data space Stay updated with u Share this page: International Data Spaces e. (data analytics and ai services) | INGETEAM, S.A.(energy) | GOIZPER S.COOP. (machine-tool industry) | MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY S.COOP. (manufacturing) | UBIKARE ZAINKETAK, S.L. (healthcare) | EROSKI S.COOP (retail) | The technology coordinator is IKERLAN (a leading knowledge transfer center providing competitive value to companies) SUCCESS: Seeks to promote and research the necessary technology for the definition of a reference architecture, operational models, adoption of standard and development for a data space based on the common technical framework proposed by DSBA members, extending it main service to favor the development of artificial intelligence with guarantee of traceability, security, and governance of the data and services. BENEFITS: Aims to provide the country with a reliable data space that enables company to offer new concept of high-added value service based on data sharing, through the servitization of collaborative artificial intelligence for the productization and monetization of their data and industry knowledge in new business models. COMPONENTS: Will develop new service in the field of artificial intelligence and will explore current IDS component implementation (focusing on Connectors, Metadatabroker, and IdentityProviders) in order to select one of them to rely on. LEARN MORE: MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY EGOKIA MONDRAGON ASSEMBLY - an international firm specializing in the development of automatization and assembly solution for various sectors. It operates 6 production plant around the world and is part of the largest cooperative group in the world | IKERLAN Technical research center and member of IDSA CHALLENGE: EGOKIA solution allows collaborative learning and knowledge sharing between geographically distributed plants, integrating headquarters in Basque Country and domain experts. Thanks to the data space, data, and AI asset can be securely shared throughout different corporate site and a new knowledge-based economy emerges. SUCCESS: Deploys an architecture based on IDSA connectors, linking Mondragon Assemblys data and AI platform from different corporate sites. With this new reliable data space, we extend the lifecycle of artificial intelligence models, enhance their capabilities, and facilitate trusted access and use of it asset by EGOKIA participants. BENEFITS: NEW BUSINESS MODEL: A new business model based on AI service and a knowledge-based economy. RELIABLE AI SOLUTIONS: A "standardized", flexible, and secure solution to break data silo to share and complete AI asset and process between trusted organization and production plants. Measurable benefit can be listed as: Up to 30% quality on model thanks to the application of federated learning techniques, reduce inversion and time to market on IA-based solution or lower communication loads. STANDARIZED DATA SPACE The organization is ready to take part in the knowledge economy with other entities, domain experts, and technology providers. COMPONENTS: Data Space connector 8.0.2 Metada Broker 5.0.3 Identity Provider 1.6.0 Gaia-X4KI A sovereign data and service ecosystem for artificial intelligence in automotive development, production, and operation DLR | T-Systems | Capgemini Engineering | Continental | IAV | Intel | Conweaver | HighQSoft | Reuschlaw | STTech | Fraunhofer ITWM | Fraunhofer ISST | Hochschule Offenburg | Leibniz Universitt Hannover | Technische Hochschule Ingolstadt CHALLENGE: Autonomous driving scenario and the industrial production of required device face a broad range of challenge related to data sovereignty and security. In particular, transfer of large, sensitive file and service in a policy-conform way are addressed in the prototypes. SUCCESS: The solution are cloud-based and are embedded in existing industrial cloud landscape to enhance data sovereignty of participant in complex data exchange relations. BENEFITS: Gaia-X4KI connects various stakeholder and their diverse system landscape from the complete autonomous driving development lifecycle. COMPONENTS: Eclipse Dataspace Components (EDC) and EDC MVD including Connector, Federated Catalog, Identity Hub, Registration Service PREREQUISITES: The data space is currently in development and being tested inside the project. It base on open source components. LEARN MORE: Introduction IKERLAN is a leading knowledge transfer technological centre providing competitive value to companies. We seek for excellence in R&D&i, thanks to the continuous adaptation to the need of our customer and the proximity with the business reality. Faithful to our mission, we have been working daily since 1974 to develop solution that allow our customer to become more and more competitive. We are a cooperative member of the MONDRAGON Corporation and the Basque Research and Technology Alliance (BRTA). Business Expertise Thanks to a unique cooperation model, which combine technology transfer activities, internal research and training of highly qualified personnel, IKERLAN is currently the trusted technological partner of major company in the country. To meet our goal, we are structured into two technological specialization units: ELECTRONICS, INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGIES ENERGY AND MECHATRONICS IKERLAN is a center that is dynamic and open to the world. We are an accredited agent of the Basque Network of Science, Technology, and Innovation and of the Spanish Federation of Technology Centres. We have a major cooperation network integrated with renowned European center and universities, with which we conduct activity of research and training of researchers. Technical Expertise Mission: To solve the technological challenge of the companies, improve their competitiveness and collaborate with the sustainable social and economic development of the environment, all of that from a position of technological leadership and with differential ability in their area of expertise. Vission: Technological center, cooperative and non-profit, known a the European leader in it area of specialization, with an exceptional cohesive human team, that provides value to the company and society. Contact Details Santiago Charramendieta Website Increased visibility of order delivery process VTT | Wrtsil | Uwira CHALLENGE: The use case revolves around expediting and enhancing transparency between a focal company of a manufacturing ecosystem (OEM) and it supplier in their production order management processes. The existing communication method have proven inadequate in facilitating efficient and adaptable exchange between the two entities. By facilitating transparency and fostering a more seamless integration between the IT system of both companies, the management of product order can be streamlined, resulting in heightened efficiency and a reduction in errors. SUCCESS: The objective is to facilitate a reliable and seamless flow of data between the OEM and it supplier by establishing a dedicated data space. The developed solution will be seamlessly integrated with pre-existing IT infrastructure of both company and the solution is grounded in the framework of the IDS reference architecture. The OEM can selectively disclose data from their production environment to the supplier without the fear of data leakages. Respectively, the supplier receives only the data that are essential for them and there is no need to locally extract meaningful insight and valuable information from big data sets. BENEFITS: The established data space solution ha the potential to significantly enhance transparency between the OEM and the supplier. This give rise to several potential benefits, including: Effective Communication: Transparent communication help in conveying accurate information about product specifications, requirements, changes, and timelines. Risk Management: Sharing information about potential risks, such a change in demand or design modifications, allows supplier to proactively address these issues. Furthermore, in time of disruptions, such a supply shortage or unexpected market shifts, transparent communication help both party respond more effectively. Cost Efficiency: Transparent communication allows both party to work together to find cost-effective solutions. COMPONENTS: IDS connector - serve a the communication interface linking the two company and their existing IT systems. With IDS connectors, a data provider can define the rule and condition (usage policies) under which data are shared with a data consumer. DAPS - enables connector to authenticate themselves using X.509 certificates. After successful authentication, the DAPS issue OAuth2 access token for connectors, who need these token to access the service and data of other connectors. Metadata Broker store information about the data end-points offered by the participants. The broker provides a query interface for connector and can hence be considered a the search engine in this use case. LEARN MORE: IDSA Working Group MEETINGS June 18, 2024 2nd Meeting of the Working Group Architecture 2024 The IDSA Working Group Architecture aim to develop a business, security, data & service and software architecture for data spaces. It is also responsible for standardizing the main software component of this architecture: the IDS Connector. The group is incubating the IDSA Developers Community to help IDSA architecture and technology mature and foster their acceptance. The IDSA Working Group Architecture meet quarterly. Meetings usually take place on-site with remote participation. IDSA working group are reserved for members. Please contact the to receive an invitation to the meeting. Is your company or organization not a member of IDSA? In particular, transfer of large, sensitive file and service in a policy-conform way are addressed in the prototypes. SUCCESS: The solution are cloud-based and are embedded in existing industrial cloud landscape to enhance data sovereignty of participant in complex data exchange relations. Business Expertise Thanks to a unique cooperation model, which combine technology transfer activities, internal research and training of highly qualified personnel, IKERLAN is currently the trusted technological partner of major company in the country. To meet our goal, we are structured into two technological specialization units: ELECTRONICS, INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGIES ENERGY AND MECHATRONICS IKERLAN is a center that is dynamic and open to the world. We are an accredited agent of the Basque Network of Science, Technology, and Innovation and of the Spanish Federation of Technology Centres. We have a major cooperation network integrated with renowned European center and universities, with which we conduct activity of research and training of researchers. Vission: Technological center, cooperative and non-profit, known a the European leader in it area of specialization, with an exceptional cohesive human team, that provides value to the company and society. LEARN MORE: IDSA Working Group MEETINGS June 19, 2024 2nd Meeting of the Working Group Certification 2024 Activities of the IDSA Working Group Certification The Working Group Certification develops certification requirement and strategies. It creates and maintains the IDSA certification process a an important aspect of building trust among participant in data spaces. This includes certifying operational environment and core components, defining role and developing evaluation method used during certification. The IDSA Working Group Certification meet quarterly. Meetings usually take place on-site with remote participation. IDSA working group are reserved for members. Please contact the to receive an invitation to the meeting. Is your company or organization not a member of IDSA? LEARN MORE: IDSA Working Group MEETINGS June 20, 2024 2nd meeting of the Working Group Training 2024 The IDSA Working Group Training is dedicated to establishing and upholding a professional certification program that aligns closely with the goal of IDSA and caters to the specific requirement within the IDS framework. Its core objective is to create a robust training initiative that disseminates knowledge and skill effectively, promoting comprehensive understanding and proficient implementation of IDS principles. The IDSA Working Group Training meet quarterly. Meetings usually take place on-site with remote participation. IDSA working group are reserved for members. Please contact the to receive an invitation to the meeting. Is your company or organization not a member of IDSA?
